The main board represnts a virtual city and is segmented into 3 areas: Center, Suburbs and Hinterland.
Different areas have different customers... and different customers need different goods.
(user summary from original booklet)

83404.description:
This is the first expansion for Hansa Teutonica. This expansion includes nine mission cards for the basic map. Each mission card shows three cities and the player can receive additional victory points for Kontors in these cities.

In addition the expansion includes a new map: The East-Expansion
This map introduces new items into the game: e.g. Ocean trade routes and permanent bonus markers.

Errata: The rules erroneously mentions the 'Kontor Network', points being given when building the East/West-connection between 'Leipzig' and 'Danzig'. There is no 'Leipzig' on the map. Instead the rules should have stated the city of 'Lübeck'.
83404.name: Hansa Teutonica: Die Ost Erweiterung

90826.description:
In Leprechaun’s Castle, the players are noble family members in Ireland. These Lords and Ladies will score points by being the first to reach castles that contain Leprechauns before their close competitors. They will build and travel on roads between castles while collecting gold coins, pots of gold, and shamrocks. By carefully choosing from the available actions, players will draw road tiles and attempt to explore castles without getting caught by an Evil Leprechaun. Players will use their special abilities and plan their turns to locate the most shamrocks. These brave souls may escape the clutches of the Evil Leprechaun but not even the luck of the Irish can save them from a Banshee!

The game system allows players to choose from the available six actions, but players may not take more than four. The available actions are: place a road, travel to a castle, exchange one road, destroy one road, draw an Exploration card, or spend a pot of gold.

82635.description:
Back of box: "Match and collect the pairs of friendly animals in this fun farmyard card game. You'll have to keep your eyes peeled and watch out for the wily fox that gobbles up your chickens, or you might lose them all!"

Players are farmers that have 4 chickens each. The goal is to collect as many pairs of animals as possible before losing all your chickens.

A fun educational game for children.

90830.description:
Take Your Pick II is the third title in SimplyFun's Take Your Pick series of party games, which gets each player to challenge his knowledge of fellow players.

Each round one player is the subject; each other player is dealt three cards. Each card shows two words or phrases on it – Fried / Grilled? Do it Yourself / Pay for Labor? – with one word or phrase circled on the top half of the card, and the other word/phrase circled on the bottom.

Turn the cards so that the phrase you feel most matches the subject on each card is on the top, then stack the cards with the phrase you feel the subject would most likely agree feel describes herself in the front. Players take turns reading their chosen phrases to the subject. If the subject agrees that a phrase describes her, you score a point and move on the next card in hand; if not, you're through for the round. Play as many rounds as the number of players, and whoever scores the most points wins.

90915.description: Subtitled "Sally Store Manager Success Game". This game appears to have been sold or given out at Sally Beauty Stores. the goal of the game is to have the best available product line, you do this by stocking products and cases of products. when another player lands on your product spaces they must pay you to stock that product. the winner of the game is the last player to left with money at the end.

85454.description:
A 2 player abstract game, played with white and black stones on a Hexhex board. The goal is to have the largest group on the board when the game ends and the board is full. There is a trick, though: You can place as many stones per turn as you have groups on the board (up to a limit). There's a tricky balance: you need to connect your groups together to advance toward the goal, but you can't connect them too much or else you won't be able to place as many stones as your opponent.

The current rules:

1. The board begins empty.

2. To begin, White puts a single stone on any vacant space, and then Black does the same.

3. From then on, starting with Black, the players take turns. On your turn you may place as many stones as you have groups on the board, and you may place them onto any vacant spaces. Except:

*You must place at least one stone.
*The stones you place may not be adjacent to one another.
*If you have more than 3 groups on the board, the maximum number of stones you may place is 3.
*You may not grow any group by more than one stone.
*A stone connecting two or three different groups together is considered to have grown them all (at the end of your turn, no group may have more than one new stone in it).

4. The game ends when the board is full and the player with the largest group wins. If the players’ largest groups are the same size, compare their second-largest groups, and so on, until you come to a pair which aren't the same size. Whoever owns the larger group wins.

90840.description:
Sushi High Battle is a game about colors, faces, and racing to the top of some ambiguous track of colors. Yes, by battle I mean race!

Sushi High Battle consists of 10 custom dice with multiple colors per die. Each is marked with a face that corresponds with a color. Also, each die has a number which indicates the turn in which you may roll it.

The game is designed for 2-5 players but more may join in the fun.

The goal is to have the most pieces on the board, in the highest places of each colored track, after all 10 dice have been rolled by all of the players.

90841.description:
Push your luck and your opponent by taking part in developing Cleveland's early streetcar lines. Players roll dice to improve their portfolios, expand their railroads, harness new trains or force dividends. Play continues until three of the four railroads have expended their cubes. The most cash wins.

This game is an approachable, quick train game, similar to a lot of Winsome games. It uses cubes for track. It uses shares in a manner similar to Chicago Express. Payouts and dividend trigger in a manner similar to German Railways. The unique twist in this game is that there are no treasuries for each company - dice are rolled for any company the player has a share of - and actions are performed on behalf of that company by the player. Trains are also purchased which work similar to 18XX trains and also add bonuses to the company value as well. Dice may be rerolled, but 6's are automatically removed and one group of dice for a specific number must always be locked for each roll, like Pickomino.

There are choices to be made along the way - do you invest heavily and buy into shares? Do you force a swap with your opponent to ruin his position? Do you build into another railroad now to trigger a dividend or wait until your opponent goes to take it? Do you take a turn to send your opponent's company into the woods? How do you manage a poor roll?

This was designed for the 2011 One Sheet PnP Contest.

90843.description:
Just a party game, the theme is drawn from the film “The Big Lebowski”, as well as “LebowskiFest”, the annual festival of all things Lebowski. All of the artwork is original. Printed on fabric, the board design reflects The Dude’s rug, the maguffin of the film.

Goal
Move to the center of the board and get The Dude’s rug, which is a poker chip placed in the center space. The player must then get home with the rug.

Game Mechanics
It’s a roll-and-move game. The board is laid out in a circle, with 8 starting points on the perimeter. The player may roll a single die, or for more control (to land on a more desirable space) may bowl instead. 5 bowling pins and 2 marbles are included. 1 marble is rolled and each pin knocked down equals 1 space. Each space requires its own action, or inaction. E.g. answer a trivia question and roll again.
The players may move in any direction, there is no predetermined path. Once a player gets possession of the rug, the other players must catch up and challenge for possession. This is determined by a roll-off. Each player bowls a frame, and the best score wins possession of the rug.

There is some adult content. This game is not intended for little Larrys.

86748.description:
Players are sailors who try to reach America before the other players, starting from Europe and crossing Atlantic ocean. During the perilious travel they'll have to avoid storms, mutinies, hull crashes, winds, also thanks to Colombo's cards' help.

In order to achieve their objective they'll have to draw and play the right cards and to move their ships the fastest way possible to reach the american coasts.

86750.description:
From the Perfect Captain website:

The first in our series of Spare Change games, Villehardouin is a campaign game of the Byzantine Reconquest of the Morea in southern Greece in the year 1263 AD.

Players take the role of either the Achaean Franks under Prince William de Villehardouin, freshly back from captivity in Constantinople, or that of the Byzantine Empire under the Sebastocrator Constantine (the Emperor Michael VIII's step-brother).

As with all of our games, supply and logistics are as important as naked force. Never fear- there is of course no bookkeeping. At the start of each turn players figure out how much "change" they gather to fuel their activities for the turn. Simply marching off into arid and barren territory, even if it is strategically important, will leave you high and dry and out of supply- forcing a humiliating retreat. Players must plan carefully where they are going, how long they will be there, and what can go wrong; losing a battle will deplete your treasury as well as your army.

The opposing armies are different too, adding another element to strategy. The Franks have excellent cavalry and good foot troops, but not many skirmishers. The Greeks have an abundance of archers and ambushers as well as hard fighting regulars, and a corps of Turkish mercenaries (of dubious loyalty..). Both sides have to pick their battlefields and their timing must be near-perfect to pull off a game-winning battle.

The terrain is not the friendliest; each players base is green and lush, but you can't win by sitting still. Feint and counter-feint will be the order of the day, but when the time comes, you must strike. Sieges can be long, but sudden assaults costly. Greeks can set up ambushes while the Franks can attempt impetuous charges- either one can, if handled properly, bring about your opponent's overthrow.

This is the kind of game where there can be no wasted moves; everything is important, and dilly-dallying will hurt you sooner rather than later. This is a game that will lead to taut nerves and a lot of beard stroking!

Does it take long to play?
That's entirely up to you. You could easily fly through it in an hour, but if you want to win you'll need to think things through very carefully. Still, it's one of our quickest-play games.

90847.description:
Players each control a hive and the worker bees within. Each turn players must choose between expanding their hive, creating new workers, collecting pollen and attacking other hives. Opportunities and choices exist on every turn, but timing and luck are critical.

You must decide which workers to deploy, whilst trying to out-think your opponents. Take risks by gambling for extra actions, and play the odds for Events that can both help and hinder all players.

The player whose hive and workforce is the largest after 12 turns is the winner.

Working Bee is a luck-driven strategy game for 2-4 players aged 10 and up that plays in around 45 minutes.

86752.description: Two players game: one player will take control of Danguard, hero of the humanity who will have to stop the other player evil project to harm terrestrial bases with his terrible ufo robots. Danguard will win by destroying 3 ufo robots. Ufo robots will win by occupying and destroying 4 terrestrial bases

86753.description:
Adventure game where players will travel worldwide, from Africa to America, from Asia to Australia. The game is divided in two main phases: during the first phase players will decide where to go, the right season, try to search a good sponsor supporting their expedition and buy the right items to survive.
During the second phase they'll leave for the expedition and try to do their best to avoid accidents and hazards also thanks to their equipment.
The winning player is the one completing the adventure first.

86754.description:
Team-based card-game with a fantasy theme.

Players group in teams and struggle for the dominion over the land of Mystras. Each team starts with a treasury of 50.000 Iros (the local currency) and tries to exaust the other team's treasure by winning battles. Players have also to spend the Iros in order to gain cards from the personal marketplaces of each player, thus needing to balance the expenses in order to avoid damaging their own team.

The game box includes:
- 36 pages rulebook
- 196 cards
- 8 Marketplace player mats

Available in Italian since October 2010. International editions to follow.

90853.description:
From the rules:
Famous game show, the board game formula has seen many versions for several decades. This is one of the first versions.

The board represents a path of squares alternately white and black. The game includes two sets of cards, vowels and consonants, and 6 special cards representing each side of a dice.
The goal is to complete 3 laps of the course by forming the longest words possible. The first player draws 7 letters by choosing the convenience vowels or consonants.

It has 1 minute 30 to form a word that has spread before him, if a player can form a longer word, it announces and shape. Whoever has the longest word advance his pawn on the course as many spaces as there are letters forming the word. Maps of the word are removed from the game The next player must keep the other letters and return to pick the missing cards to replenish his hand to 7 letters. If nobody finds a word, 7 letters are rejected and the tour resumed.

On the course, when a player lands on a black square, he rolls the dice, takes the letter corresponding to the figure obtained (this letter can be A, E, I, O, U or S) and must reform a word of the same number of letters in the word presentation of the current lap. If it fails, it returns to the box where it came from.

86758.description:
How many words, movie titles or famous people, can you and your team guess in 90 seconds? Set the word generator on your head, press it and a word appears. More than 2000 names, movies, objects and animals can be shown on the word generator. You're teammates can sing or yell instructions. You should lose no time to guess who or what's on your head because you have 90 seconds to guess as much words or names as possible. Ben Ik Napoleon is a party game where the fun and enthusiasm splashes.

(From the Publishers website)
86758.name: Ben ik... Napoleon?

86759.description:
Bible Caravan is a travel game that takes players on an imaginary trip through the Holy Land for the purpose of learning the location and significance of 30 places described in the Bible.

Each player gets a map board of the Holy Land depicting a caravan route. Players then select text filled tiles that match their caravan route cities, and play the tiles upon their board, matching the city tiles with Bible verses printed on the right side of the map board. Scoring is determined by locations filled and correct verse identifications.

90858.description:
The Operations and Objectives sourcebook allows players to introduce a strategic level to their WWII gaming. Taking control of company sized formations on the campaign map, sides compete to accomplish objectives set by the upper echelons of their commands.

Designed for multiple players using the " Rules of Engagement" tabletop wargame, this addtion will encourage gamers to carefully consider every turn within a game of "Rules of Engagement" as any poor decision at platoon level could potentially cost the campaign!

Campaign rules provide all that is needed to play in cluding map generation, terrain features, supply lines, tactical reserves, resolving casualties and special rules such as railheads, para drops, airstrikes and the random fortunes of war! Also includes the sample historical scenario, "The Defence of St.Vith".

Operations & Objectives is easily convertable for use with any system, from ancients to sci-fi.

90919.description:
The BoardGameGeek glossary helpfully includes the term "fart-factor" for those who have wondered how to describe the gassy sound created when pushing down on a box lid. Who knew that someday a couple of game designers would move the farts from inside the box to the front cover?

Yes, PRRRT... – from the designing duo of Ludovic Maublanc and Bruno Cathala – is all about the rip-roarers and pants-busters that emerge from one's nether regions, more specifically about determining who dealt it (while thankfully avoiding the "who smelt it" end of the equation).

Each round a situation card is revealed, such as a small crowd in an elevator, and a number of people cards equal to the crowd depicted on the card are turned face up. People cards are valued from 1 to 10 based on the amount of shame that person would have towards you should you be revealed as the culprit. Grannies are merciless...

Each player receives a hand of five odor cards, ranging in value from 0 to 7, with one 7, two 6s and so on to eight 0s. Going once around the table, each player in turn asks his neighbor, "So how about it? Are you the one contributing to climate change? Are you the one making more methane?" And so on. That neighbor can either fess up – in which case he scores all the people cards in play – or he can deny the charge, in which case the active player randomly draws a card from his hand and lays it on the table in front of the neighbor, revealing some of the smell that others have detected.

If you make it once around the table without anyone confessing, add another person card to the crowd of sniffers, then go around the table again. Repeat this process up to three times, at which point most people will have three cards in front of them. Everyone then simultaneously points to the person who they think created the ruckus (that is, who has the largest total of odor cards), abstaining if they are that person. Everyone then sums their stink, with the "winner" claiming the person cards in play and a card for each person blaming him; anyone who accuses a player incorrectly is penalized. Smallest score after a number of rounds wins the game.

Being dealt a hand of high numbers doesn't automatically presage your coronation as a gas god as high numbers typically have a special power that comes into play when someone reveals the card from your hand. The 7, for example, removes all other cards in your hand from play, while the 6 lets you exchange up to three cards from your hand with an opponent. With odor comes power!
90919.name: PRRRT...

86765.description:
Social(c) is the game of social interaction! While working together, construct a question that someone must answer. Each player gets a hand full of cards with a single word on them. As the turns go around the table, each player plays a single word. Once the question is complete, someone must answer the question. Will it be you? The question being asked is both uniquely your choice and the choices of others. Be careful though, you might be the one that must answer! Earn points based upon the words chosen in your sentence. After the question is answered, the real fun begins. Participate in mini-games that include everything from storytelling, acting, dance offs, trivia challenges, a game of craps, or a stare off. Each expansion comes with its own twists and challenges!

Social comes in several different flavors, each to meet the needs and interests of the gamer. Unlike most modular expandable games, Social does not require all previous expansions to be able to play the game. A single base kit is required along with any number of expansions to create a personalized deck of cards. Some base kits come with expansions. The purpose is to provide new gamers with popular expansions for cheaper pricing and an enhanced level of customizations to decks.

Additional expansions are able to be purchased separately.

The white label expansion includes the very basic set of Social.

Included within this tasty morsel are 189 playing cards that are sure to keep even the most loquacious gamers busy. 2-4 players. Ribbon, box, and cards included. A great starter set for any Socialite!

Source of information (Company website, Social Flyer, and Instructions).

86768.description:
“Abetto” is a dynamic, exciting game, where players become gentlemen and ladies brought from Arsen Lupin's stories and compete with each other for the name of the greatest burglar, lover and fencer of the nobel underworld.
There are several ways to achieve success. By means of committing burglary you can get trophies and gadgets that are essential to win the game. They also help you in overcoming challenges of the game as well as give you an opportunity to harm your opponents. By shooting at rivals or dueling with them you can steal their chosen trophies but you may also lose yours.
Mechanics of the game is based on modified roulette rules. Players bet the result on a special even/odd table and a number table (1-36). The probability of failure is small – only 25% - and can be further reduced by means of some gadgets. The esthetic wooden roulette is attached to the game.
In order to smooth down certain randomness that accompanies burglaries, shoots and duels, so called task cards were introduced to the game. There is a different task for each round and after accomplishing it a player receives prize in the form of trophies and gadgets. Fulfilling the task depends solely on player’s behavior.
The game board is based on a tile system. Players arrange it themselves and each time they compose a different district in which the game takes place.
Abetto game provides large interaction between players and a great deal of emotions. Even during another player’s turn you take active part in the game.

Publisher Blurb

88872.description:
Description from the box and website:

The King has died without an Heir!!

Gather enough allies and power to claim the throne for yourself.

Will your reign be one of chivalry and bravery? Or one of diplomacy and deception? Will it be of prosperity and fertility or will the endless struggle throw the country into a devastating rebellion?

Time is against you as you join the chaotic era of the Rising Kings!


Rising Kings is a fun and entertaining cardgame for adults and kids age 12 years and up.

Each box contains 97 cards, a rulebook (English, Danish and German) and 15 overview cards (English, Danish and German).


Gameplay:
Players draw cards from a shared playdeck and play cards from their hands. Every card is put into play and has an effect when played. A few cards have an ongoing effect - like the Fortress and the Cityguard.

There are three types of cards: characters, buildings and rebellions. Each player can play one character card, one building card and any number of rebellion cards on his turn.

When the last card is drawn from the playdeck the game ends. Each player is awarded points for buldings and characters he controls, and the one with the most points becomes the King.
It is possible to get bonus points for being the one with the most characters or buildings of each type.

Examples of card effects:
The thief allows you to steal two cards from an opponent's hand, while the saboteur allows you to destroy a building controlled by another player.
The Inn allows you to play an extra character, while the University lets you retrain and replay one of your existing characters.
The Rebellion disables the effect of a Fortress or Cityguard.

87507.description:
This is the second expansion set for the Fantasy Flight Games version of Cosmic Encounter.
From FFG web site:

In Cosmic Conflict, 20 new alien races explode onto the galaxy! Players will now shudder at the insidious kindness of the Empath, blink in confusion at the antics of the Lunatic, and howl in outrage as their planets are stolen away by the Claw!

Cosmic Conflict also makes the Cosmos even bigger, adding another player (and attractive black components) to the game. Cosmic Quakes will shake things up, ensuring that no player’s hand is truly safe. And as if that wasn’t enough, Cosmic Conflict introduces a new variant to the game – the hazard deck, which confronts the players with dangerous and amusing events that can crop up at any time.

Hazards are special game-altering conditions that bring exciting effects to your Cosmic Encounter experience. Special destiny cards, drawn during the destiny phase, display a “hazard warning” in the upper left corner; this indicates that a hazard card should be drawn.

Consisting of two types (temporary and permanent), these cards have a variety of wild effects. The Energy Fields hazard card, for example, lets each main player draw two free cards... but they must show them to the group first. And the optional “Extremely Hazardous Variant” will take you on a wild ride; it brings a new hazard card into play every turn!
87507.name: Cosmic Encounter: Cosmic Conflict

86772.description:
This game takes us across the map through the large cities of Europe and the adjacent Mediterranean countries. The aim is to be the first player to put down all of his Citycards. You can do this by working the shortest route between cities. The more often you play the game the better you will know your way about the map, the better you willbe able to select your routes critically, and the faster you will be able to put down you cards.

The game is a variant from Journey Through Europe but without dices.
86772.name: Dove ti porta il viaggio?

90870.description:
We're in Australia, a land of myth and magic, and every night at sundown eight dreambirds gather around the holy rock Uluru. To make the magic work to its fullest, they all wish to land in specific locations to fulfill specific conditions.

Unfortunately, they haven't coordinated their wishes among the flock, so it's up to the players to sort out the puzzle so that as many dreambirds as possible have their wish granted. Oh, and you better do it quickly because the sandtimer is running towards sundown.

In Uluru: Tumult am Ayers Rock, players must solve these dreambird puzzles individually and simultaneously, then review their results together. Each unfulfilled wish results in a penalty point for a player. Play proceeds over several sundowns, and the winner is the player who in the end has received the fewest penalty points.

The game includes variable difficulty levels so that everyone from children to seasoned gamers can compete together and be challenged.

Uluru: Tumult am Ayers Rock can be combined with Uluru: Neuer Tumult am Ayers Rock to add further variants and combinations to the game.
90870.name: Pelican Cove

82679.description:
Bee Maja is going to leave her beehive and explore the garden around her. No need to say that she won't meet only friendly insects. Will the players direct her through her adventures and bring her savely back to the hive?
This is the only authorized Biene Maja game from the original author Waldemar Bonsels. (source: publisher blurb)
82679.name: De Avonturen van Maja de Bij

82680.description:
"Grasshopper is a Backgammon variant invented by Matt Crispin and its most significant feature, compared to the classic Backgammon, is that there are no dice and no luck factor at all. The game strategy fully depends on player's skills."

My brief description of how the game is played and the goal:

During the game, players attempt to race their 14 pieces around the Backgammon board, counter-clockwise, blocking their opponent's pieces along the way by occupying a point (a single piece on a point cannot be captured in this variant, in fact, there is no capturing at all) or by building a "wall" (two stacked pieces on a point make a wall) that no piece, friendly or otherwise, can pass over. Movement, in this game, is only from quadrant to quadrant, each quadrant consisting of 6 points (1 thru 6, 7 thru 12, 13 thru 18, 19 thru 24). The second piece on the wall has special ability of jumping over any wall that might be in the way to land in the next quadrant (hense the name "Grasshopper"). Walls can only be built by moving a piece from the previous quadrant that is exactly 6 points away to a point that has one piece on it. Once the players get their pieces to the 4th quadrant, they must build walls on the quadrant. These walls (two piece stacks) can be borne off the board as a unit for the players turn. The winner is the first player to bear off two walls consecutively, but not necessarily in two consecutive turns.

86778.description: In 100 Really Dumb Things YOU have to DO while PLAYING this game, players will do some ridiculous things while laughing uncontrollably at each other. Players might draw cards that tell them to salute the nearest wall, do the Chicken Dance around the room and meow like a cat while wearing a cat nose. Other cards set off chain reactions among players. Your actions might cause players to tap their heels together and say 'There's no place like home,' do a hula dance using a tambourine, pretend to jump rope or hiss like a snake. One dumb thing definitley leads to another in this zany game of craziness!

name.#text: 100 Really Dumb Things You Have to do While Playing This Game

86779.description: A cooperative game in which 1-4 players race against time to jointly solve crimes. The game board is a map of the city of Osh Vegas. Crimes occur randomly throughout the city. The police move to the crime scenes as allowed by a special movement die. Then using five 6-sided dice, crimes are solved if the police on the scene can roll 3 of the same number. To win, the players must solve all of the crimes before time runs out.

86780.description:
This mini-expansion contains 9 bonus planets for use with Eminent Domain. It includes 3 Prestige planets and 6 Utopian planets. These planets are intended to spice up the game and add an interesting twist to the Survey role, making your choice of planets, and therefore your strategy, more interesting

Prestige Planets
There are 3 Prestige planets, each with a different cost, representing important or famous worlds that confer a lot of influence. However, they do not help to satisfy any research requirements, they do not provide symbols, and they do not have any resource slots.

Utopian Planets
There are 6 Utopian planets, each with the same cost, representing impressive utopias where any type of resource can be produced and any type of technology can be studied. The resource slots on Utopian planets can store any type of resource, so when producing a resource you may choose which type to produce.

When researching technology, a Utopian planet counts as any type of planet you already have for purposes of satisfying planet requirements. However, for each research role you may only count 1 Utopian planet this way. For example, if you have 1 Advanced planet and 2 Utopian planets in your Empire, then you could choose Advanced technology cards from level 1 or 2 (but not level 3). You could not choose any Metallic or Fertile technology cards unless you also have planets of those types in your Empire.

88874.description:
Roll and move on a round board with 8 rings and 12 segments. Players start in the center and can move inwards, outwards or along the rings with one die roll.
You try to get all 6 different fruit cards. On a space with a fruit you roll 5 dice and try to get as many dice from this fruit. One reroll is free. All other rerolls cost money.
5 of a kind gives the fruit card matching. 3,4 and 5 of a kind gives money.
In the outer ring you get a fruit card only with 4 of a kind.

86783.description:
From the box: The beautiful stained glass windows of Matthew, Mark, Luke and John need your help. Use all of your cards to rebuild the apostles and you win Church Windows!

User summary: Players "rebuild" church windows by swapping cards from their hands to mixed up windows on the table. Once a window is repaired, a new window in the opposite color (red or black) can be built next to the repaired window.

The player who gets rid of their cards first is the winner.

86784.description:
From the box:
Hours OF FUN for 1 or 2 players. Play at home or carry along to play while traveling.

YOU CALL THE PLAYS! Run...Kick...Pass. There are touchdowns, pass interceptions, fumbles, penalties, field goals, in fact, everything but a water boy.
All the thrills of a real football game are enjoyed while playing this game. Never two games alike.

Play using regulations football rules of your choice: high school,college or professional rules. Se enclosed cards with rules on how to play and instructions on easy way to keep track of te first downs, line of scrimmage, etc.

82690.description:
"A rally with a difference, full of dangerous pitfalls and traps. Your guide is a reckless owl who leads you through the streets of Athens at top speed. Your aim is to reach the end, at the Acropolis, and be crowned the winner!" (Source: Back of the box)

"This game consists of a series of 63 squares. Each player chooses an owl-shaped pawn. The owl was the symbol of Athena, patron goddess of the city of Athens. All players in turn roll the dice. The player with the highest score goes first. The rest follow in turn. When a player falls on a square depicting an owl, he has the opportunity of moving his pawn a second time, for the same number of squares. If a player throws 9 (with a 6 and a 3) he moves to square 26 whereas if he brings 9 (with a 4 and a 5) he moves to square 53. The player to reach square 63 first, is the winner. But beware! There are traps on the way." (Source: Center of the board)

82691.description:
From the publishers website:

As a courtesy to new players we are presenting a condensed version of the rules for your enjoyment free of charge. This will allow those of you new to the game to play some simple test games to evaluate if Classic BattleTech is for you. Classic BattleTech is a game of skill and luck, and we are certain that new players will find this an excellent introduction to a very rich game and universe.

Almost everything needed to play is included, the only exceptions being a couple of pencils, a pair of six-sided dice, and of course you and your imagination.

As always, enjoy, and thank you for supporting Classic BattleTech.

86792.description:
From the instructions: Peanut Butter Party is a fun, fast-paced game based on answering riddles. Follow the friendly animals from the Peanut Butter Pond series along a path filled with special places. Answer exciting riddles as your travel toward the pond.

User summary: Answer riddles correctly to draw "Peanut Butter Party" cards, which allow movement along the board, either one or two spaces, or to one of six designated "Special Places". Reach the end goal (pond) and answer a final riddle to win the game.

86793.description:
Statistical replay game on basketball, featuring many different expansion sets. Basic game is very simple: each team is rated for points made, points allowed, rebounds and assists, plus it has a special value based on historical performance in the tournament (used to give a possible random variation to a few of his ratings). Opposing teams compare their value and a die is rolled for each team to determine the score. It is a fast replaying simulation, with a good bit of accuracy in the final result.

For the moment the following sets are available (directly from the designer, Roberto Chiavini or from Wargamer Vault): WNBA (all seasons) NBDL (all seasons), original ABA (all seasons), all the NBA from 1951 in single decades

86794.description:
Peculiar statistical replay game on a minor sport game, handball, dedicated to all the editions of this sport in the olympic games.
Basic system is really simple, as each team is rated for goal made and allowed, plus a killer instinct capacity (the ability to win point to point games) and a random modifier based on historical performance in the competition. Opposing teams compares values, then a die is rolled for each team to determine the final score (after a few possible modifications).
Very simple and very fast to replay an entire tournament in a very short time

86795.description:
This is a strategic dice placement game for 3 - 5 players. Each player takes the roll of a strain of bacteria in a petri dish, and begins to mutate and grow their strain in an effort to be the biggest.

Every turn you roll two D6 spotted dice, and then place one of these on the board according to a set of simple rules. Do you extend your strain or do you focus on breaking apart an opponents? Do you risk expansion into a contested portion of the playing area or do you focus on strengthening, but not lengthening, your strain? Every turn has interesting and strategic decisions to be made all from a simple roll of two dice.

86798.description:
You are Giraffe the hero of this game and you arrived in a small inn. Suddenly during the night something was attacking the inn. It’s a horde of ZOMBIES!!!. Nobody survive except you and the inn keeper’s daughter, Mari-chan. Survive the game in 3 nights without anyone dying.

This game is inspired by the genre tower of defense, where a horde of zombie, comes and attack the inn wave by wave. Your job is to control Giraffe, Mari-chan and occasionally Dogmeat by moving them through the inn, defending against the zombies, set barricade, buy stuff to upgrade and protecting Mari-chan while surviving yourself.

You need at least 1 six sided-die (the more the faster the game goes), 4 counters(different kind or colour) in which 1 of them represent zombie (which you need at least 7), a pencil and an eraser to jot down equipment, hp, bp and so on.

download the game here http://experimentalplayground.blogspot.com/2010/11/horde-of-...
86798.name: Horde of the Dead Minigame

90896.description:
Players take on the roll of extra-dimensional puppeteers who create and manipulate automatons in a shared environment. Backers is a creative game involving drawing, writing, and the playing of instruments.

Play consists of about five phases, called Objectives: Spiritual Amalgamation, Space Definition, Automaton Production, Dramatic Operation, and the Resulting Objectives. Via collaborative mechanics, the players create a map and characters which they then influence through a series of job rotations. Objects and characters are defined by motivations. Players may cause things and characters to interact in ways contrary to their motivations through the expenditure of points.

Backers: Amalgamations of the Spiritual Hinterlands is designed to facilitate and moderate the formation of collaborative playgrounds in a simple and comprehensive way with an eye toward personal extension balanced by a diminished role for the ego. Conditions for success are not listed in the rules and must be supplied, if necessary, by the players themselves. In the current edition, players must also provide their own musical instruments, art supplies, and, optionally, hats.

name.#text: Backers: Amalgamations of the Spiritual Hinterlands

82707.description:
From the TactDecks website:

The Nettler is a jack of all trades, specializing in General attacks and foiling the enemy's strategic plans. He comes with 5 Vexing Tricks (including Alchemical Blast, Smokescreen, Firebrew Sling) and reinforcements of Conscripts and a Darkstone Mercenary.

The Nettler is for any faction and considered an Uncommon type.

82708.description:
Obstacle Pack 1 is an expansion booster pack for the TactDecks Basic set that enhances your stronghold.

Build greater defensive cover with Battlements. Use Stairs to climb atop your walls and rain attacks from above. Construct more formidable barriers with Angle Joints. Expand your territory with additional Walls and Forests.

Obstacle Pack 1 provides 18 additional obstacles for your battlefield!

86807.description:
This game is a spin and move game where the object is to capture valuable animals in the jungle. The game board is filled with face down animals and by spinning a spinner and then moving your playing piece onto one of those animals you capture it. The game continues until all of the animals have been captured. Turning over each animal reveals a value attached to that particular animal. The player who captures the most valuable animals wins the game. When a player lands on an animal, his playing piece remains on that spot until his/her next turn and other players cannot land on or move over that spot, They must use their roll number to move around the opponents piece. The designers name appears to be Dexter Wayne but research is still being done on that fact.

Game for ages 7-10

name.#text: Ramar of the Jungle, The New Jungle Game

86808.description:
Brand new introductory set for Legend of the Five Rings. Features the Dragon Clan and Lion Clan in two pre-built decks ready to play right out of the box. A lavish rulebook quickly teaches new players everything they need to know to start defending the Empire of Rokugan.

The set also comes with many choice rares for the current environment, giving players a quick foot up in the game! Combine with the free Imperial Gift set (150 cards free!) and you'll be serving with honor in no time!

(publisher blurb0

86809.description:
From the publisher:

A compact collection of card games about and with homonyms, so-called "Teekessel / Teapots". The cards show 240 photos which display everyday views as well as extraordinary motives and perspectives. The players try to discover the "Teekessel" in the pictures and to combine the cards according to certain rules.
The complexity of the games varies from easy to difficult. They provide challenges as regards perception, quickness, knowledge, wit, creativity and language competence.

The games have been designed for cross-generational playing. They can be played within the family as well as in the contexts of language teaching and creativity training. So far Teekessel im Quadrat is available only in German.

90907.description:
Test you mettle with the John Deere version of UNO!

112 Custom Cards featuring legendary John Deere equipment.

Same great UNO play PLUS the special Harvest card which forces your opponents to do some heavy lifting! When you play this card, select another another player to draw cards from the draw pile until he/she draws a green card which will allow them to complete the harvest (or until they draw 5 cards, whichever comes first.)

Remember to shout "UNO!" when your hand gets down to the last "crop"!

Comes in Collector's Tin.

86812.description:
User summary:

Theme - A fortune telling game based on cards and pendulum. Played solo or between two players with roles of questioner (later on just Q) and interpreter (N). The interpreter leads the game and the questioner is the one receiving information about his/her home, work, personality, love, future and past.

Game-play - The game-play is divided into two phases 1) the card turning and 2) the pendulum swinging.

1) The card turning phase starts by picking up the proper coloured scarabs to the game board; the hair, eyes and favourite colour of the Q. The Q shuffles the purple 54 card deck and hands it over to N. N divides the deck into 3 separate decks of 18, 9 and 27 cards. The cards are dealt on the game board in the order 18, 27 and 9. The 18 cards are dealt on locations shown at the front page of the rule leaflet. The cards have 6 words in them and one of those is picked depending which is forming a pyramid with the game board (the black half of the pyramid on the left side of the card and the white half of the pyramid on the game board). While the cards are dealt, the N questions the Q if the word on the cards have any special meaning. The forming words are related to either home (1st vertical row), work (2nd), personality (3rd), love (4th), future (5th) or past (6th), depending which vertical row the cards are placed to. The 27 cards are then dealt on the game board (some restrictions apply, see the rule leaflet). Then the deck of 9 cards is used as a key to whole interpretation. At last the rest cards of the deck of 27 are used to check if something is being dominant on some areas of the Q's life. The final interpretations varies each playing time.

2) The pendulum swinging phase starts by placing the four decks of 28 cards onto the game board. The decks are placed on lower part of the game board, around the pyramid (letter A shown on the first page of the rule leaflet). The decks represents the areas of home, work, personality and love. The players decide one of the four categories and Q decides a question he/she wants to get answered related to that category. The transparent pyramid is placed on the game board and the pendulum is used for random number selection. There is numbers of 1-28 around the pyramid on the game board and the random pendulum swing decides the number of the chosen card. The N reads the text on the proper card to the Q. Same is repeated to other categories and questions.

Goal of the game - Interpreting the message gotten with cards and pendulum and gaining more self-consciousness.

The game includes:

1 game board
1 transparent pyramid
1 pendulum
4 decks of cards (28 cards each)
1 purple deck of cards (54 cards)
2 bags including different coloured scarab buttons
1 rule leaflet (4 pages)

From Finnish intro on the rule leaflet:

"Karnak on kiehtovan jännittävä ennustuspeli, jota voi pelata yksin tai yhdessä. Se perustuu eräisiin muinaisegyptiläisiin mysteereihin ja kulttuuriperinteisiin. Koska peli on tunnettujen astrologian ja horoskooppien asiantuntijoiden suunnittelema, pelaajat voivat sen avulla myös kehittää omaa kuudetta aistiaan ja salattuja kykyjään. Luonnollisesti sitä voidaan pelata myös pelkkänä pelinä, mutta moni varmasti mielellään käyttää sitä oman itseymmärryksensä kehittämiseen ja hankkii sen avulla tietoja sisimmästä minuudestaan. Näitä tietoja voi sitten soveltaa toisten, kenties vähemmän onnekkaiden ihmisten auttamiseen."

82717.description:
Eight cards are dealt to each player. The other cards are placed face down in the centre of the table.
The first player draws a card from the pile and discards a card from his hand. When any player holds five connecting cards of a figure, they must be placed face up on the table.
The other players try to connect their cards to that figure.
When any player has disposed of all his cards, the other players count ten for each card left in hand.
The game ends when any player loses 500 points.

82719.description:
This was one of several games in a series that focused on Regional Cities within NSW and Victoria, Australia.

The primary function was to promote regions and businesses within the cities featured in each game.

But there was a game here too.

"The gameboard is a full colour representation of your city and the players compete with each other to race to targeted destinations on the gameboard. The first player to arrive at the targeted destination will buy that property and receive a destination card. The first player to purchase 10 destination cards and return home safely, wins the game.

Source: Back of Game Box

name.#text: This Is Your City Albury-Wodonga Game

86816.description:
Königsberg ´45( # 104-1 ), is a boardgame covering the Soviet attack on East Prussia in 1945.

The game handles the 20 first days of the attack starting on the 13th of January 1945. The 3rd Belorussian Front under command of Cherniakhovsky launches an attack into the northeast of East Prussia while the 2nd Belorussian Front, commanded by Rokossovsky, one day later starts an attack from the south east. However, Army Group Mitte, under the command of Reinhardt, puts up an astonishing defence desperatly pushing the Soviets back.
The time is however on the Soviet side and when the defence finally crumbles there is nothing left to withstand the Soviet troops to ravage the country.

Königsberg ´45 is taught in 30 minutes and easy to digest yet a challenge even for the more experienced players. It is built around the same system of rules that have shaped both Plan West and the upcoming Tanneberg 1914.
The game uses a chit pull system telling you which armies to move. Each turn is two days and the game has 10 turns.

Components:

50 x 70cm-size map
280 die-cut counters
1 six-sided die
Rules
Box

86817.description:
Banana village is having their annual village run. This year you entered to win the Banana Cup, but you are not the only one who hungers for the cup.

Village Run is for 2 or more player game where players roll for speed and hoping to take the first place. During the game players will get power up box to take advantage over their opponents. The game use a unique speed system, in where players will have a decision whether to stay on the same speed or try to roll their luck to speed up or getting slow. Village Run also features combat in which players will try to land on a box tile to get an advantage over the other players. The game can be played around 15 minutes and whole lots of exciting laps of Village Run.

publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company
86819.description:
The classic Monopoly game. This theme: A game celebrating Island life!

Players roll and move along the board to collect the properties of the Lake Erie area, in the United States. When they have a complete collection of one color, players can build houses and even hotels. If another player lands on a property, the player who's owning it, can ask rent.

The object of the game is to let the other players go bankrupt.

86822.description:
Plan 1919 is a variant for 1918: Storm in the West, which was published in Command Magazine Issue #16. Here we assume no decision was reached during the campaigns of 1918, leaving the Allies with the task of driving the Germans from France and Belgium during the sprimg and summer of 1919.

This variant uses the 1918 map and most of the parent game's original counters, along with the new ones (32) provided in this issue. Except as added to or amended in the rules, the standard rules of 1918 apply here unchanged, along with optional rules 16.4, 16.7 and 16.8.

(From the introduction)

86823.description:
Published in Vae Victis nº 77, this expansion adds new cards, rules and counters for the original game Les deux Bretagnes (Vae Victis No. 76) which covers the dynastic struggle in Brittany during XIII and XIVth centuries.

The new cards are added without surpassing the total activation value of the player. They can also replace other cards with same activation value.

The new markers are reminders of some important game events or played cards (Ex. "Bombardes" or "du Guesclin va en Normandie"). They can also be associated with the new cards (the two green markers).

The 3 new characters counters are for "Jeanne de Flandre" and "Jeanne de Penthièvre". The "Jean de Monfort" counter is a variant.

name.#text: Les Deux Bretagnes: Expansion et nouvelles cartes

90922.description: The game is a standard trivia game where players take turns answering trivia questions in one of three formats: 1) Multiple Choice 2) True/False 3) standard Question and Answer. Correct answers allow you to move forward with the first player reaching the finish line being declared the winner. Contents: Game Board, 800 questions on 200 cards, 6 Pawns, and Rules.

90924.description:
In the midst of a heated forest conflict, an electrical storm damages the communication equipment of the telematons, telegraph-controlled war machines, of both belligerents. As the battlefield dissolves into a frenzy of nearly unguided machines controlled in only erratic bursts, the opposing sides must salvage the situation by using balloons and ground crews to locate and regain control of strayed telematons. However, the armed telematons are unpredictable in their damaged states and the battle is by no means over, so artillery has been brought to bear as well. Victory can be attained through the recouping of lost telematons or the destruction of the enemy headquarters.

A strategy game where the majority of the action revolves around 33 randomly-moving unkown units in the center of the board. Players can interact with them by learning their identities (observation balloons), firing on them (artillery) or attempting to salvage and control them by forming lines of retrieval crews, telegraph wires, and telematons. Only telematons within these lines can be controlled, and control of these units is lost through the severing of the line through hostile attack or poor tactical movements. Thre are two ways to win; either recovering 10 telematons and returning them to your headquarters or destroying the enemy's headquarters before they can reach this goal.

86829.description:
From the back of the box (translated from croatian):

"Tibor becomes a vampire. To return among normal people, Tibor has a long way from his village to the castle of Countess Zarina Sibilskog in which Kosinius, a scientist created a magic potion for the vampire. Will Kosinius' magic potion help Tibor to become again an ordinary person?"

Content:
1 board
40 playing tiles
10 scoring tiles

In this simple game the players place tiles on a grid, trying to connect their village with their castle (if they place a tile with a garlic on it, they gain a score tile with 1-3 points). The player who first reaches the castle gains ten points.

82735.description:
HE WHO DIES WITH THE MOST LOOT
NOW PROBABLY FOUND THE STAIRS
DOWN TO THE 2nd LEVEL

The first expansion for Loot and Scoot adds new monsters, new treasures, new adventurers, new buildings and the official solitaire rules.

With this expansion, you can build Fountains of Healing, Statues of Glory (with a value based on how well you can loot the dungeon) and even own a Tavern. Dual-class characters, like Paladins and Rangers, can be hired at the Inn. Secret Rooms are waiting to be discovered, hiding incredible powerful magical weapons (loot a +1 Dagger or Wand of Magic +1!). New traps are available to hinder (or kill) your opponents. Even the undead stir in the dungeons below.

Two additional player mats are included for variety. Now every dungeon master can have their own dungeon type.

Notice: This Expansion Kit is not a ‘stand alone’ game. To use it, you must own a copy of Loot and Scoot

Complexity: 2 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 4 on a 9 scale
Scale: Individual heroes vs. individual or groups of monsters

Game Components:


One illustrated, color 2-page Rules sheet
40 color, die-cut 5/8" square playing pieces
2 Dungeon player mats

name.#text: Loot and Scoot Expansion Kit #1: Loot Harder

90928.description:
Another self-print game from David Simpson (Tug of War).

It Counts to Win is an abstract game of dice, numbers, strategy and probabilities. Players roll dice and place them in either their pots, or other players' pots. Players attempt to make a total of '15', but beware, if you exceed 15, you'll have to start all over again, and your fellow players aren't going to let you make your 15 so easily. Players can either build their points or cause other players to bust by managing the dice rolled.

Every time a player makes 15, they score a point. First player to acquire 5 points wins.

86833.description:
A dexterity/skills table top game based on flicking or trowing small metallic balls.
There is a round board with 6 spiral channels;reaching the end of each route score points.
86833.name: Billard Bordelais

90930.description:
Witty Pong is the first release from French publisher MyWittyGames, which invites gamers to fund projects that they want to see released.

As far back as 2005, designer Antoine Bauza was trying to encapsulate the essence of ping-pong in a board or card game, but his design efforts never came to fruition, so the project was shelved – until mid-2010 when he chanced to show the prototype to Bruno Cathala. Cathala suggested a few changes, then the pair worked together to bring the game to the table.

In Witty Pong the ping-pong table is recreated by laying four cards in a 2x2 square, with a ball token being placed on one of the cards. On a turn, a player flips a card and places it on one of the three cards not covered by the ball. Two situations can occur:

• If the card depicts a ball somewhere in the artwork, the player must move the ball token to a new card. If he says anything or hesitates too long, he loses one of the three banana tokens with which he started the game.

• If the card doesn't have a ball on it, the player must say the "proper" word, with the word being determined by the letters and colors on the three uncovered cards. The word starts with "P" or "T" depending on which letter shows more frequently, and ends with "ong" or "ing" depending on whether more blue or red paddles are showing. If he says the wrong word or takes too long, he loses a banana.

Lose all your bananas, and you're out of the game. Last moneky standing wins. The game includes advanced rules that change what to say if the same letter or color is on all three paddles; additional rules allow for competitive play in which players can steal bananas from one another if they say the right word first.

86840.description:
Zip! is a tactical boardgame for 2 to 4 players, in which each player is searching for a buried treasure and, once found, tries to get away with the loot.
Who finds a treasure, has a bigger chance to win, but has to be extra careful too, because each player can "zip" his/her stone around the board to hit an opponent's stone in a flash, removing the opponent from play and stealing his/her treasure on top of that.
All stones are being moved simultaneously (players can hit the stone of an opponent in another players' turn) and for expert players there's a variation in which all player's stones are invisible!

86841.description:
The lush green grass of irish meadows and a homey shelter provide a pleasurable life for black sheep as well as white ones. A feast for the old lazy wolf. That's why you should keep an eye on your herd with help of the shepherd and his dog.

A strategic two player game about tending sheep. Each player moves sheep around the meadows and either into the shelter for twosomeness or off the board to score. A core mechanic is to keep an eye on blancing the size and composition of the flocks. The wolf will kill one of the sheep in the largest flock and you should make sure its not one of yours! You win by scoring enough points or reduce the opponents sheep so they can no longer mate.

As all the "Mini-Lederspiele" of Hiku-Spiele this game comes with several semi-precious stones in a leather pouch that when opened is the board of the game.

90938.description:
From the back cover:

Theme
Weet Wat Je Eet is a quiz game in wich the fascinating world of nutrition is discovered. With the elements brainteasers, facts, jokes, pratical advice and etiquette this is a game about food and drink playable by all.

Gameplay
Quizgame. Trow a dice and answer the question corresponding with the number on the dice. A correct answer wins the puzzlepart.

Goal
Filling the menu with the five different puzzleparts.

82749.description:
User Summary

This WWII miniatures rules set is subtitled Simple Fast Play Wargame Rules for the Western Desert 1940-43. The rules cover British action in North Africa. It indeed does use a simple d6 driven resolution system and contains rules for melee, weapons fire, and morale. Game uses a centimeter scale.

From the Introduction...

"For a good part of the Second World War Britain's main contribution to the Allied cause on land was in the Western Desert of North Africa. For a long time is was the only point where Britain was in land contact with the Axis powers, fighting first against the Italians and then against the Germans and Italians.

The following rules are as simple and fast moving as I have been able to make them, they are designed for relatively large-scale actions involving fairly large numbers of figures and AFV models."

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #76 (January 1994)

90942.description:
Mixtour is an original abstract stacking game for 2 players.

Starting with an empty board, players enter new pieces and move them trying to build up stacks with 5 or more pieces to win the game. There are many move options: stacks can be split at any level, opponent pieces may be moved, yet a move must always end on another stack. In fact, it is the height of the receiver stack that determines the range of possible moves.

90943.description:
From publisher blurb:

A strange disk has been spotted flying around Fort 51. Some say it's a secret Confederate airship, others claim it's a "Spaceship" full of little green men! Whatever the truth, all the Rail Barons want to get their hands on it! Will your crew be the first to discover its secrets? Or will they find your bones in some hushed-up crash site a dozen years from now?

Raid on Roswell follows the same awesome format as Deadlands: The Great Rail Wars – A Fist Full o' Ghost Rock, with detailed player briefings, new troops and equipment, and more fun than you can shake a gray at!

For the Great Rail Wars Miniatures Battle Game.

name.#text: Deadlands: The Great Rail Wars – Raid on Roswell

90944.description:
This book compiles new rules from the other Great Rail Wars expansions and adds new rules for experience, duelling, gadgets and conversions from Deadlands RPG to the miniatures game.

From Chapter One: Open Volleys Introduction:

In Cry Havoc! we're going to bring you up to date with all the rules changes since The Great Rail Wars began. Nobody wants to search through three or four books in the middle of a heated battle, so we've conveniently combined them in this chapter, letting you concentrate less on flipping pages and more on shooting holes through your opponent.
There are a few changes and expansions to the existing rules here, but that's not all. We've even collected all the new abilities and weapons from the GRW expansions to date. There are also the complete rules on duels and how to handle experienced and veteran troops.

From Chapter Two: The Lay o' the Land Introduction:

We just talked about how you fight your battles, and now we're going to talk about where you fight them. Here, we clarify a couple of areas from the GRW rulebook, but we also give you some new regions and strange locales for your battles.
There's also a section detailing the Strange Locales rail warriors may encounter. We've beefed these up and given the heroes more reason to explore these outposts of the Weird West.

From Chapter Three: More Magic, More Mayhem Introduction:

In the Great Rail Wars rulebook, we gave you about a dozen spells to arm your spellslingers. Since then, we've come out with a stampede of Deadlands: the Weird West sourcebooks filled with new arcane incantations and miracles to make the average cowpoke's ride even rougher.
This chapter contains the GRW conversions of many of those new spells. We've also tacked on complete spell lists for all the types of spellslingers in the game.

From Chapter Four: Fleshin' Out the Dead Introduction:

In the original Great Rail Wars rulebook, we gave you just the bare bones on using the Harrowed in your games. In this chapter, we show you how to make a Harrowed hero, plus we've got special Hindrances just for them, and a lot of powers only available only for these Boot Hill rejects. We've also included guidelines for converting your Harrowed character from the Deadlands: the Weird West roleplaying game.

From Chapter Five: The Miracles o' Weird Science Introduction:

There's a whole passel of strange devices that have found their way onto the battlefields. Guns that shock the opponent into next week, contraptions that let a man move underwater, and even steam-powered chainsaws! And there's the latest development in the area of science: alchemy and its potent chemical effects.

name.#text: Deadlands: The Great Rail Wars – Cry Havoc!

86849.description:
Total Soccer is the classic table footballs which recreate a Football game play with fingers.

It has evolved from the Subbuteo game, improving material quality and the playability, besides to have the licenses of the best football clubs around the world.

The way of playing is nearly identical to Subbuteo, player flick minature soccer players around the field to move, pass the ball, and attempt to score on the goal.

For two players, you can use only the fingers to win the match. Normally the duration is around 30 minutes (15 minutes for half).


Total Soccer es el clásico juego de fútbol de mesa que recrea un partido de fútbol con los dedos.

Es un producto que evoluciona del Subbuteo, mejorando la calidad de los materiales y su jugabilidad, además de ser licenciado por los mejores equipos del mundo.

El modo de jugar es idéntico a Subbuteo... pero con mejores componentes!!

Para dos jugadores, solo puedes usar los dedos para ganar el partido. Normalmente la duración son 30min aproximadamente (15 minutos por tiempo)

86851.description:
The Game consists of 3 games: The Steamboatgame (Het Stoombootspel), The Giftgame (Het Pakjesspel) and The Memoryvariant.

All games are based on a dutch special-day: Sinterklaas. This is the dutch version of SantaClaus and is celebrated on december 5th each year.

In The Steambootgame players use there playingfigure to collect presents from the hold of the ship on the gameboard. They do no know the value of the present they took.Via stairs and rooms of 3 different colors they attempt to bring them to the deck, to secure them. To do so, they throw a dice with the 3 different colors on it. A player must stop in a room of that color. When 2 players are in the same room, they have to switch presents. Two special actions which are in some rooms give players the chance to look at another players present, or his own, or to catch up with another player who is at max two stories higher in the ship. If all presents are on the deck, the player with the highest value of presents wins the game!

In The Giftgame players buy a few small presents upfront. They agree on the amount of money to be spent. You can also use the chips in the game and play for points.In this game also the colordice is used to decide to what field on the gameboard the player moves his playingfigure to. On each field is a different symbol, each giving a different action. The possible actions are: Take a present, switch presents and open them up, give present away to the player with the fewest presents, all presents in front of the players are passed to your neighbour in a clockwise fasion. and finally open up a present. When there are no more presents in the pile, the game ends. When playing with chips in stead of real presents, the game ends as soon as the last chip is taken from the supply. The player with the most points wins!~

The Memoryvariant is just another memory: There are 2 pairs of 12 different colored-and-valued chips. Turn them up-side-down so the sack is showing, shuffle them, and try to find the matching pairs as in regular memory. The player witrh the most chips wins.

82761.description:
In this roll and move trivia game, players race across Western Europe answering questions about the various countries or areas in which they visit. The questions cover subjects of, among others, history, literature, fine arts, geography and economy. Each player has a small deck of cards that they can exchange for advantages (extra dice of movement typically) under certain circumstances (answering a question correctly or landing on a particular kind of space). The first to move their marker to the end space is the winner.

The game has three sets of cards, each containing a set of questions at different levels: novice, intermediate or expert.

Text is exclusively in French.

82762.description:
Who can smack the Whac-aTile fast and first? Turn over a card. If your top card matches the top of another player's mole pile, be the first to hit the Whac-A-Tile. The first to hit it gets to keep all the cards in both mole piles!

Keep smacking until you've won all the cards to be King of the Molehill!

(From back of package.)

86859.description:
A word game based on the popular Catalan TV show "Bocamoll", aired by TV3 Televisió de Catalunya since 2007. Following the show structure, it is composed by six different tests on words: matching words with their definitions, guessing words from images and symbols, filling-in popular song lyrics with the correct words, deciphering SMS language texts, etc.

The game includes:
- board
- 500 cards
- 4 markers
- bag
- hourglass
- rules booklet

86860.description:
A roll-and-move game based on the Catalan TV show "Caçadors de bolets", aired by TV3 Televisió de Catalunya. The players try to win in this particular race of mushroom hunting, correctly identifying mushroom types.

The game includes:
- board
- 6 markers
- 112 mushroom cards
- 300 cards
- rulebook

82769.description: This domino-style game was designed with the intention of teaching the metric system. Players align hex-shaped pieces in such a way that equal measures of different units match. This can reinforce the base-10 concept of the metric system (eg, 1 kilogram = 1000 grams), or show the conversion rates between metric and imperial measures (eg, 1 litre = 1.06 quarts). Tiles for volume, mass and length are given, with the ability to "bridge" between the types with specific tiles.

85475.description:
This Maori Stick Game is called 'Ti Rakau' in Maori.

This game is played with two people or, at a more advanced level, four people. Each player needs one pair of wooden sticks. Players kneel on the floor across from each other and hold their sticks straight up, ends touching the floor. In unison, they perform a series of movements with their sticks, tapping their sticks together or against their partner's, progressing to throwing a stick to their partner and catching the one being thrown to them.

The aim is to keep going for as long as possible without dropping your sticks.

The last person who hasn't dropped a stick is the winner!

86872.description: It is a 12-page booklet describing the rules for a naval battle, intended to use with Navwar's miniatures. Each ship has maximum movement, fighting value and armament. Players simultaneously decide about movement, then each ship can fire. There are also rules covering ramming, close combat and morale.

82777.description:
Rough translation from the box:

The environmental protection quiz game for the entire family. Did you know...

why the foxglove plant is so useful?
how many liters of air a person needs to breathe?
how you can effectively avoid garbage?
which mode of transportation is the most environmentally unfriendly?

"Die Oekolis" guides players in an original and informative way through the everyday world of the environment and helps players learn more about the essential protection of our environment as they game.

For positive implementation of environmental concepts and for original ideas "Die Oekolis" received the 1991 award for "Game with Environmental Protection." This award is sponsored by the Ministry for the Environment, Conservation, and Reactor Safety.

Contents:
Game board
6 scoring tokens
1 pawn
1 special die
3 action tokens
95 question cards from 6 Knowledge Areas
33 hint cards
1 rulebook
Cardboard chits

86874.description: The title translates as IQ - the game of luck and logic. A player in her turn rolls a die, moves her pawn horizontally or vertically on a grid and on certain spaces gets a question (an IQ test item). If answers correctly, she gets 2, 4 or 6 points. The winner is the first player who arrives to the goal (the opposite corner) first, having at least 30 points. The game comes with 220 question cards and two additional IQ tests.

name.#text: IQ: A szerencse és logika játéka!

90972.description:
Mermaid Beach, a card game created by an eight-year-old, plays somewhat like a take-that version of Go Fish. Each player starts the game with a hand of beach cards: these cards include four copies each of items like beach balls, sunglasses, umbrellas, and so on; a dozen mermaids/mermen; and seaweed, sneaker waves and a single sea monster. A deck of shell cards – with cards worth 1-4 points and starfish action cards – is shuffled and placed on the table.

On a turn, a player can discard a mermaid/merman or matching pair of items to take the top shell card, discard a mean mermaid to steal another player's shell card, ask another player for an item card (a la Go Fish, drawing a card if you come up empty and scoring if you hit), play a sneaker wave to remove one opponent's shell card from play, or play seaweed to force someone to draw a beach card. If someone collects a shell card that is worth points, that player places the card on the table; if the shell card features a starfish, every player passes one beach card left or right as instructed.

The game ends when a player has no cards left in hand or has only the sea monster in hand. In the latter case, this player must discard all of the highest-value shell cards that she has collected. The player with the most shell points wins.

86877.description:
From the back of the box:

TURANGA – an expansion for Shuuro.

Turanga transforms Shuuro into a four-player battle.
Together with your ally on the opposite side of the board, get ready to fight for supremacy. But watch out: only with perfect timing and harmony of intents, is your team going to achieve victory!

Requires a copy of Shuuro to play.

90974.description:
In Splish Splash! players get to recreate that great feeling that comes from tossing stones in a pond and seeing water splash everywhere – but now you need to splash out just the right things in order to win.

To set up the game, take the box bottom – which has a game board set into it complete with an indented "pond" – and place it on the table; then fill the pond with the 50 wooden droplets, which come in five colors. Give each player a scoring disc showing ten droplets.

On a turn, a player rolls the die; based on the die roll the player either chooses a colored droplet in the color of her choice from the pond and places it on her scoring disc or drops a wooden "pebble" into the pond two or three times. After dropping the pebble, she then keeps any droplets that match empty spaces on her scoring disc while returning any other droplets to the pond. The first player to fill her scoring disc wins.
90974.name: Eine Party für Fridolin Frosch

86879.description:
The cards all show a couple of different animal types. There are six different animals - donkey, frog, rooster, cat, cow and pig - on the cards and there are one, two or three of them on each card. The cards are dealt, in his turn the player turns the top card of his stack and places in front of him.

If somebody sees a series - i.e. one, two and three animals of same type on one card - it makes the noise of this animal and gets all the played cards. Player who calls 4 times first is the winner. Whomever calls wrong must give one card to other players as a penalty. Who has no cards left is eliminated.
86879.name: Le concert des animaux

86881.description:
In Le jeu des fruits you have to get rid of all of your cards. There are six sorts of fruit on the cards: pears, bananas, plums, strawberries, oranges or pineapples. Each fruit is now 0-5 times on the cards.

A player must always play a card that has more fruit on it then the previous card that has been played in one of the fruit categories. For example, if the visible card shows two pears, three plums and a banana, you can play any card that contains three or more pears, two or more bananas, four or more plums.
86881.name: Gyümölcsjáték

86882.description:
Medieval Mastery is a board game of tactical conquest based on the feudal system that existed in Europe throughout the Middle Ages. Set in France, during a time of turmoil, each player assumes the role of a provincial lord as the country erupts into a war of succession. Send your brave knights forth to conquer the surrounding lands in an all-out struggle to claim the throne!

Medieval Mastery incorporates area control, hand management and modular board design as well as variable player powers and phase order. The rules include alternate gameplay variations. This, coupled with a modular game board and a random combination of crowns, orbs and sceptres, means that no two games will ever be the same! In addition, the number of components included allows for up to three games of varying sizes to be played simultaneously!

86884.description:
Tricky Double works a bit on the principle of Raj but makes it an 'adult' version. Players simultaneous choose a card and reveal it and then have to select a second card and reveal this one too. You win with the combination of these two cards.

The lower cards in the deck hold coins, the person who gets the most of these coins wins the game. The lower the card, the more points it has. So if you want to score a lot of points you will also have to play out a low card from your hand but still want to get the highest result in the end.

(User summary)

90981.description:
"Ends 'N Blends expertly combines fun and learning. It is an exciting, creative game which your child will want to play again and again. The game will increase reading and spelling ability. It will stimulate interest in and understanding of words.

"Created and developed by a professional educator, Ends 'N Blends has been tested and proven successful in the home and classroom. While playing the game, hundreds of words will be formed by combining word beginnings (consonants and 'blends') with word endings ('word families'). As he plays, your child will master the use of word families and learn to read a countless number of new words independently."
(From the rules introduction.)

The game consists of a game board divided into eight columns and eleven rows. Every third 'cell' contains a word segment such as "all", "ap", "ick", "ay", "ook" and several others. There is a spinner evenly divided into two sets of the numbers 1-5 and a "Hit or Miss" section. A set of over ten dozen "Ends 'N Blends" cards or tiles each contains a single word segment such as "sn", "ight", "ot", "at", "tr", "g", "fl", "ing", and many others. Forty-two "Hit or Miss" cards carry instructions such as "Return one point marker", "Take one end 'n blend. Spin again.", "Take one end 'n blend card from each player. Spin again.", and so forth. A small box holds approximately 40 thin, transparent red discs used for points. Finally, a small booklet entitled "Your Child's Reading: Suggestions For Parents" is included.

Players use the spinner to determine the number of "Ends 'N Blends" cards/tiles to draw. The player then places these cards on the board, matching them up to the word segments there to form as many whole words as possible. He then receives one point (red disc) for each whole word. First player to fifteen wins. If the spinner points to "Hit or Miss", the player draws one of those cards and follows the instructions.

86887.description:
