Fidchess Qenqe is an attempt to modify Fidchess so that it works for more than two players, with additional changes to make it a different game. Qenqe is five in proto-Celtic.

Number of players: 2–5

Object of the game: Be the first player to capture an opponent's Rigant, or causes an opponent to be reduced to only controlling Rigant (because all their disks are in stacks of other players or off the board).
Getting Started

Equipment: Stonehenge board, using all 30 spaces of outer track, and is considered four spaces wide for this game. All 50 disks in the game. All 5 non-neutral figures (Rigants).

Ending the Game

Once a player has either captured an opponent's Rigant, or causes an opponent to be reduced to only controlling Rigant (because all their disks are in stacks of other players or off the board), the player wins the game.

89658.description: Similar to Monopoly but with added elements. Players can take out loans and there are opportunities to "cheat" the other players or raid their properties. You roll and move around a board like Monopoly and land on businesses, but there is also a secondary track called the high-roller track.

86262.description:
This game is operational level wargame based on Japanese warring states period. Uesugi Kenshin who was the best war commander of this period died in history in April 1578. But, he is the supposition that it didn't die with this game.

Each troop organized by one or more unit.
The game repeats the game turn. Each game turn divided for two player turn. Each player turn include Movement phase, none active side reaction movement phase, Force march phase and combat phase. All unit can move in movement phase, but required pass activity check in reaction and force march phase. Combat result by fire power CRT and two dice.

Victor of the games is decide by victory points. The victory point is provided by the capture of the castle, the removal of the enemy units and unit in Kyoto, is capital of Japan.
86262.name: Kenshin Joraku

91596.description: RoboDerby: Express - 3rd Wheel is an expansion to the Print-and-Play game "RoboDerby: Express". It adds a 3rd player and 5 boards with new elements.

87501.description:
This is a new game about Romania, a trivia game for your family and friends to enjoy.

There are 400 cards with a total of 2400 questions about Romania, covering 6 areas: history, culture, science, sports, geography and misc.

Contents:

- 400 cards with 2400 questions and answers;
- the board;
- 6 pawns;
- 6 puzzle pieces;
- 1 dice;
- rules.

Roll the die to see from what category you will get your question. Once you answer one correct question from a category, you receive one puzzle piece. The first one to give a correct answer to a question from every category will make up Romania from the 6 puzzle pieces and win the game.

Be the first to find out how well you know your country, learn new things and have fun!

83408.description:
From the back of the box:

It's Noddy's birthday and he's having a party! He's going to town to buy all the things he needs. He must hurry, though. Sly & Gobbo, those Toyland troublemakers, will try to buy the party goods first, and ruin Noddy's plans.

Young players move the game figures around the board, collecting objects to fill shopping lists. The colorful chance cards require no reading or number skills, and the simple rules allow for a perfect first board game experience!

Duration of play: about 10 minutes per game.

User Summary:

The first player to collect all the objects on their shopping list and return Noddy to his birthday party wins the game. It's a race against time, however, because if Sly & Gobbo finish their shopping list first, they ruin the party for everyone!

83410.description:
The New Catholic Catechism Learning System.

(from the back of the box)

Designed for Roman Catholics.
The Catholic Catechism Learning System was created by religious educators as a teaching tool for the home, the parish and the classroom...and it's here for you NOW. Your family (youth over ten years old and adults) will forever enjoy learning and sharing their Catholic faith.

The questions and answers contained in this game were composed by a Catholic theologian and inspired by the Catechism of the Catholic Church. Ask your religious education director about the unique advantages of this family learning system for reinforcing knowledge of the Catholic faith!

83411.description:
From the introduction:"One Ring Chess is played upon a field of 32 linearly adjacent squares formed into a ring. The game is won by checkmating the opponent King."

This is a linear chess variant, played on a half-sized board. The "Lord of the Rings" theme of the game points up the byzantine nature of this circular chessboard. Rooklike moves are translated directly to the board. Diagonal moves are translated as jumps, moving by staying always on the same color and hopping over squares of the other color. A full set of pieces and 4 pawns each, coupled with the board's two 1-square wide avenues of approach, offer a good range of chess tactics.

87508.description:
Battle Beast is the game player gather Beast warrior and fight other players

Game Play : Every one draw 5 cards from the same deck. When in their turn, They must form a team of beast warriors to attack another player and may play only one tactic card from their hand per turn. The defender may play one tactic cards and form a team of beast warrior from his hand to defend. If the Attacker win He claim VP equal to 1 + (different in number of beast warriors) and kill all defending warrior. If the defender win nothing happen and pass to next player turn

Goal : When 2 players are out of VP the game end and Who got the most VP win the game

87509.description:
A funny board game for 2 to 4 players.

Each player chooses the colour of his pawn and rolls a dice, then he moves his pawn. When he steps on the place with the blue circle, there’s something happening (good or bad, for example the player is missing his turn). On the red circles nothing happens. The winner of the game is the person who first will reach the place with the bears' house.

87511.description:
Goal: to build a 30x30 cm square using rectangular pieces of different colors while avoiding pieces of the same color to touch themselves.

Gameplay: The pieces are evenly distribute between the players. The first player puts one of his pieces over the table. The other players do the same, trying to build a square. Pieces of the same color cannot touch each other(horizontally, vertically or diagonally). The winner is, either the player that puts his last piece or, if there aren´t a possible move, the player that has fewe pieces left.

87514.description:
Goal: the attacking army (red) must occupy the throne (central position of the board). The defending army (yellow) must eliminate all pieces of the attacking army.

Gameplay: The pieces are distributed over the board following pre-configured positions: the defending army around the central position and the attacking army at the border. The red army starts the game, each player can move one piece per turn. A piece can be moved to any other adjacent empty space. During the game, the central piece can be used by the yellow army. The captures are made the same way as checkers. After a capture the same player continues playing as long as he can capture other pieces.

83420.description:
Zig Zag is a racing game using shared pieces but with the players having hidden goals. Each player is given a card that shows the order in which they want the pieces to finish the race. During the game, players take turns moving the three coloured markers on the game board. A turn consists of moving any piece on the board. The space on which this piece lands will dictate the next piece to move, and how. This continues until the forced movement is impossible, and then the next player takes a turn.

The game ends when two pieces make it to the finish line. The player holding the results card showing the order of finish wins!
83420.name: Zig Zag

87524.description:
After the latest rains, several colonies of ants are trapped by water. Should cooperate in building a bridge that allow them to leave, but without neglecting their familys. Must go to search of food, materials and to extend their anthill, care for the larvae, feed ants and defend against attacks from other insects. The best Developer colony will take the victory.

The players handled their own colony of workers and warriors, and will have to face all these challenges, carefully choose the most beneficial actions and learn to manage their ants, both the workers who are those will go for food and materials, and the warriors, which will give you protection against insects. You'll get victory points for contributions to the construction of the bridge, the good behaviour of your warriors, as well as at the end of the game for having the best developed colony.


Tras las ultimas lluvias, varias colonias de hormigas se encuentran atrapadas por el agua. Deben colaborar en la construccion de un vado que les permita salir, pero sin descuidar a su familia. Deberan ir en busca de materiales y alimento, ampliar su hormiguero, cuidar de las larvas, alimentar a las hormigas y defenderse de los ataques de otros insectos. La colonia mas trabajadora y mejor desarrollada se llevara la victoria.

Los jugadores manejaran su propia colonia de obreras y guerreras, y tendran que enfrentarse a todos estos desafios, elegir cuidadosamente las acciones mas beneficiosas y saber administrar sus hormigas, tanto las obreras que son las que iran por comida y materiales, como las guerreras, que te daran defensa contra los insectos. Conseguiras puntos de victoria por los aportes a la construccion del puente, por lo bien que se hayan portado tus guerreras, asi como al final del juego por tener la Colonia mejor desarrollada.

91623.description:
Take Me to the Cleaner$ is a hilarious board game promoting bonding and togetherness between couples.
1 to 4 couples can play this game with each couple playing "directly" and "only" against their own spouse/partner, not other players on the board. There must be one winner from each couple. The men in the game are known as "Tycoons" and the women are known as "Divas. "

Players roll the dice to advance around both sections of the game board. The outer ring is the "reality" portion of the game and there are three repeating squares that require a card draw with different tasks. The center ring is the "fantasy" portion and there you roll the dice to acquire ownership of the 20 "Matrimonial Assets". If you land on your own asset, you're safe. Landing on an unowned asset gives you ownership of that asset. If you land on an asset owned by your partner, you must hand over an asset of their choice.

To win the game, you must be the first player between you and your partner to accumulate the 20 Matrimonial Assets. Winning allows you to choose up to 3 tasks or consequences (from the Oops cards) for your partner to perform in real life the following week!

Components:

Game Board & Dice
Bride and Groom Tokens
Matrimonial Asset Cards
65 Busted Cards
65 Tycoon Oops Cards
65 Diva Oops Cards
65 Splitsville Cards
Pad of 20 Pledge Sheets
Rules and Definitions

91624.description: This new board game offers a innovative approach to teaching relationship skills - one that’s highly informative, research based and great fun. The game uses role playing and realistic scenarios to help players experience the dynamics of their life choices. With a toss of the dice, players move around the board, facing options about money, education, work, romantic and sexual activity, lifestyles, children and more! Just as in real life, each decision carries consequences which affect emotional and financial well-being all based on independent research. Winning is determined by how many good relationship decisions are made in the game, not by luck or money.

83538.description:
Got a hankerin' to enter town with a different pack full of money, materials, and cowboys? Then welcome at Carson City - a New Beginning!

This expansion gives you exactly what the title suggests: a new way to begin the fantastic boardgame Carson City. Fine tune your own setup. Choose between more money, roads, cowboys, or revolvers…and be prepared to get some great new special powers, like the Marksman or Influential Connections.
83538.name: Carson City: A New Beginning

91635.description:
In Rock Star Rehab, the board game, you can pretend to participate in all the same activities your favourite rock stars do on television or in the tabloid magazines.

With simple dice rolls, you can imagine yourself partying at exclusive night clubs, VIP house parties, and even going to jail. The goal of the game is to persevere your way through Rock Star rehab.

83445.description:
7 Wonders: Manneken Pis – first available as a promotional item at Spiel 2010, then distributed later via the BGG Store and Spielbox – is a wonder that can be used with the 7 Wonders base game in order for players to have more choices of wonders available to them.

Unlike the wonders included with the base game, Manneken Pis produces no resource of its own, instead giving its owner more money at the start of the game. One side of this wonder allows its owner to copy specific levels found on neighboring wonder cards, while the other side consists of a single level that requires one of each resource for a single huge payoff in power, points, and the purse.

Reimplemented by


7 Wonders: Wonder Pack

91638.description:
Olympic tennis, features complete data for all olympic tennis tournaments from 1984 onward. There are data for both singles and doubles, men and women tournaments. The system is a derivation of the one used in Head to Head tennis (TCS), but without cards for each single player.
Basically, after tossing a coin to decide who's to serve, roll a percentage dice on the service value of the player involved, and if the result is in the correct range, he wins the game. Otherwise, the chance to win the game passes to the opponent, that rolls on his Return value. If both players fails, game goes checking other values, until one player wins the game.
There are special rules for tie-break and a random event table, that may strongly modify the result of a game, a set or even the entire match.

The game comes as a pdf of 28 pages and it is sold directly by Roberto Chiavini (pumaye@gmail.com to contact

87545.description:
Krampus,the dark twin to that jolly elf Santa Claus, is tired of his diminished and secondary role in the Christmas holiday, and has booby-trapped Santa's sleigh. The sleigh has flown off on it's own and now it is a race: Krampus is out to ruin everyone's night by stealing gifts and Santa is trying to retreive the sleigh and deliver the presents.
The board consists of eighteen areas, the north and south poles which are the base points for the Santa and Krumpus players. The sleigh is placed in the center of the board. The game includes three dice, hand painted with both numbers and the following symbols:
1,2 :footprints
3,4 :sleigh
5 :a spring
6 :a hand
and on one die, a three is an asterisk, representing a wild face. The game may be played with normal dice, but one 3 face must be marked to represent the wild symbol.
Setup continues by rolling the dice six times (3d6) and laying cubes that represent the gift targets on the resulting spaces, which are numbered from 3-18 (1 and 2 are the poles, and will never have gift targets placed on them.)
The dice and the player's tokens are manipulated using the dice. Each turn the player may roll 3 times, keeping a die or two each time. If a die is kept, it must be used at the end of rolling, there is no deciding to reroll later. Whatever is rolled on the third roll is kept and used.
Keep on footprint to move one space, two to move three spaces, and keep three footprints to move four spaces. Movement is orthogonal only, never diagonal.
Keep one sleigh to move the sleign one space orthogonally, two to move three, three to move hour. In addition, if the player's token is in the same space as the sleigh, you must roll two sleighs to board the sleigh. Once on the sleigh, the sleigh is moved with either footprints or sleighs (not a combination of both, though you may wait until the end of the third roll to decide which you will use to move the sleigh.) Move the sleigh to bring it closer to you, or to keep the other player from intercepting it. The sleigh may not be moved remotely if the other player is riding it.
Roll and keep three springs to eject a player riding the sleigh back to his or her base. (In variant play, any gifts on the sleigh at this point remain aboard) While unlikely, it is possible to eject yourself from the sleigh if you roll all three dice three times and it pops up. If so, too bad, back to base with yourself!
If on the sleigh and in the same space as a package, roll and keep two hands to deliver the package as Santa or steal the package as the Krampus. In either case, place the package in your base as a point.
The wild symbol may substitute for any other in the above combinations.

Winner is player to pick up the most gift tokens when the last one is picked up, ties going to Santa, because it's Christmas, after all.

Variant Challenge 1: To 'win' a gift and get the point, you must return to your base with it (no roll required to drop it)

Variant Challenge 2: Use Variant Challenge 1, but the other player may also steal gifts from your base, and the winner is the first to get ALL the gifts.

83450.description:
The game consists of a number of interlockable game pieces, each with two or three connection points. The pieces are double sided, with one side to be used for younger children and the other side to be used with older children. The side for younger players contains pictures of Disney characters. The side for older players contains word fragments that can be matched up to form words.

Each player starts with the same number of game pieces, and an additional piece is laid in the center of the play area. Starting with the youngest player, each player in turn links a piece from their hand to a piece already in play. If a player is not able play, that player draws a piece from the supply of unused pieces, and may play the new piece if able. In either case, play then passes to the next player. The first player to run out of game pieces is the winner.

name.#text: My Friends Tigger & Pooh Word Builder Game

83453.description:
Best of British Game Rules
A game for 2 teams of any number or 2-6 individual players.

The Team Game is great when you have a mix of younger and older players. It makes best use of everybody's knowledge. The individual game is great if you want to be more competitive.

CONTENTS:
Best of British Playing Board
400 Best of British Question Cards
6 Playing pieces

TEAM RULES
PREPARING TO PLAY
Unfold the board and lay it on the table. Each team selects a playing piece and places it on the Start Space on the board.

Split the players into two teams. The oldest player in each team will become the first Question Master for their team. The team containing the youngest player will start.

THE QUESTIONS
There are four questions on the back of each card. The first question is beside the Red Square followed by the White, Blue and Green.

There are three kinds of question cards:

Picture cards - on which there is a picture that the questions relate to.

Common Theme Cards - on which all the answers have a common theme.

Pot Luck Cards - on which there are random Best of British questions.

THE BOARD
The board is a path from the outer Start space into the Winning Zone in the centre of the board. The spaces on the board are made up of the four different colours that match those on the Question Cards. The first four spaces on the board match the order of those on the cards.

After the first four spaces the colour order becomes random so just answering one question correctly can sometimes mean a big leap forward.

PLAY
The Question Master for the team containing the youngest player picks up the first Question Card from the box making sure the answers are concealed from all the players on both teams.

If it is a Picture Card, the picture is shown to all the players on both teams. If it is a Themed Card, the theme is read out to all the players on both teams.

The Question Master reads out the Red Question to the opposing team. If that team answers correctly they move their piece onto the first Red Space on the board. The same team is then given the White Question, moving their piece onto the White Space if they answer correctly and so on down the card.

If at anytime a question is answered incorrectly then the Question Master can put the same question to the members of their own team for a bonus move. If they answer correctly they move their own piece onto the next space on the board that matches the colour of the question. The original team is always given the first chance to answer each question. After the Green Question has been played the card is placed to the back of the card box.

The Question Master for the other team now takes out the next card from the box and plays the card to their opponents in the same way.

The two teams take alternate turns at being the Question Master and also alternate the roll of Question Master within their team.

When any team answers a question correctly and there are no spaces left matching that colour left on the path, they move their piece directly into the Winning Zone.

WINNING ZONE
Once inside the Winning Zone a team no longer moves their piece after answering a question correctly. The first team to answer any bonus question correctly after having entered the Winning Zone wins.

INDIVIDUAL PLAY
The oldest player becomes Question Master for the first game and asks the first card to the player on their left. The bonus opportunity for any incorrect answer passes firstly to the next player to the left and so on. The order of play then continues in a clockwise direction.

Source: Publisher's Website

91646.description: Wordopoly: the game that won't leave you speechless! Circle the board and encounter foreign words, abbreviations, clichés, pithy humor, and vocabulary words from English classes of past. Does "magnanimous" mean full of spite or generous and noble? Answer correctly and advance towards the spelling bee. The first player to acquire a complete set of word definitions wins the game! This game is a great way to fall in love with language. The 770 vocabulary words included in the game are historically found with the highest frequency on the verbal portions of standardized tests such as the SAT, adding function to its fun.

87552.description:
T’was 9 minutes to takeoff and all round the castle,
Elves were scurrying about dealing with hassles.
Bernard, the head elf, screamed out in fear,
4 undone tasks might cancel Christmas this year.
“9 minutes ‘til Christmas! You, you, you and you,
Listen to me now, I will tell you what to do.
Get 4 bolts to repair Santa’s sleigh,
It can’t land on rooftops with a broken runner, OK?
Get 24 cups of flour to the baker right now,
Some of the Gingerbread men were mistakenly shipped to Fuzhou.
8 golden bells from the reindeer harness are missing,
Please get this fixed before the Big Man has a hissy.
From Santa’s red coat, 4 buttons are lost,
We must find and replace them, whatever the cost.
These things must be done, but a bad storm is near.
If we can’t do them all in 9 minutes, there will be NO Christmas this year!”
Ready for the challenge, the team sprang to its work. . .

9 Minutes to Takeoff is a cooperative game for 2 – 4 people, ages 8 – Adult, lasting 30 to 60 minutes. This game was designed as an entry in the BoardGameGeek.com 2010 Christmas Print and Play Game contest.

Your team of North Pole denizens must work together to prevent the greatest tragedy of all time: No Christmas. A blizzard is heading for the North Pole and snow is making certain areas impassible. To win you must work together as a group to clear the snow around Santa’s Castle so that you can complete the four required tasks and return to the castle by flying reindeer before time runs out. If however, the countdown clock runs out before you can complete your tasks, there will be no Christmas and Everyone, Everywhere will lose.

91051.description:
This small volume contains twelve scenarios to accompany the von Reisswitz Kriegsspiel
Rules and the Meckel Map. In addition to the basic scenarios initial orders are also provided
for the Red side in each case.
The idea behind supplying orders for one side is that it might allow a gamer who, through
circumstance or design, is gaming solo. The importance of a considered plan of action in
Kriegsspiel means that this can provide for an interesting game, seeing how ones
theoretical plans work out on the map.

89686.description:
Track & Field Math is a game for children in grades 6 to 8 that uses a sports theme. It can be used to review for tests, brush up on a specific topic, or just for family fun.

There are eight "events" like the 100 meter dash, the pole vault, or the discus. Players roll dice to participate in the events and the first player to finish must answer the math question. Correct answers give the player a medal. The contestant with the highest medal total is declared the winner.

Includes a colorful board, 4 pawns, 120 question cards, a die, rules, score sheet, and a storage insert.

83462.description:
It is a race where the first pirate ship that reaches the island Gral is the winner. On the trip you meet different hazards such as pirate attacks, hurricanes and bad food.

This game is put in the world of Kaptein Sabeltann and came with the children’s magazine "kaptain Sabeltann nr 5 2010"

The game is a typical roll and move game, where you must follow the instructions on the square you land on. This could be miss a turn or taking a short cut in the same manner as snakes and ladders.

name.#text: Reisen til den forheksede øya Gral

91655.description:
In Arschbombe – German for "cannonball" – players make cards "dive" from their hand into a swimming pool comprised of cards.

To start the game, players create a swimming pool via a ring of scoring cards, with more cards in the ring for more players. Each player has six swimmer cards, three "rascals" who want to cannonball other swimmers and three divers. The pool is seeded with one swimmer during set-up.

On a turn, a player chooses one swimmer card and decides whether to take a normal jump or a special jump. For the normal jump, the player stands, holds the card at eye level, then drops it onto the playing area. A diver scores points if it touches no other swimmer cards, with more points being awarded if the diver jumps later in the game. A rascal must try to "splash" a swimmer identified by the player's left-hand neighbor. If the rascal doesn't touch this card, the player scores no points; if it does, the player scores 1-3 points depending on how successful the splash is.

For a special jump, the player must hold the card over the head (for a diver) or toss the card while sitting (for a rascal). If a swimmer card touches the edge of the pool or falls completely outside the pool, the player loses 1-2 points.

The player with the most points after everyone's had a turn in the pool wins.

87562.description:
PvP is a quick 20-30 min, 2 player fantasy card game where players use teams of combatants to try to be the last man standing!
The game is easy to learn and play, offers many interesting challenges and replayability.

The objective of the game is to wipe out all of the opponent's characters. Each character can only take a certain amount of damage.
Each turn, players roll 6 Six-sided die three times, keeping any number of die between each roll. At the end of the third roll, players assign dice to characters they control. Each character has abilities which correspond to specific die combinations. (Eg. Fireball requires a straight, a strike requires a pair, etc...)

Characters are divided into teams which provide special bonuses if at least 2 members of the same team are present. Each of the 12 characters possess unique abilities. Advanced rules allow for customization of character teams, allowing endless re-playability!

For more info on motivation behind the game, head over to
http://www.indiegogo.com/PvP-A-card-and-dice-iOS-game?a=4762...

87564.description: From the back of the box: Wheel and deal your way to a fortune even faster using debit cards instead of cash! All it takes is a card swipe for money to change hands. Now you can collect rent, buy properties and pay fines -- all with the touch of a button! It's a new way to play the family classic that's been brought up-to-date with higher property values and Taiwan's hot spots.

83470.description:
This game is named after Alex Randolph and jointly published by the Europäische Spielesammlergilde and the Spieleautorenzunft. The game has been announced for Essen 2010.
The cards show famous game designers and the games they designed. The number of game cards for each designer varies; the goal in this memory style game is to collect as many games from a given designer as possible.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

91664.description:
Auf die Birne is a counting, memory and reaction game played with a deck of 60 windfall cards – each showing some combination of apple, pear and grubs – and 20 harvest cards.

In one of the two games included, players shuffle all 80 cards, then deal equal amounts of cards to each player. One at a time, players take turns revealing a card from their deck and adding it to a face-up pile. Whenever a harvest card appears – which will show either apples, pears or grubs – players race to grab numbered tokens in the center of the table. Each player with a token then says how many of the depicted item are shown on the cards in the central pile. Whoever is correct (or closest) wins the harvest card. The stack is cleared, then the game continues. Whoever collects the most harvest cards wins.

In the second game, each player has two harvest cards face-up before him and a deck of windfall cards. Now players are trying to slap the deck when any of the three items appears at least 11 times in the pile. If the slapper is correct, he wins a harvest card; if not, he loses one of those in front of him. Again, the player with the most harvest cards wins.
91664.name: Auf die Birne

91666.description: This take on bocce, aka lawn bowling, gives players soft, flexible balls that will be kind to materials within your house, allowing for indoor games on the stairs, at a bookcase, or wherever else you might think to throw the target ball. Throw the right way in Crossboule, and you can earn bonus points; whoever wins two sets of 13 points first wins the game.
91666.name: Crossboule

87572.description:
from Publisher blurb

Sorry Sliders Pocket Game - Aim, slide and score your way to victory! Set out the double-sided discs and slide your pawns to hit just the right mark. But watch out your opponent could knock you out of your perfect spot! Hit the points zones to start racking them up and avoid the danger zones, where your score could slide down to zero. Test your skill on the easy side of the discs first and then flip them over for an even bigger challenge! When your game is done, pack up your pawns and discs into the carry-case and take your sliding skills on the go.

Sorry Sliders Pocket Game includes:
6 pawns
5 Double-sided play-discs
Carry-case
Instructions

83477.description:
From the rules found on pg 15 of this document, a document with citations by Nader Daoud Daou (made free by the author for non-commercial distribution).

The game is a traditional Japanese game of the chess family which can be played with an international chess set. It is of the shogi branch of the chess family but does not involve drops. Set-up is on the back row identical to international chess except that king is placed on the center left column for either player so that kings are not facing each other. Pawn however occupy the third rather than the second row.

For simplicity, I'm using the international chess names of pieces rather than the traditional Japanese names. The king moves one space in any direction but castling does not exist. The queen moves one space in any direction except diagonally backwards. Bishops move either one space diagonally in any direction or one space forward. Knights move only forward in an otherwise normal knight's move so that the piece jumps to a space on either side of the space two rows ahead of its starting position. Rooks move only forward but otherwise like a standard rook. Pawns move only one space forward with no initial two-step move, and all pieces including pawns capture as they move.

The promotion zone is the last three rows on the board for either player. All pieces except the king and queen promote to the queen. Promotion is optional so long as a piece still has a legal move in its non-promoted state. The promotion happens at the end of the move and the move must either begin or end in the promotion zone.

The object is to check-mate the opponent's king. Both bared king and stalemate count as a win, but a bared king becomes a draw if the other player can bare one's king in the next move.

91671.description:
In the dice game Da ist der Wurm drin, players want to be the first to have their worm poke its head out of the compost heap at the end of the garden.

To set up the game board, attach a smaller game board with two slots in it to the larger game board on which the worms will crawl. The first slot has a row of daisies by it, while the second slot has a row of strawberries. Each player chooses a color, and places the worm head of that color in the appropriate track on the game board.

On a turn, a player rolls the die, then places the appropriately colored worm section into the track holding his worm. The worm sections come in six colors and range from 1 cm to 6 cm long. On any turn, a player can place her daisy (or strawberry) tile above the worm that she thinks will reach the daisies (or strawberries) first. If that worm does indeed poke its head into view through the slot before any other, then that player can add the daisy (or strawberry) tile to her own worm. (Choose wrong, and you discard your tile.)

The first worm to poke its head out from under the far edge of the smaller game board wins. For a longer game, players can keep their worms going until one stretches its head off the edge of the larger game board.
91671.name: Da ist der Wurm drin

83480.description:
Source is rules found on pgs 17-17 of this document by Nader Daoud Daou (2007).

Although this is the game from which modern Shogi is believed to have directly derived, the game are distinctly different if the following respects. Sho shogi has no drop mechanism. All pieces used in modern shogi are used in sho shogi and have the same movements and initial positions, but sho shogi also has one additional piece with respect to the modern game-- the drunken elephant which promotes to a crown prince and begins the game directly in front of the "king" (osho or gyokusho). The drunken elephant moves one space in any direction except directly backwards, and the crown prince moves exactly like a king because it is a second king. Namely both the crown prince and the king must be bared, checkmated and/or stalemated simultaneously to win. Baring counting as a draw only if one's own king can be bared the next move.

91673.description:
From the back cover:

"The fury that was the Fourth Succession War crippled Wolf's Dragoons forces but not their will to survive. After taking the full brunt of House Kurita's wrath, Jaime Wolf turned to Natasha Kerensky, the notorious Black Widow, for help in rebuilding his devastated mercenary unit. Under her ruthless command, the Dragoon's Black Widows returned to deadly form.

Now the entire Inner Sphere is locked in a life or death struggle against a seemingly invincible invader known as the Clans. Some say that only the Black Widow and her men could triumph against these invaders. But Natasha Kerensky no longer fights for the Inner Sphere. Now she fights for the glory of the Clans!

More Tales Of The Black Widow chronicles Natasha Kerensky's unit's service during the Marik Civil War, the War of '39, and her latest role with Clan Wolf. This scenario pack describes 16 of the Widow's most critical battles. Also included are detailed unit rosters, personnel files, and BattleMech readouts that give the truest picture yet of the Inner Sphere's most feared mercenary commander."

This scenario pack follows on from Tales Of The Black Widow Company and provides 19 assorted pre-prepared BattleTech scenarios.

name.#text: BattleTech: More Tales Of The Black Widow

83483.description:
User Summary:

Using clues given on each of the game cards, players place nine teddy bear markers of three different colours in their proper spaces. The clues offer rules for the particular game card. For example, the clues may state that a blue bear sits after a red bear, or that a green bear cannot sit after a blue bear. The players, then, must use logic in order to solve the card.

There are eleven different puzzles included in the box.

The game can be played solo, cooperative or competitively. In the competitive mode, players divide the bears amongst themselves. On a turn, the player will roll the colour die and may place a bear of that colour on the puzzle. Making a wrong placement results in a two turn penalty. The player to correctly place his last bear on the puzzle wins.

87580.description:
“There is no doubt that the simultaneous deaths of the personal doctor of the Empire’s ambassador to the City of Gnomes, a dwarven merchant named Nuñez y Carazil, who owned a canton in Amidawa, and Timur ibn Sallah, an astonian burglar serving a sentence in the Morning City have not occurred by pure chance. As we will show here, though nothing obvious points to that conclusion, the three were acquaintances and exchanged coded letters often. Whoever decided to eliminate them, not only learned of this connection, but also had the resources to strike in three different places of the Universe at once. We know then, that we are dealing with two covert organisations: one to which the deceased belonged to, and another which performed the executions. We also know that at least one of them does not stop short of murder.
- Aldobrandino di Gato Nero, “The Chronicle of the War of Shadows”

CrystalicuM - Krzysztalowa Gra Karciana (Polish for Crystal Card Game, abbreviated KGK) is a Polish CCG, set in a 'fantasy/ space opera/ steampunk' universe and with anime/manga like art. The universe is also developed in a Polish role-playing game of the same name.

In the Known Universe there are many secret conflicts, wars and alliances. Secret brotherhoods fight each other, and for them, interstellar powers are only a tokens in the eternal game. The fate of the Universe and its unaware inhabitants rests upon you.

The Second Edition started in november 2010.

87581.description:
"Politburo, Lucha de Poder" (Politburo, Power Struggle) is an ironic card game about the struggle happened after the Russian Revolution of 1917, to become the General Secretary of the Communist Party and guide the URRS into a new era.

Players try to guide their three candidates in a dangerous ascension against the Politburo charges, with the aim of become the General Secretary of the Communist Party. The players have to play diferent kind of cards to increase their candidates loyality and health and to decrease their opponents ones.

Players can enjoy role playing their candidate's actions (that results from the cards played), ruining the plans of the other candidates and for example calling them names like "antisovietic" or "traitor" at the same time that you use difamation cards to reduce your opponents loyality and maybe to send them into a Siberian Gulag. You can also use agresion cards to reduce their life points until you kill them.

Everithing is allowed to become the General Secretary of the Party.

83486.description:
Kursk Campaign, a computer game of Operation Zitadelle, summer 1943.

Kursk Campaign is a command oriented study of the battle, the greatest tank confrontation in history. The Axis player must cut into the bulging Soviet line and destroy any trapped Red forces. The Soviet player must brunt the attack with defense in depth and attrite the Axis into defeat. The game includes 2 sets of playing pieces and simulation maps for both players. The computer will act as a player for either side. Scenarios include both early and late Axis offensive start dates.

Design by Stephen St. John, development by S. Newberg and art by J. Kula. Disk for Apple II or IBM PC systems.

87583.description: Tabletop space combat game. Rules involve miniatures, tape measures, a decent amount of space in which to play, and other typical miniatures-based game stuff. From the publisher's page: "150 million years ago, the Surakari launched a surprise attack on the Heragul Empire. In a matter of a few weeks, half a dozen star systems had fallen to the Surakari. Now, the Minex system has come under attack. These seven planets provide critical fuel and material resources for the Heragul Empire. The Minex system must be defended at all costs. This is where the war really begins."

name.#text: Legends of Kalidasia: Rise of the Surakari

87584.description:
User summary:

The adventure of Hayabusa is a co-operative card game for 1–4 players. The space probe Hayabusa has just fetched samples from another planet and is journeying back to Earth, when trouble after trouble occurs. The players play the roles of the crew and the mission is to overcome the problems and guide Hayabusa back to the Earth safely. All players draw cards from the same deck, and discuss which cards to add to the deck, all the while problem cards are gradually added to the deck.

Designed by Makoto Nakamura, the designer of Gashbell the Card Battle.
87584.name: The Adventure of Hayabusa

87585.description:
Miniature game recreating a buoy race with flying/hovering vehicles (like the ones featured in Wip3out videogame, or Podracers from Star Wars Episode I). Vehicles can be equipped with weapons, and victory coul be achieved by being the fastest racer, or the last one still in game.

It was published on #3 of french magazine Ravage (February/March 2001).

91682.description:
(Working Title- Unpublished Prototype)

Overview
In this game players take the roles of the "Great Houses" of the land. Over the course of several generations, those in power change. Players try to influence succession and match their House's resources to the interests of the True Power in the land (often not the actual monarch). By adding new family branches, using carefully arranged marriages, and managing grants players raise their prestige in the hopes of seizing power after the inevitable downfall of the monarchy.

Basic Play
Each player has a house display representing their larger political family. BRANCHES make up that family, beginning the game with a same number of small family branches. Each branch is represented by a card with a branch name and spaces for GRANTS. Grants represent offices, industries, resources, contacts and so on which that part of the family has control of. There are six kinds of grants: Influence (INFL) which generates the currency for play and the five areas of control: Activism (ACT), Intellectual (INT), Religion (REL), Society (SOC) and Warfare (WAR). Grants, represented by tiles, can move around throughout the game. Some branches may also have special abilities which allow special actions or modify the values of the grants attached to them.

During each turn, players may add a new branch to their House Display. Since they only may have five branches at a time, they will eventually have to Marry or merge two of those houses, creating a new branch. Each turn players gain currency in the form of influence, bid to add a branch, support those in power, and take actions. Some actions can always be taken, while others require the use of particular grant types. At the end of the turn, players check to see which Royal currently holds sway in the realm. Players score VPs based on the interests of that Royal and how well their various branches and grants match those.

91683.description:
From the back cover:

"Maximilian Liao offered Anton Marik two things: his daughter in marriage and the assassination of Anton's brother, Captain-General Janos Marik. To win the throne, Anton agreed, and the Free Worlds League plunged into a devastating civil war...

His work done, Maximilian Liao just sat back and smiled.

Although perceived as the weakest Successor State, House Liao's Capellan Confederation is still a wily, treacherous, and formidable foe. Ruthlessly dominated by the cunning Maximilian Liao, the Confederation schemes to pick up the pieces of the shattered Inner Sphere and declare itself leader of a new Star League.

From their tremendous library containing the knowledge of the universe, ComStar has compiled this dossier on House Liao and the Capellan Confederation. Included are dozens of full-color illustrations depicting Confederation personalities, daily life, and military regalia. Classified documents on Confederation armed forces, the Warrior Houses, military structure, and political intrigues are also provided. In addition, the large history chapter stretches from Franco Liao's unification of the Confederation to Maximilian Liao's devious plotting to control the Inner Sphere.

The rulers of the other Successor States do not consider Liao a threat - Maximilian Liao just sits back and smiles."

83492.description:
Privacy - Scharf wie Chili is an expansion for Privacy or Privacy 2.

It contains 200 completely new questions about morals and "interpersonal topic #1".

Privacy - Scharf wie Chili can also be played as a travel game with up to 6 players.

87589.description:
From the FFG Website:

"Oksana is a former Archimandrite, defeated at the hands of the reincarnated god that she refused to bow to. Now she’s back to cause a split within the Matriarchy, the powerful faction introduced in the Operation Novgorod expansion. Just as likely to side with the Union as she is with the Matriarcy on her path to vengeance, Oksana is a powerful ally or a dangerous foe, depending on where you stand in her eyes.

Oksana utilizes the mechanical drones known as Voïvodes, which are utilized heavily in Operation Novgorod. These Voïvodes operate under Oksana’s control, doing her bidding without hesitation.

Oksana comes complete with a detailed pre-painted figure of Oksana Gusarenko, two pre-painted Voïvode miniatures, two character sheets, and tokens for all of her equipment. Oksana has the ability to field two Voïvodes when she is chosen as a hero. Players wishing to utilize Oksana’s technological talents must replace one of their Troopers with her two Voïvodes. She cannot be used on the same team as Zor’ka from the Operation Novgorod expansion.

In addition to these components, Oksana also comes with a rulebook featuring a custom scenario that sends her into Reich territory on a quest to recover lost documents."

88855.description:
Roll and Move game similar to Mensch ärgere dich nicht (Ludo)
Each player has 4 money pawns in one color (green, red, yellow or blue). Each monkey has a differnt tails in one of the four colors (green, red, yellow, blue).
There are four starting spaces and the monkeys start at their matching tail color and the goal spaces are also color coded for the tails.
You throw not only by landing on another pawn but also by overtaking.
Banana spaces are safe. And two monkey of the same color on one space are blocking.
The best: The six is worth 12 points and you can reroll, but 3 "6" in a row: you loose all pawns to the start, but 4 "6" in a row safes and 5 rolls of a "6" in a row is winning the game immediately.

85706.description: Based on a popular Swedish TV game-show, in a new version including a DVD. The DVD contains questions in the form of film and commentary by TV host Ingvar Oldsberg. The players try to guess the name of a destination based on images from a traveling train or car, while Ingvar gives increasingly more obvious hints. Once a destination is revealed there are more questions about it's local culture or history.

87603.description:
Escaping the T-Rex

From the back of thebox:
A hungry T-Rex tracked down a small Dromaesaurus and since he runs a lot faster then the small Dromaesaurus, they have to be more clever then him to escape. A cooperative game to train the concentration.

Each player gets a hand of cards.
Players add to the track if they have matching cards to move the Dromaesaurus, all matching cards in their hands are played on their turn adding cards to the track. If they don't have matching cards they can ask 1 other player if they have the other card of the pair.
The T-Rex is moved by rolling a 0-1-2 dice. Since the T-Rex starts on a T-Rex only part of the track he is a bit behind, but if he is lucky he can catch up on the Dromaesaurus and win the game. If the Dromaesaurus is not caught when all cards are played the game is won by the players.

Components:
12 T-Rex route cards
40 escape cards
2 playing pieces with stands
1 0-1-2 dice

The game is part of the T-RexWorld line of Die Spiegelburg.
87603.name: Escaping the T-Rex

89694.description:
This Monopoly variant was published as a fundraiser for the Taft High School (Lincoln City, OR) 2009 Senior Class. The board features local businesses from Otis, Neotsu, Lincoln City, Glenden Beach, Lincoln Beach, and Depoe Bay instead of the traditional properties.

Houses and Hotels are replaced with green and red 'customer' chips. Chance and Community Chest cards are renamed as Fate and Beachcombing cards. Other non-property spaces on the board are also renamed (Loading Zone instead of Free Parking, etc) and each feature the name and logo of a local business. Money features the Chinook Winds Casino Resort name and logo, playing pieces match the 'monopolist' pieces from Anti-Monopoly.

87608.description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

In the early summer of 1898, the United States embarked on war with Spain. The Spanish actually declared war first, but no one doubted that the United States was the aggressor; whether said aggression was designed to acquire control over Cuba or liberate the island depended on one’s point of view. The small U.S. Regular Army would quickly be joined by tens of thousands of volunteers, who answered the war’s signature battle cry "Remember the Maine!" with the less-well-remembered response:

"To Hell with Spain!"

To Hell With Spain is a supplement for the Infantry Attacks series, based on the battles fought in Cuba and Puerto Rico between June and August 1898. It is not a complete game: ownership of any boxed game in the Infantry Attacks series is necessary to provide the rules and markers, and maps are drawn from the following Panzer Grenadier games and supplements: Elsenborn Ridge, Road to Berlin, Battle of the Bulge, Kokoda Trail, Eastern Front and 1940: The Fall of France. There are 10 scenarios, each based on an actual battle or situation from the Spanish-American War.

To Hell With Spain is sold exclusively via .pdf download. The playing pieces are not die-cut and mounted, nor is the scenario book printed. Instead it comes as a series of .pdf files that will need to be assembled into the game’s components.

name.#text: Infantry Attacks: To Hell With Spain

87611.description:
Wargames Rules for Entire Battles. From Earliest History to 1400 AD.

A miniatures game for ancient and medieval warfare. The rules use interesting game mechanics, such as random movement rates, to represent the variable nature of warfare in the era it addresses.

Units are rated by a Unit Cohesion Value (UCV) that takes into account the armor, leadership, and training of the unit. For example, Roman legionaries would have a high UCV due to their better equipment, good leadership, and regular training while barbarian tribesmen would have a lower UCV.

Combat is divided into shooting, impact, and melee. Unit's abilities are divided into strengths and weaknesses in these areas. For example, a barbarian unit may have a high impact value, meaning that they have a formidable first charge, but their value in an ensuing melee is less imposing.

The figure scales used for the game is 1:50 (one model figure representing 50 actual men) and the time scale is one turn equals approximately 60 minutes. The game attempts to allow entire ancient battles to be fought out in miniature on the tabletop.

At the time it was published, Milgamex' "Ancient Warfare" emerged as a potential rival to the popularity of WRG's "Wargames Rules for Ancient and Medieval Battles." However, they could not push WRG's rules out of the place they had gained in international competition play. The rules went through two printings, but by 1980, they were difficult to find in stores.

90379.description:
Satirical left-winged political board game. The goal is to make your political career. You need 4 demonstrations and 4 "gatherings" to become a member of the german government.
For the movement you you political units to move up to 10 spaces. Overtaking other cost extra and the spaces you land on are executed. If you run out of political units, you are forced to go on holidays.

87621.description: A dice game simulating the game of Baseball by using two dice. One die is the "Pitching" die, which has STRIKES, BALLS and HITS. The second die or "Batting" die (used when a HIT is rolled on the "Pitching" die) has FOUL, CAUGHT and HOMERUN on its faces.

90380.description: Just a roll-and-move to build up a new city and become the richest player. Branded by the Commerzbank as a promotional gift.

87626.description:
From the back of the box:
Polaritease is the unique vertical board game that has caught the attention of people around the world. By using the forces of magnetism, each player is presented with the opportunity to create a wide variety of game-winning strategies.

Polaritease comes complete with rules, a black and white set of positive and negative charged tokens, a triangular game board, and two stands for mounting in a vertical position.

From the rules:
The object of Polaritease is simple. If you remove your tokens from the board before your opponent, you win. This is done when each token is placed on the bottom row, advanced to the red holes and then removed.

87627.description:
It is mid-19th century Mexico. As more and more railroad companies emerge in the US, the transportation of goods is at an all-time high. trading between countries is booming, and Mexico is ready to develop its rail system for transportation of goods to the USA.

Can you be the first to build the best rail system south of the border and control the Railways of Mexico?

Components:
Mexico gameboard
Railroad Baron and Railroad Operation cards for the Mexico map
Rules
Scoreboard

This expansion will be included in the revised edition of the Railways of the World base game (scheduled for release at the end of 2010), but will also be available separately as a self-contained expansion for owners of Railroad Tycoon and of the first edition of Railways of the World.

87628.description:
"What is this? A prodigy? A collective hallucination? This is not a movie. This is not a child’s play. This is not even the real world, as you’ve known it until now, at least...This is more".

For fifteen years players had to customize their own deck: now, at last, they can customize their cards too!

Prodigy Game Cards is a card game, you don't collect it, proper for experienced players; every player drives a group of people "special" in it: these people are called WIPper, in specific places around the world, that in order to prevail on the adversaries fight for many purposes.

These characters, at first sight, seem just common people, but possess increased ability that we called "prodigies." It is a WIPper who succeeds in these "prodigies". Who is not able to do it, is without bond. Four types of bond exist and each is represented, in the game, by a different color:

Molecular - yellow: those people that can modify their phisical structure and their molecular density in different ways.
Elementary - green: they possess the ability to channel, to send forth and to check different types of energy using the body as catalyst.
Feral - red: they possess a combination of Dna human and animal, that allow them to possess animal physical powers.
Psionic - blue: they are the WIPpers that possess some superior mental abilities.

To play a game of Prodigy Game Cards it needs at least two players. Every player must possess WIPper (the protagonists of our history), Places (where they fight) and a deck of Prodigies (the special actions that are able to do).

With Prodigy Game Cards you can directly reach a new level of personalization: the Prodigies have the technology Scracth&Play, developed in collaboration with Cartamundi, that allows the players to personalize, in phase of construction of the deck, every single paper.

Every Prodigy possesses three levels of power: low, middle and high.
According to the strategy and experience, and according to the objective that the player want to get during the game, he decides what value "to release." To increase a low value, is necessary to remove the patina that covers the left yellow panel of the paper; to increase the value, without going to far, it is recommended the panel (orange) found to the center; if you need values of maximum power, it needs to set the right the panel (red) free.
87628.name: Prodigy Game Cards

87629.description:
The game is so far only in danish...
But the rules are simple:

In the game Match! you have to explain why pictures are alike. You have to convince the other players, that your match is the best, but thats not enough. You also have to appreciate another players good explanation!

Yo get point for best match (most votes) and for appreciating the best match. The first player woth 20 points is the winner.

In Danish:

Match! - hvordan ser du din verden?
I match! skal du forklare, hvordan billeder af verden hænger sammen. Det kræver hverken terninger eller paratviden, det handler om at fortælle de gode historier - og at værdsætte de andres!

Reglerne kort fortalt:
Hver spiller får tre billeder på hånden. På bordet lægges et tilfældigt billeder, det er dette billede, de skal forsøge at 'matche'.
I hver runde vælger spillerne det billedkort fra hånden, som han/hun synes passer bedst med det kort, der i forvejen ligger på bordet. Spilleren forklarer eller fortæller en historie om hvorfor netop dette kort passer bedst – altså er det bedste Match! Alt gælder, så det gælder bare om at lade fantasien løbe.

Når alle spillere har lagt deres billedkort ned og fortalt deres historie, er det tid til afstemningen. Her stemmes der om hvem der har fortalt den bedste historie. Det er tilladt at stemme på sig selv.

Den spiller der har fået flest stemmer og dermed fortalt den bedste historie får 1 point. Alle de spillere, der har stemt på den spiller der fik flest stemmer, får hver 3 point. Det gælder altså ikke kun om at kunne fortælle den bedste historie, men også om at kunne anerkende en god historie fortalt af en anden...

Når der er fundet en afgørelse, lægges det vindende billedkort på bordet, ved siden af det kort der lige er fundet match til. Dette er nu det nye kort, der skal matches. Efterhånden i spillet kommer der altså en længere sammenhæng af billeder, tænk lige over det!

Spillerne får nye billeder i stedet for de brugtem og en ny runde starter.

Specialrunder. Hver spiller har desuden et 'specialrundekort', som kan ændre rundens form, når det spilles. F.eks. at der denne runde ikke må siges noget...

Pointene er ringe, der sættes på hver spillers pointtårn. Når en spiller har tårnet fyldt op, har han/hun vundet. Tillykke!

Source: summary from the rules + papskubber.dk

name.#text: Match!: hvordan ser du din verden?

87632.description:
You are a survivor of a zombie apocalypse and you're stuck in a house with a broken car and hordes of zombies are attacking in the lawn. But wait, you found tools enough to fix the car to escape from the hordes of zombies. ARE YOU READY FOR IT?

Escape of the Dead is a solo game. In the game you are trying to fix the car while trying to defend yourself against hordes of zombies. You're given 4 Action dice per turn, distribute between 3 sections of the game (either by shooting zombie, fixing the barricade and/or fixing the car). Roll for success on each section. Any zombie that survived will attack the barricade. When you successfully killed 10 zombies you will be rewarded with power-up. You lose when your barricade is down (i.e barricade's hp equals zero). You win when the car is fixed 100% and get out of the house.

All you need to play

1 A4 paper to print the board + rule
4 six sided dice
a pencil (optional)
an eraser (optional)




As of 1.5 (The 'portable edition'), all you need to play

1 A4/Letter paper to print the rules
1 A4/Letter cardstock to print the cards/zombies
4 six sided dice
4 transparent card sleeves (optional)
1 Dry Erase Marker/Grease Pencil (optional)
Something to erase markings (optional)
Gaming Stones (or some other marker) instead of Dry Erase/Grease Pencil. The amount you use is by preference. You will need from 3-30. 12 is ideal (1 for a zombie kill track, 1 for repair track, and 10 for barricade HP - You could make the barricade damage a track and only require 3 markers).




You can download the game for FREE in the file/download section below.

You can also visit us and play more games at http://experimentalplayground.blogspot.com/

87633.description:
Bombs Away is a simple game of magnetic planes that drop ball bearing bombs on targets.

The aim of the game is to pick up metal ball bearings from the side of the board with your "magnet" plane, then try to fly the plane across the plastic covering — with the plane on top of the plastic and the ball hanging below it — and aim to drop the bomb onto one of the targets below. Each target gives a different score, and the player with the highest score wins.
87633.name: Bombs Away

87634.description:
Terror War is a DTP solitaire, strategy level game of the current conflict against al Qaeda and various potential adversaries. The player takes the side of the U.S./West and must choose one of the offered strategies. Operations include military, diplomatic, and intelligence. Economics have been added and interleaved as an important factor.

Initial strategy in the Historic game is set and one must follow through with it until allowed to change strategy. This presents both opportunity and difficulty. Terror operations are governed by Random Event and various rules. While the terror side may not seem too active, it's very existence constitutes a tremendous threat to the U.S./Western position in the world. Players will feel the pressure and frustration of achieving the right balance of strategy to means. A half dozen or so different strategies are available to play with.

The game spans 20 one-year turns, from 2001 to 2021. By the end of this time the U.S. side must either bring off a victory, or lose.

This is a tough, strange war and the game reflects that reality.

Download rules, map, counters, etc at http://talk.consimworld.com/WebX?14@153.EuETbiw6OXw.45@.1dd4...

87635.description: Players have to answer trivia questions of different categories. A pawn moving around on a board shows which category. The first player to answer 10 questions correct wins the game.

83541.description:
What happened in the year 2002?

Spel van het jaar 2003 (dutch for 'game of the year') offers a full-view of the year as a quiz game; an educational question/answer game. A game in which de funniest, (most/least) important moments of the year step into the spotlight.

The game has been re-edited and expanded with the alphabetgame.

Contents;
118 alphabet/question cards
1 die

83542.description:
Each player drives his car on the border of the board. You can start having parkingplaces on the streets of the different cities. Later you can expand there building parkings with several layers.

With more layers you get more revenue when other players park in your parking.When a parking has 3 layers it cannot have a hostile take-over.

You get points by having parkings with 3 layers (1 point each parking), points by having special strategycards (with P1 bonus of 1 point) and by completing your mission card you got at the start of the game (1,2 or 3 points).

The player with 11 (2 players), 7 ( 3 players) or with 5 (4 players) points wins the game.

87639.description:
This special item was available at the SPIEL10 fair in Essen together with the game.

Tréville is the captain of the Musketeers.

His is an charismatic leader with the following special ability:

Once per turn during the Musketeers’ phase, when it is Tréville’s turn to play, he may give any of the Musketeers one ‘order’. This costs Tréville 1 action. The Musketeer carries out this free action at once according to normal rules (i.e. draw a card, move, fight, etc.).
87639.name: Mousquetaires du Roy: Tréville miniature

91736.description:
Challenge abstract game for 2 players
Pick up randomly 2 cards over 15,
As fast as possible, build a 3D structure with 5 blocks so that this structure fits one card looking in a direction, and the other card, looking in the other direction.

87641.description:
At the Essen Toy Fair 2010, Lookout Games has published a new special card for Le Havre.
It is part of the Lookout Games anniversary catalog and has to be cut out.
A printed version of this card is only available in German.

The new card has the following ability:

"Nimm Dir 1 Schuldschein und 6 unterschiedliche Waren Deiner Wahl (außer Stahl)."

In English:

"Take 1 loan and 6 different goods (except Steel)."

You can find an English version of this card in the files section.

91739.description:
Somme 1918 is the second game in a series that covers all of the offensives on the Western Front in 1918 and the Sequel to Marne 1918: Friedensturm.

Somme 18 is different from Marne 1918 because it covers only one battle, Operation Michael, while Marne 1918 simulated a series of offensives, from Blucher to Friedensturm. The result is a more intense and nerve-wracking game that takes place over eight turns (from the end of March to mid-April), at least half of which are composed of three operational phases. Both players will face difficult challenges. The German player needs to re-create the historic breakthrough and has to put in every effort to reach Amiens. The Allied player has to resist succumbing to panic in the first turns in order to organize an effective defense, and then a counter-attack near the end of the game.

While the basic rules in Somme 18 are identical to those in Marne 1918 (with the exception of the air rules, which have been completely revised), the advanced rules will be very different. The principal reason is the length of Operation Michael, about fifteen days, which does not give an opportunity for the campaign management rules of Marne 1918 to be used.

So, all of the unit management tracks have disappeared and have been replaced by one table that manages the replacement and re-construction of units. Strategic movement has also been greatly simplified and adapted to the tempo of the game.

Somme 1918 will of course be enriched by numerous specific rules, simulating the particularities of this battle.


Petain’s Reticence: Simulates the French command’s lack of urgency in supporting their British allies.
The arrival of French reinforcements without their artillery support, allowing a quicker deployment of troops coupled with a reduction in their value.
Inter-Allied Cooperation: This will be extremely reduced at the beginning of the campaign.
Evolution of the use of Stoss: The doctrine of using assault troops had been principally introduced by General von Hutier, in Russia and Italy. At the beginning of Operation Michael, the generals commanding the Second and Seventeenth armies used their Stosstruppen in frontal assaults, wasting these elite forces and provoking fury from Ludendorff. A rule thus simulates the evolution of this doctrine.
The Doullens Conference: At the height of the German offensive, while the French Army under Petain prepared to cut its ties with the British, Haig accepted that he be placed under the command of Foch, finally creating an inter-Allied command. This rule simulates this conference, tied to German conquests. It also plays a part in obtaining victory points. In fact, this rule is really the heart of the game and we think that players will be pleased with the proposed system that will bring together the different parameters of this game.

87648.description:
From the rules:

In the mid 18th century, two fearless pirate brothers ruled the seas of the world as it was then known. They were Captain Blackbeard and the Red Corsair.
They salvaged treasures, attacked merchant ships and embarked on many an adventure. Over the years, the par assembled loyal crews and had magic pirate spells which they used to spread terror and fear throughout the civilised world. They were as thick as thieves. As for who was the strongest of the two, no one knew. To decide those once and for all, each pirate kidnapped the beloved lady of the other.
In this exciting duel between two legendary figures, the players take on the roles of Captain Blackbeard and the Red Corsair and each attempt to free their ladies from the clutches of their brother.
The table where the cards are laid represents the sea and its islands. The hand of each player represents their pirate ship, while the cards symbolise the crew or the pirate spells. Which pirate brother will be the first to free his lady from the grasp of his brother?

Object of the game:
The object of the game is to free your pirate lady from the clutches of your opponent pirate.
The first player whose lady (Lady in Red for the Red Corsair, Lady in Black for Captain Blackbeard) appears on the opponent's discard pile is the winner.
Cards land on the discard pile either by defeating them while fighting on an isle or due to a penalty when the opponent pirates controle one or more of the 4 islands. Care has to be taken on which island your followers should be send as even the strongest pirate has its weaknesses. Furthermore, every island has its own penalties (e.g. discard cards from your hand / discard pile or pirates already on islands) which should be considered.
87648.name: Pirate Brothers

87649.description: This is an adult themed game in which the goal is to use cards and directions in race to disrobe your "opponent." Each turn the two players are vying to control the title "Bedmaster," which gives them control of that round.

84923.description:
The game board shows shelves with pairs of item. One of each pair is eco-friendly (and has a green dot), the other isn't (and has a red dot). The items are also depicted on tiles, and there are 15 additional garbage tiles.

The item tiles are placed face-down around the game board. The active player flips open a tile. If the depicted item is covered by a garbage tile on the board, the turn ends - but if it is a tile with a red dot, another item in the shelves has to be covered. If the item is still free, another tile can be flipped open. If the two tiles form a pair, the green-dotted card is put on a shelf , the red one is discarded. Also, a garbage tile can be removed from the board. If the two tiles don't match, the player has to cover all red-dotted items s/he just flipped open with garbage tiles.

When all items with green dots are covered with item tiles, the game ends. If there are still garbage cards on the shelves, all players lose. If not, everyone wins.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

83561.description:
Board game which needs an Yvio console to be played. When a chip is inserted, there are seven different game options (and a combination of several of these). The board contains pictures of 20 animals. When a player puts a pawn on one of these, it is registered by the machine.
The console can make the sounds of the 20 animals, and most game ideas use this. The sound of one animal sounds, for example, and the first player to put a piece on the corresponding picture scores, for example. The console also functions as a die, so some roll and moves are also included. The "Olympiade" mode combines the scores of various games to determine an overall winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
83561.name: Auf dem Bauernhof ist was los!

87658.description:
It's the ultimate book of spells . . . the Munchkinomicon. But beware! If you aren't munchkinly enough, the Munchkinomicon will slip away and find a more suitable host. This set includes the Munchkinomicon and 14 of its deviously cheesy spells, like United I Stand, Eldritch Cleaver, and Unnatural Compulsion.

This is an expansion for ANY Munchkin game. It is not a stand-alone game. This is NOT a collectible or randomized set. Every Munchkinomicon pack is the same as every other.

Part of the Munchkin series
87658.name: Munchkinomicón

89703.description: The Game uses the map of Hong Kong Islands District as the background. Players discover the scenic spots of Hong Kong of Islands District and collect scoring points by using transportation card(s) according to the transportation type and number stated on the route. For example, the player uses 4 "Ferry" cards, the corresponding player marker on the map will move from Central to Cheung Chau and collect scoring card or bonus card on Cheung Chau. Each turn player either draw transportation card(s) or move the player marker around the map to score. A collection of location cards will also provide bonus points at the end of the game. The player with the highest score wins the game.

83565.description:
Move as in "Chinese Checkers" (e.g. pieces jump over other pieces) trying to score as many points as possible by occupying your opponent's most important positions with your most valuable counters. The object of the game is to attempt to do this while avoiding your opponent's efforts to occupy YOUR most valuable bases. At the same time, you must try to box-in his/hers most important counters. To find your score, you must multiply the figure on the counter with the figure on the square. Simple rules.

(Description from the back of the box.)
83565.name: Multi

87664.description:
From the R&R Games Website:

200 all new categories in this expansion set to Smarty Party. Fans of this game have patiently waited while we handpicked each category and carefully ripened them until they were practically bursting with flavor. Now that long wait is finally over and they're ready for play!

87667.description:
This is a dexterity game where players have to try and balance food items on the two trays held by a waiter. What makes this a game is that the waiter's feet are not flat, they're rounded, so any addtion to the trays causes the whole mass to move about.

The loser is the person who causes the food to fall off the trays.

87671.description:
Several versions of the battle have been produced. Each has been contrived to show a historic resolution, fun for the English player, depressing for the French. Azincourt (French spelling) is a unique approach. The French might have had more coordinated leadership. They might not have been so intent on an easy victory, and as a result been so careless. They might have taken advantage of the vulnerable English advance. They might have waited for the English to wear themselves out crossing the muddy field and allowed Henry to make the first attack. They might have employed their crossbows to better effect. Had they better control of their troops, crowded conditions would not have reduced combat effectiveness. Finally, had they considered avenues for retreating units, disruption of fresh units would not been such a problem.

In Azincourt I address a number of these what-ifs but, moreover, I offer players the unique mechanic of commanding one flank of each opposing army. In effect players play BOTH the French AND the British. It works out much better than you would expect. Since the English line is necessarily pretty static, there is little problem in coordinating an English defense while splitting command of the French in the face of the enemy mirrors the historically poor French command.

Azincourt is a card assisted, counter and hex game utilizing large colorful counters and a variety of aids that allows for a key battle component which other versions neglect to emphasize - the capture of nobles for ransom. Integral to Azincourt play is the capture of these nobles, English and French (including King Henry), of varying value. Ah and then there are the complications that such nobles bring. Wounded nobles become easy targets. Captured nobles make targets of their captors. Then there are Henry's terrible archers ... who WILL run out of arrows, and then what? To add to the game's variety is a random set-up and reinforcemnt schedule that toys with a number of possible historical possibilities.

Playtesting has been a blast so far but continues so no publisher has yet committed. Still, all in good time...

90274.description:
Darwin, a child in the Australian bush inadvertently comes across a great discovery - a chance to document and classify a new species... one that is not of this world.

Follow Darwin's accounts of these creatures throughout the Rise of the Occulites Saga.

Dawn - Rise of the Occulites is the first in a series of games that depict the different evolutionary stages of creatures called Occulites.

This first foray into the Occulite world sees you control a small tribe of Occulites as they fight for survival.

Lead your tribe through a series of campaign scenarios as they learn new abilities and traits from their surroundings. Become stronger or weaker depending on your actions during the game. Or pick and choose your tribe's specialities and then jump right in to a one off game.

Dawn - Rise of the Occulites is a skirmish level miniatures game that uses an innovative card based action resolution mechanic that is both interesting and engaging.
This system is called the "Natural Selection Deck" and is responsible for everything from activating your tribe members, to resolving movement through terrain and a deep and rewarding combat system.

However, Dawn - Rise of the Occulites is not primarily a combat game, but involves each side striving to achieve different objectives. Whether it be to collect Sungems to provide heat for the long night, recruit other denizens like Luftles to help your tribe succeed, take over an uninhabited (or inhabited cave), fight in cooperation against larger predators, protect your land. There are many scenarios and objectives to keep the game fresh.

Dawn - Rise of the Occulites is a fun and accessible game that is easy to pick up, but difficult to master.

87677.description: Geography Trivia game where players are given a latitude and a longitude and a short clue and must guess the location. Play to a set number of points or any given time length. Includes 3000 questions on 500 cards.

name.#text: Do You Know Where You Are?: World Challenge Edition

87678.description:
In an era of global communication’s transformation, which will be the strategy that will grant a greater number of readers?
