They will try to steal your resources.
There is no room for error.
There is no time for hesitation.
Open your Briefcase, lay out your business plans and enjoy the game!

Briefcase is a deck-building and resource management boardgame.

In Briefcase, players build their own business empires by acquiring and activating various companies. Each company, once activated, provides the player with some benefits (which are called decisions cards) and a special ability for the rest of the game.

Players start with identical decks of decision cards. Each time one player activates a company, he/she adds to his deck more decision cards. Decision cards give the players various possible actions (like buy/activate/hire/obstacles). The most important is the "buy" action, with which players can either buy a building or a resource from the market.

89080.description: A memory game with 4 different ways to play. There are 48 different cards in 6 different colors and different numbers. In one variant you have to find a card in the color roll with a colored die, in another you have to build a sum rolled with a d10.

88020.description:
This game was officially released in October 2010 to mark the 32nd anniversary of John Paul's election as pope, although several hundred copies had already been sold.

A dice roll allows a player to travel to many of the 130 countries where the pope traveled where players collect cards with the Pope's messages.

name.#text: Dookoła Świata z Janem Pawłem II

83928.description:
iDetective is now ready with it's third intallment in the awarded game book series: "The Tragedy on the Train", introducing some new timeoriented gameplay.

You find yourself on the journey of your life as you travel with the beautiful old steam train St. Mary. Soon you are entangled in a plot most devious. It will require more than you can imagine figuring out what happens in the Tragedy on the Train. So lean back and enjoy the ride.

Based on the awardwinning board game, Sherlock Holmes: "Consulting Detective", iDetective presents a new downloadable case in the series every month. This standalone version comes complete with eveything you need to play:


Rules
Case Introduction
Location Entries
Quiz
Solution & Answers
MP3s of Author reading the Casebook and Solution.


Fund it here:
http://igg.me/p/72198?a=455812

name.#text: iDetective #3: The Tragedy on the Train

83811.description:
Front of the box: "Get the most yield from any field with Dan the Answer Plot man."

This is a promotional game that was created by Croplan Genetics and their Answer Plot program.

From jackplotvegas.com:
JackPlot! is a CROPLAN GENETICS and Answer Plot based board game. The game is based on a year in time. Just like in real life, growers have to withstand the elements of winter, spring planting, growing season and harvest to hold onto as much yield as they can. Hopefully with the help of their local agronomist and by attending the Winter Grower Meeting and the Answer Plot Knowledge Events, growers can plan well and gain enough insight to protect and increase their yield. The player with more yield than other players (the neighbors) at the end of the game (the grain elevator), wins!

83933.description:
From the publishers site:

NWS: Modern Naval Conflicts Series is a NWS Team designed next generation comprehensive naval wargame covering the hypothetical major naval battles of WW3 with the ability to create unlimited custom scenarios.

Features for the MNC:1970s edition (expansions will add additional time frames, regions, navies, etc.):

6 - 11" x 17" full color cardstock maps covering over 1.5 million square nm of the GIUK naval theater. Total map size 33" x 34"
25nm map hex scale and 5nm-scale tactical formation display for resolving closer range combat.
Time frame/area for the first edition is 1970-1980 / GIUK AOA with other time frames/locations planned for future editions.
Rapid fire combat resolution allowing players to handle even large naval engagements in just a few hours.
Forces will included: United States, Great Britain, and Soviet Union. More countries planned for published expansions.
Detailed data for 140+ ship/submarine classes, 100+ aircraft types, and 50+ land units included.
Streamlined, detailed, and easy to follow combat mechanics including basic, advanced, and optional rules.
Full color professionally printed and mounted 560 - 1/2" aircraft, ship, sub, etc. combat unit counters
52 page rules manual. Scenarios are available on the CD-ROM included with the game.
17 cardstock sheets with color-coded Reference Tables covering all dimensions of sub, surface, and aerial combat, sensors, and electronic warfare.
8 x Formation Displays on heavy cardstock.
CD-ROM with complete unit data/record sheets, scenarios, and other files (All in PDF format).
Combat examples included for easy understanding of how the rules work during game play as well as quick reference modifier charts.
2 ten-sided dice.
Very flexible design that can be played as a board game or with miniatures. Rules, counters, and other materials will be useable with all other MNC series games.




1980s Expansion information link
http://www.navalwarfare.net/mnc.html

85669.description: Solo American civil war card game. Every turn draw cards until you have four cards in your hand, you decide when to play the good and bad ones. But end a turn with four cards and you lose. Primarily you place cards into play, pushing toward the enemy general. Use flanking,charging, artillery with your line formations. Free print and play, 40 cards in all, plus rules. A quick play game with no bean counting or dice rolling.

families: Last Night on Earth Game Engine
83937.description:
Have you ever asked yourself what would happen if a Zombie killed a Martian? Undead-Alien? Well...now you can find out in this special crossover variant for Last Night on Earth and Invasion from Outer Space.

In this special crossover variant, whenever a Zombie kills a Martian, it may rise again, as a Zombie-Martian !!!

Includes a set of 18 Martians and for use in crossover games of Last Night on Earth and Invasion From Outer Space.

-9 Zombie Martians in brown
-9 Zombie Martians in green
-18 Helmets (included separately to allow you to paint your miniatures before gluing on the helmets)

85670.description:
Language learning games with various editions in different languages. Two or more teams are competing, but two individuals can also play. Teams with different language levels can compete, but within a team, the players should have roughly equal abilities,
The players roll and move, then a player from another team draws a card from a category depending on the field the active team landed on and the language level of the active team. Questions or tasks are read out, and the active team has to answer/perform them. If successful, they collect the card and continue, if not, their turn ends.
Categories include definitions (taboo-like), grammar, culture, expressions, vocabulary and role playing. The first team to collect a card from each category is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

families: Last Night on Earth Game Engine
88038.description:
From the FFP website:

We will include Promo cards Pitchfork/Flashlight and Here They Come with this purchase. Zombies With Grave Weapons in crystal green/radioactive color. 7 zombies, each unique, in this set.

name.#text: Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game – Radioactive Zombies with Grave Weapons Supplement

families: Last Night on Earth Game Engine
88039.description:
From the FFP website:

The IFOS - Advanced Abilities Supplement is a Web-exclusive for Invasion From Outer Space and features 4 new game cards for the Martian and Hero Decks and 10 new Advanced Ability cards (8 Hero and 2 Martian) as well as the new rules for using them. All pieces are printed on the same high-quality card stock as the boardgame. The cards are exclusive to this supplement and will not be available anywhere else.

The new Advanced Abilities cards can be added to any existing Scenario as a way for both the Heroes and the Martians to gain experience during games unlocking powerful new abilities. There is a unique Advanced Ability for each Hero character, allowing each to level-up and use a super-powered version of his or her Talent (requiring the use of a full 3 Power Tokens), as well as global abilities that the Martians can get.

name.#text: Invasion from Outer Space: Advanced Abilities Supplement

families: Last Night on Earth Game Engine
88040.description:
From the FFP website:

The LNOE - Advanced Abilities Supplement is a Web-exclusive for Last Night on Earth and features eight new game cards for the Zombie and Hero Decks and 20 new Advanced Ability cards (16 Hero and 4 Zombie) as well as the new rules for using them. All pieces are printed on the same high-quality card stock as the boardgame. The cards are exclusive to this supplement and will not be available anywhere else.

The new Advanced Abilities cards can be added to any existing Scenario as a way for both the Heroes and the Zombies to gain experience during games unlocking powerful new abilities. There is a unique Advanced Ability for each Hero character, allowing them to level-up, as well as global abilities that the Zombies can get.

name.#text: Last Night on Earth 'Advanced Abilities' Supplement

88045.description:
(from VaeVictis website:)

On June 6, 1944, Overlord, the biggest military operation ever launched, began along the Normandy beaches with the landing of two Allied armies. On June 22 in Byelorussia, more than a million Soviet soldiers swept against the German Army Group Centre: the Allied counter-offensive was underway and would not stop until it reached Berlin.
From Overlord to Berlin is a strategic wargame that simulates the end of the Second World War in Europe on all fronts: east, west and Italy. One player directs the Axis forces and must resist Allied pressure for as long as possible while the other directs the Soviets and the Western Allies and must wipe out Nazi Germany and its satellites before the end of the game. The simulation begins in June 1944 with the Normandy landings, the fall of Rome in Italy and Operation Bagration in the east. There was still hard fighting ahead including crossing the Rhine and pushing forward into the heart of the Reich, surrounding numerous armies in the Ruhr and reaching the Elbe.
In the east, Hitler’s counter-attacks in Hungary and in Poland accomplished nothing against the might of the Russian bear.
At the beginning of January, Russian troops attacked along the Vistula and drove the Germans back to the Oder. Budapest fell in February, and Vienna was captured in April. Finally, the offensive on Berlin began in April and the Reich fell at the beginning of May 1945, putting an end to the Second World War in Europe.

The cardboard pocket includes :
216 die-cut counters (Units : fronts, armies and army corps)
1 Zone map of Europe from France to USSR, 59 x 40 cm
1 rulebook, 2 player aids


French or English Rules and Charts.
88045.name: D'Overlord à Berlin

88046.description:
(from the download document)

This is a fan based expansion created by Mike Young for the game Dominion.

These cards may be used to create standalone sets or may be added to mixes from other Dominion expansions.

This set introduces the concepts of:

Kingdom cards where not all the cards in the pile are identical.
Duration cards that last for more than 1 turn.
Duration cards that allow players to perform an action instead of playing an action card.
Use tokens to determine when or if a card has been used.

89085.description:
This is a biblical cooperative game, where the players try to form new christian societies while traveling through the eastern mediterranean.

When all players are die or imprisoned the game ends and you score how man societies you have build.

88049.description:
It's feeding time for the chickens, and you've got a lot of hungry mouths to feed in your hen house. So out into the barnyard you go, looking for tasty spiders, worms, beetles, and bits of corn. All you need to do is grab it and bring it back to your henhouse. Unfortunately, there are a lot of other chickens in the yard that are trying to grab the same food! Will you be able to successfully maneuver your chickens to collect the most food and feed your flock?

In Chicken Feed Stampede!, players control a pair of chickens trying to collect food as they run around the barnyard. While doing so, they have to avoid other chickens and the fox, which chases the chickens to the edge of the barnyard, forcing them to the edge to start over.

Each player uses a set of eight action cards to determine how their chickens are moved each turn.

There are four different kinds of food available, and each gives the player who collects it a different ability or score. Player order is managed by placing their turn markers on the "Pecking Order" board. Clever management of your actions to stay at the top of the pecking order is needed to win the game.

The game board is comprised of a grid of various terrain tiles. A chicken's movement ability is based on the terrain of the tile it starts its move from. Using the boulders and gravel paths gets you around faster, but sometimes you need to get into the grass to collect the food you need.

Components
- Modular Board featuring barnyard terrain
- 12 chicken tokens (chickeneeples!) in six colors
- 48 chicken action cards
- 36 food tokens (spiders, worms, beetles and corn)
- one fox token
- 6 chicken turn marker tokens
- 6 Rooster Crow special power tokens

88051.description:
A trivia game as a tie-in of the (in Germany) popular-Science-show "Welt der Wunder" (World of wonders).
Players move arounf the board, answering questions or have to memorize shapes or words.

name.#text: Das große Welt der Wunder Wissensspiel

83969.description:
The cheese is 12 inches high, 8 inches across and 9 inches thick at the base.

From the box; 'A Giant Slice of fun. Manoeuvre your marbles up the 'Cheese' mountain. It takes skill to be the first'.

It looks like the marbles are pulled up the cheese mountain using a harness attached to the top of the cheese - pulled by strings at the bottom sides. I've only seen this game in a toy museum.

Each player gets four marbles and a mouse. A marble is put onto the mouse and then you have to carry that marble to the top, using a cord that acts as a lever and pulley. If you drop the marble, then you must go back to the base of the cheese and try again on your next turn. The first player to get 4 marbles to the top, wins.

91095.description:
ScatterLand is a game of strategy and deduction for 2-4 players. It takes roughly 30 minutes to play.

The basic idea is that players are exploring an archipelago in search of islands. The game board consists of a 9×9 array of 81 squares, further divided into nine 3×3 boxes. There are 18 islands total, but these islands aren’t distributed randomly; instead, they are arranged so that two islands occupy each 3×3 box, each row, and each column. What's more, these islands are initially hidden from view.

Players claim one square per turn. A player either places an island of her color in the region (if there's an island there) or a boat of her color in the region (if there isn't). Players are trying first to discover and then to connect together as many islands as they can: the more islands they connect together, the more points they receive at the end of the game.

Players use logic to determine where the islands are likely to be, but logic alone is not enough: players must also think tactically and strategically in order both to foster their own growth and limit the growth of their opponents.

ScatterLand takes no more than five minutes to learn (or to teach), but its gameplay is surprisingly deep. There are a lot of things to try to balance when deciding where to play: do you want to claim a new island as your own or try to connect two of your islands together? Do you want to try to consolidate your own position or be the first to explore a given area? Do you want to focus on expanding your chains or trying to cut off your opponents?

Two versions of the game are included: the basic version (described above) and the advanced version (which limits the number of exclusive islands any one player can claim).

ScatterLand can be found at http://boardgameforge.wordpress.com/scatterland/ -- just click the links toward the bottom of the page for both the rules and 20 additional boards.

83978.description:
From the Introduction

"This set of rules allows you and a few mates to go rummaging around in old ruins looking for sacred texts, the Hair Lip of St. Ravell, treasures of a lost age or just about anything else you fancy. Most of all, it gives you a set of simple, fast and enjoyable skirmish rules for the late medieval or renaissance period. There is also, dare I say it, an additional section which allows for more horrifying encounters in the ruins. Not for everyone, I know, but we enjoyed them and I hope that you do too.

To play, you will need 2d10 and 2d6, a ruler marked in inches, two or more sets of around 8-10 figures and some sort of ruin or building model."

User Summary

These relatively simple rules cover both combat and searching for items in the ruins. Rules set includes melee and ranged attacks, armor values, morale, etc. Each side gets a pool of points with which to buy a small skirmishing force. Each unit gets outfitted with armor and weaponry (with more effective items costing more). Set also comes with an appendix for Horror/Fantasy game play, which introduces undead creatures, spell casting, etc.

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #161 (February 2001)

83980.description: The 5th Century - the Eagle of Rome has retreated from British shores. British tribes are surrounded on all sides by Saxons, Picts, and the Irish. The fiercely independent tribes must elect a high king, the Pendragon, to unite them under a single banner. Will you be the leader strong enough to claim this crown? Pendragon is a conflict-based worker placement game for three to six players. Each warlord builds both the size of his army and his stronghold while actively paying tribute to the British tribes which serve as the main source of champions for his forces. Build the largest army, secure the support of the tribes, and seize the crown at the legendary Giants' Dance.

88077.description:
This is self-published expansion kit for Hideyoshi Gunki.
"Cho-Gen Ki" means "Record of Chōsokabe Motochika". Chōsokabe Motochika was Feudal lord in Japan and main person in this game.

Covering battles in Shikoku region by Chōsokabe Motochika.
Six scenarios are included in this kit.

Each players control one or more clans. The clan's combat units is organized to some troops.
The game repeats the game turn decided by the scenario. There are four action stages in each game turn. The number of stages where each troop can act is decided by commander's activation ability. In the action stage, each troop selects one action. The action that can be selected is a movement, field combat, siege, moral recovery, reorganization and replacement.

Victor of the games is the player who got more victory points. The victory point is provided by the holding of the castle and the removal of the enemy units.

Also need to play Standard rule (Late version), Reference card and some units from Hideyoshi Gunki.

88078.description:
This is self-published expansion kit for Kanto Seiatsu.
"Kanhasshu Kosenroku" means "Record of Ancient Battles in 8 States of Kanto Region".

Covering battles of Hojo clan before and after period of Kanto Seiatsu.
Six scenarios are included in this kit.

Also need to play Standard rule (Late version), Reference card and Map #2 from Kanto Seiatsu.

families: The Legend of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table
88079.description:
From Osprey's publicity:

The Dark Age of Britain, from the middle of the 4th century to the end of the 8th, was a time of violence and warfare, when charismatic warlords such as the fabled King Arthur could gather together armies and carve out their own kingdoms. With this new set of wargames rules, players can take on the role of these warlords and command their own armies on the tabletop. Written by the author of the popular Glutter of Ravens rules set, Dux Bellorum is an element-based system, where each base of figures represents 50 fighting men. Each player has a specific number of points with which to construct his force and can choose to a Late Roman, Romano-British, Welsh, Saxon, Pictish, Irish, or Sea Raider army. The game is then played out following a set of simple, fast-paced rules. A completely self-contained gaming system, Dux Bellorum is perfect for gamers who are looking for a way into fighting Dark Age battles without investing a lot of time or money in larger rulesets.

From the playtest introduction:

Dux Bellorum is an Arthurian-era Dark Ages wargame, set in the period from the mid fourth century AD to the end of the eighth century AD. The rules emphasise the influence an army’s commander has on his units, with simple manoeuvre rules and chaotic, swirling close combat. You'll win by inspiring the right troops at the right time, balancing quality versus quantity in your army, and by finding a sprinkling of luck at the right time.

All distances are given in Base Widths, which allows the game to be used with any scale of miniature based in many different ways. An army usually has 6-12 units, and each unit is rated for Aggression (Attacks), Protection (Defence), and Cohesion (Strength) and is trained either as Shieldwall, Warriors, Riders, or Skirmishers (all of which operate differently in the game).

Dux Bellorum armies are selected from following lists: Late Roman, Romano-British, Welsh, Saxon, Pictish, Irish, Land Raider, Sea Raider.

88080.description:
In this fantasy miniatures game players each create an army with the same number of points (with each miniature having a different point value), then take turns moving and attacking until all of the opponent's forces are dead or captured. Players can use special magic and ability cards to provide advantage for their armies.
Unique game mechanic also allows players to launch small plastic missiles with heavy machines (such as ballista or catapult), physically knocking out enemy forces from the battle.

The universe of Fantasy Battles includes various epochs and genres, from fantasy cratures and gladiators to napoleonic wars and cossacks.

Usually each set includes 20 miniatures of characters or creatures, 4-6 warmachines, a deck of magic or ability cards 1 die and techsheets for each unit. Many sets also contain modular structures, such as walls or castle towers.
88080.name: Fantasy Battles

88081.description:
This fantasy-themed miniatures wargame is set on a hexagonal map with dimensions of 5X7 hexes with special 2 hexes marked as "castles". The goal of this game is to defeat all enemy forces or capture his "castle" hex.
Player may reinforce their armies by purchasing additional units during the game process. Also players may build walls and towers on hex borders to defend their castles.

This game is developed based on ideas from Император and Император 2 games.

Components:
32 warrior miniatures
10 plasic bases with flag and 3 slots for units
12 plastic towers
16 plastic walls
20 gold tokens
1 game map
1 rulebook
1 die

88082.description: Color Mio is a Halli-Galli style speed card game about color mix matching instead of fruit counting. Players try to match one of two open palette card colors with combination of paint cards as fast as possible, opened by each player's turn. The correct player takes all open paint cards of every players and the matched palette card(s) is replaced with new one. After all palette cards are matched two times, the player with the most paint cards wins the game.
88082.name: Color Mio

88083.description:
Jihad is a variant kit based on "Belisarius" published on S&T 224.
Original game, "Belisarius" was published in the Decision Games Strategy & Tactics magazine #210.

"Jihad !" is a wargame simulating the early expansion of Islam in the period of the Caliphs Omar and Othman (634-656 AD) when is 100 years after the parent game.

"Jihad !" is a two player game. The Caliphate player controls the forces of the Islam. The Kingdom player controls various non-caliphate kingdoms. Each player’s forces are represented by military units and Stratagem markers. Players must use a combination of military strength and cunning strategy to maintain and increase their power.

The rules are based on the Charlemagne (S&T #189) and Xenophon (S&T #203) games. And this system was later used in Khan (S&T #229).

88084.description:
(From the Introduction)

"Samurai wars" is a game sited in medieval Japan. Each player represents a "Grand Lord", confronted with the other players for the control of lands and resources (mines, hamlets, castles...) in a combination of stretegy, planification, risk, diplomacy and (mostly) war.

In a game turn, each player must collect his resources in order to pay his army and, or recruit new units. after he can attack at his rivals, or ally with others, or be betrayed for his former allies. In this confussed scenario also are present the peasants, sometimes violent, sometimes powerless..., and the Ninjas, special units who can kill a "Grand Lord", removing it for the game.

The game units are completd with infantry, bowmen (each represents ten men), and the powerfull samurais.

At the end of the game (20 turns), the winner is the player with most resources controlled. If there is a tie, the game is played one more turn.

name.#text: Samurai Wars: juego de simulación estratégica en el Japón medieval

88085.description:
What is Arena? It's in your face! It's multi-ton robots trashing each other! It's all about drama on the field and off the field! This isn't your slow paced hack fest! This is Gears kicking tail and taking names!

Hire the best. Kit your Gears. Slug it out with the best. Only one team can rise to the top, but do you have what it takes to win?

Heavy Gear Arena is a fast paced, highly customizable tactical battle game set in the award winning Heavy Gear setting. For centuries, Terra Nova's best pilots have taken their Gears, advanced robotic fighting machines, and pitted them against each other in the world of sports dueling. Only the best stay in the games and earn their legendary reputations. Of course, reputations only get you so far. Winning equals money for upgrading your team and its equipment, the support of your adoring fans brings fame and more importantly the corporate sponsors, or just the thrills, pilots come from all over to find the thing they're desperate for in Khayr ad-Din.

Take on the role of team manager and build up your team to pit against the competition.

What you'll find in Heavy Gear Arena:

Robust tournament campaign rules
Duelists capable of growing in experience and talent
In depth Gear Customization
Support Personnel to aid your team's growth
Fast paced combat with combo chains and Duelist Talents

88086.description:
Clara's garden is game for 2-6 players. You need 1 set of nestortiles and 1 men for every player.

In Clara's garden is 60 flowers in ten colors. Flowers are in various class (1-6). Goal is pick most valuable flowers for bouquet where every flower will be in different color.

Components
- Nestortiles A-Type (60 tiles)
- One man for every player.

Setup
Before game players create random map of garden from nestortiles in grid 10x10.

Play
First move: All players in order put his man on tiles with value 1.

Next move: Player pick up tile and move his man diagonally, horizontally or vertically any number of squares. Only one man can be on square. Man can jumps over oposite men.

Game continue with next moves. Because empty fields cannot be crossed, isolated islands of tiles could be removed. Player can pick up more tiles with the color. But into final score will be counted only one most valuable flower for every color.
If player has no move, she picks up last tile and passes next moves.

End of game
Game is finished when one player has completed bouquet (she has tiles of all ten colors) or when all players are out of moves. Score is counted as sum of points of all flowers. If player has more flowers of the same color, only most valuable flower is counted. Player with best score is winner.

In Rule book there are Advanced rules too.

88088.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Outrageous fun for the whole family!

Join Mickey and friends on a fun journey through the wonderful world of Disney! Celebrate everything Disney with friends and family as you. . .

CREATE works of art like Cinderella’s glass slipper;
PERFORM hilarious feats like finding something that Ariel would use to comb her hair; and
DISCOVER fun facts like "What does Hakuna Matata mean?"

Can you. . .

DRAW Pinocchio with your eyes closed?
SCULPT Phineas? or. . .
ACT out Captain Jack Sparrow?

Enjoy this playful game that delivers fun and laughter, and stretches the imagination every time!

Game includes: 16 Fun activities, 400 Disney-themed cards, 2 Mickey Mouse ears movers, game board, 1 tub of "Cranium Clay", 6 letter dice, Sand timer, 1 die, pad and pencil.

83994.description:
Uncle Scrooge, Huey, Dewey and Louie Duck, Gyro Gearloose and Launchpad McQuack travel to Mexico to search for QuetzalQuac Treasure. They must climb a pyramid, fight monsters and find precious itens.
The Pyramid is a 3D board with four stores. Each player must roll a die, advance his character to the square and do the action indicated by it (if any). There is a dial used to resolve battles that occur when a door is reached.
The goals of the game are: find the two halfs of a map, a lucky amulet, the QuetzalQuac treasure and go back to the base of the pyramid.
83994.name: Ducktales: Tesouro da Pirâmide

88091.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Battle as a heavy hitting Athena or a versatile Purrtek. Grab a group or friends, blast, pound and bash them into kitty litter on your way to victory. Arena Assault is an expandable card game compatible with all other Arena Assault games and decks. Games are fast and furious, even with large groups, allowing for many battles to be played in one game session. Includes two 50 card decks, rules and 20 Arena Gear cards. So, gear up and get ready for battle.

88092.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Battle as a powerhouse Crusher or a fusion blasting Robozon. Grab a group of friends, blast, pound and bash them into dust on your way to victory. Arena Assault is an expandable card game compatible with all other Arena Assault games and decks. Games are fast and furious, even with large groups, allowing for many battles to be played in one game session. Includes two 50 card decks, rules and 20 Arena Gear cards. So, gear up and get ready for battle.

88095.description:
"It's War!! ...but in a nice way."

Good: the Battle is a miniatures based combat skirmish game, in which you take the role of a character or characters and attempt to defeat your opponents by doing good and inflicting bad upon them. The core game, designed by us at Project Good is the game of Good: the Battle. The uniqueness of Good: The Battle is it's ability to use any genre, any miniatures, anywhere, anything else...? Yes there is, but it's all Good...

Unlike the heavily stat-based games that you see everywhere nowadays, Good: the battle turns these statistics into two basic attributes; Good and bad. Obviously the better you are at things (shooting, close combat, healing, etc.) the longer you will survive in this world, but everyone has a limit of how much Good they can do. Nasty things like damage, curses, etc can only be described as Bad things, but sometimes a bit of bad is exactly what is needed.

There are thousands, probably hundreds of thousands, of character miniature manufacturers out there; and every single one of these can be used in Good: the Battle - regardless of scale, setting, period, race, etc. Good: the Battle uses the actual miniature to give you benefits in the game. For example; a miniature equipped with swords will be better in close combat, than somebody with none. A miniature carrying a rocket launcher will obviously do more damage if it shoots you in the head. Huge dragons will have more hit points, and mice will have less. But this doesn't mean a one-armed dwarf mute who's only weapon is a bag full of dead hamsters won't be able to put up a fight...

84002.description:
From the rules:

A family game with both difficult and easy questions about swedish geography, history, culture and nature.

Sverige-spelet is both exciting and educational. Start with dealing out city-cards. Then the players must travel to those cities on the cards they've been dealt. It's important to have a cunning travelplan - and also to be lucky and knowledgable about Sweden - to win the game.

84005.description:
In Lines of Fire you must protect your castle by sending Goblins, Swordsmen, Knights, Orcs, and Dragons into battle.

You will strategically form an army using vertical and horizontal lines of offense and defense. When battle starts, the more powerful unit will defeat the other. The first to reach, and destroy their opponents castle will win the game!

The gameplay is simple. Each player has a castle and a 20-sided die. The die is used as a counter to represent the amount of damage the castle can take before it's destroyed. In order to protect the castle, each player will draw cards. Players will draw creatures with powers of 1 through 5. The higher the number, the more powerful the creature. The creatures are strategically placed in lines using one of 4 horizontal positions in front of the castle. If at any point an "Attack" card is played, the front line of each players army will attack each other in a head to head battle. The creature with higher power will destroy the other. Unused power will be applied to the creature behind the defeated creature. If a player is eventually able to successfully deal damage to another player's castle, the castle takes damage. If a castle is brought to zero, that owner of that castle loses and the game is over.

90460.description:
High atop Mount Olympus the Greek gods are celebrating Zeus' victory over the Titans.

In honor of the dawn of the new era, Zeus has decided to invite representatives of the humans to join the celebration.
Following tradition, they will race to the peak of Olympus where the two winners will have the honor of joining the gods as they celebrate their victory.

Four ambitious contenders have risen to the challenge and will race for the two spots at the victory celebration. Who among them will overcome the obstacles, take advantage of the opportunities set forth before them and win the world's first Olympic game?

The race is close and the progress is surprising. Proper planning and a bit of luck will help you celebrate among the victors...

Summary of play:
Players take turns placing progress cards or order cards below the contender cards, either progressing or regressing the contenders on their way to the top of Olympus.

Each player tries to play his cards so that they will progress the contenders he predicted will win the race. The task is made difficult as the other players try to progress their contenders…

The player who correctly selected the two winning contenders will have the most victory points and will win the game.
90460.name: OlymPeak

84011.description:
Farm Cards is a fast-paced game where players assume the roles of farmers, try to harvest the most balanced crops they can, and earn the most money at the Farmer’s Market. Each player is in direct competition with the others and tries to sabotage the others’ fields by dumping garbage on their land! Don’t expect a fellow farmer to be kind, his only goal is to win!

This is a print and play game. There are 108 custom cards depicting plots of land with seeds and values; and seeds with values. The game may also be played with 2 standard 52 card decks + 4 jokers.

Players take turns working with the "junked-up land" passed to them by their competitors and attempt to achieve the highest score through two mechanics.
1- A standard point mechanic through plot and seed values (card face-value).
2- A second scale representing pH balance that can either be positive, negative, or balanced (0). This is achieved through the use of card suits (vegetables, fruits, and grains with the custom cards - 8 in total; Spades, Hearts, Clubs, and Diamonds with standard American playing cards - 4 in total).

The game is currently undergoing playtesting and review.

88110.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is no ordinary crossword game...it's unpredictable, it's fast-paced, it's Stir 'em Up! Scoop the letters out of the bowl, but don't get attached - the die may force you to flip them or switch them. And once it's time for everyone to make their own crosswords, don't dawdle - you've got 30 seconds to use more letters than everyone else!

User Summary

Once everyone has their letters, roll the die to stir things up! If the die shows a color, everyone must flip over those color tiles they have. If it lands on "right," they take two tiles from the person to their right. If it lands on "left," they pass two tiles to the person to their left. Now ask them to
try to form a word with the tiles. The word must have at least three letters (no
one- or two-letter words). The person to announce a word gets the points for that word. Continue playing until all tiles have been used or you run out of room on the board.

name.#text: Stir 'em Up! The Flipping & Switching Word Game

84017.description:
From the publisher: Football Leader is a simulation of real soccer. 22 players in a board that serves as field. The players (112 pieces in 8 full teams, and all different) have characteristics that allow different actions: pass, goal kick, movement... Each player, in turn, use cards to complete the actions with one or two of his pieces.

Although having random elements like cards to use actions, and dice to determine the success of the actions, it has interesting tactic and strategic characteristics, and moreover, it lets you enjoy the same feelings as a real soccer match!



Football Leader es un juego de simulación de fútbol real. 22 fichas de jugadores en un tablero que hace las veces de campo. Los jugadores (112 fichas en 8 equipos completos y todos diferentes) tienen características que coinciden con las acciones posibles: pase, tiro a puerta, movimiento, etc. Los jugadores por turnos emplean cartas para llevar a cabo dichas acciones con una o dos de sus fichas.Aunque tiene elementos de azar pues se emplean cartas para ejecutar acciones y dados para determinar su resultado, presenta características tanto tácticas como estratégicas muy interesantes y, lo que es más importante, ¡captura la sensación que transmite un encuentro de verdad!

87732.description:
A climbing game played with a standard 52 card deck primarily meant for three players, (though there is a four player variant). It is similar to "Fight the Landlord" (Dou Di Zhu) but with some noticeable differences - the biggest being that the 3 (not the 2) is the high card, but also in the number of cards in the pot and allowable plays. Because the runs are relatively limited (4 through K only) and because there are no "bombs" it is a bit more predictable in its gameplay than Dou Di Zhu.

Each round starts with dealing the cards (except for four of them) and an auction for the remaining cards. The winner of the auction then picks up the cards and plays against the other two opponents who are now in a temporary partnership.

The goal for each round is to shed your cards. The winning bidder needs to shed all his cards first before one of the opposing players sheds all of their cards. Allowable plays are singles, pairs, triplets, quads and runs of three+ cards and staircases of three+ sets (note that runs/staircases may only involve 4's through K's). There are no "bombs".

If the high bidder wins, then the other players pay him the amount of points bid, and if the high bidder loses, then the each of the other players are paid the amount of points bid. Online implementations of the game generally play for a predetermined number of rounds and the individual player with the most points at the end of the last round is considered the winner.
87732.name: Big 3

84028.description:
CrossRoads is a competitive RPG board game. The game can be played with a light conquest approach or a very strategic competition between players. Repeatable play is very enjoyable and different each time.

Game Play: Each player will play with a hand of cards with each card having three potential uses during the game. Managing your cards requires strategy, planning, resource consideration, sacrifice, and making the right card selection to replenish your hand.

Players can choose to discard their cards to travel the game board and earn experience. They can use their cards to put together combination attacks against creatures in a quest to earn experience. The third option is to use cards to heal themselves when life gets too low. The game play is dynamic and competitive with other player disrupting plans and having plans of their own. You will need to manage your cards and maneuver your opponents to win the game.

Goal: The goal of each player is the have the highest experience total at the end of the game. Experience is earned by using cards to either travel over the players color on the game board or by using them to damage a creature within a quest.

Box: Wealth beyond belief is promised to the bravest and most acclaimed adventurer who can purge Dark Lion Pass of its frightful dwellers. However, everyone knows that the pass cannot be cleared by a lone adventurer.

You join a group of adventurers that agree to work together to clear the menace from Dark Lion Pass and share the treasures and glory that come from accomplishing such a grand feat. The agreement is a loose alliance… each adventurer seems to be attempting to steal the glory and hoard the best treasures.
Are they attempting to be the bravest adventurer and keep all of the reward for themselves?

During the adventure you will try to gain as much glory as you can by stealing the treasure and doing the most damage to the creatures that lurk in the passes. You may also manipulate the path that your party takes to enhance your glory even further in Crossroads at Dark Lion Pass.

Can you manage all of this with the limited resources at your disposal? Only time and an adventure of a lifetime will tell. Welcome to Crossroads at Dark Lion Pass!
84028.name: Crossroads at Dark Lion Pass

84029.description:
From eBay listing (Michelle Murray, used with permission):

This is a cardboard board game cut off of a cereal box. It's called "Sgt. Preston Gets His Man" and comes with the playing field, a spinner, 4 little pawns and instructions. To make the spinner work, you would put a straight pin through the center and twirl it--there should be a tiny cardboard pointer but that part is missing [in the photos]. The cardboard playing board is about 6" x 6", the spinner is 1 3/4" across, and each little pawn is 1/2" x 1/2". There is no date but it's probably 1950s.

88126.description:
Time's Up! Family is a charades-based party game for teams of two or more players (and is best with teams of two). Before the game begins, each player looks at several cards featuring well-known items, crafts and animals and chooses some of them. Each player's cards and shuffled to form a deck, and this deck is used for each of the game's three rounds.

In each round, team members take turns trying to get their teammates to guess as many words and phrases on the cards as possible in 30 seconds. In round 1, almost any kind of clue is allowed, and the cluegiver cannot pass on a card. In round 2, no more than one word can be used in each clue (but unlimited sounds and gestures are permitted); the cluegiver can pass on any card he likes, and the teammates can give only a single answer. In round 3, the cluegiver can use no words at all and can pass as often as he likes; again, teammates are allowed only a single guess. Give good physical clues in round 1, and they'll pay dividends down the road when you need to keep your mouth shut and gesture like a maniac before time's up!
88126.name: Sag's mir! Familie

88127.description:
Set up the 12 bowling pins and aim to get a strike. This game is fun for everyone and will unleash your competitive side!

Object of the game is to knock all the bowling pins down and score a strike.


Comes with: 1 Bowling Alley, 12 Bowling Pins, 2 side supports
1 Score Sheets
1 Instruction Sheet
2 Bowling Balls
1 Monkey Bowler

88128.description:
From the front cover: The animals are escaping. Capture the most to win and become head zoo keeper.

User summary: A roll-and-move game where the players are zookeepers trying to catch all of the animals that have escaped from the zoo. Based on the roll of a die in the game's unique elephant dice tower, a player will either move his pawn the indicated number of spaces, attempting to land on and capture an animal, or follow the instructions on an event card. When all of the animals have been captured, the player with the most animals wins.

88129.description:
Excerpt from page 3 of the rules: Gulf War involves the use of military maneuvers and the careful use and selection of weapons, in order to achieve sea, ground and air supremacy. Gulf War is made up of two teams, regardless of the number of players.

Excerpt from page 1 of the rules:
Long Version (Game One): The object of game 1 is to completely destroy and eliminate your enemy from the game board by using your various weapons.
Short Version (Game Two): The object of game 2 is to maneuver your flag on the game board, as well as protect it by using your various weapons. In addition, weapons must eliminate your opponent's flag to achieve victory.

From the front of the box:
Dedicated to all those who helped liberate Kuwait!

88130.description:
The Wild, Which-Way-Did-They-Land Game

Spotcha! takes fast eyes and faster hands. Start by tossing the 18 oddball objects and watch how they land. Flip a card and the race is on. Is the lawn mower rightside-up? Is the ghost face down? Look, the wizard hat is on its side! Quick, grab the correct scoring flags before anyone else. Everybody plays on every turn, so it's all-out, mad-cap fun for everyone!

84037.description:
A mini-game from the oldschool French magazine Casus Belli (Issue 18 - Dec 1983). In the game, adventurers must seduce the Queen of the Kingdom of Passion and eliminate all others courtiers while controlling military patrols. The game is a mix between roleplaying games and boardgame as each player defines the seduction and discretion score for his character. Several magic items may be found to help him in his mission.
The game can be played by 2 to 4 players.
The game has only 10 counters : 4 characters and 6 patrols.
It needs 2 d6 dices to play.
The games ends when a character has managed to sit on the throne besides the queen and all other players are captured, or it ends when all the characters are captured and remain in the depths of the dungeon.

88136.description:
"An informative route game around the island of Texel"

This is a roll-and-move game published to promote tourism on the Dutch island of Texel. The players throw the die to move their pawn across 87 spaces on a map of the island; the first player to reach the finish, wins.

89100.description:
"Battle of Cannae" is the 3rd postcard wargame published by Formosa Force Game in 2011. It simulates the "Battle of Cannae" in 216BC.

Components:
Two players lead 11 Roman units and 7 Carthage units respectively. The battlefield is a 6X9 grids map. There are three kinds of soldiers including cavalry, heavy infantry, and light infantry.

Sequence of play:
Two players do actions alternatively. The Carthage player act first. He need to move all units and then units next to enemy units can attack. In each battle, two players roll 1D6 and add the unit combat value. The difference of the result determine which side needs to retreat or flip the counter. The cavalry unit can move for 3 grids and infantry can move for 1 grid.

Victory condition:
Player who eliminates half of opponent's army win the game immediately.

88140.description:
This is a strategic marble stomping game.
Outwit your opponents by stomping their marbles before they stomp yours!
Outmaneuver by leaving their "stomper" trapped with no escape. OUTSTOMP the competition and you win!
Each player has a "stomper" piece with a marble of a different color attached to the top. On a player's turn, he or she may stomp any marble (by putting it on top of it, knocking it underneath the board), not in the outside ring. On the following turn, the player can stomp any adjacent marbles of the same color, or stomp a marble matching the color of his/her "stomper" piece.

88142.description:
Toussaint L’Ouverture and the slave insurrections in Saint-Domingue (now Haiti), the richest trading colony in the new world, shocked and terrified Western Nations. Not since Spartacus had slave rebellions succeeded on such a grand scale. However, this story cannot be confined to a single leader like Toussaint. It is far more complicated, riddled with intrigue and rife with defections. There is no shortage of villains, and heroes are often conflicted. On the surface, the topic is obscure but the ramifications for this conflict were incredibly far-reaching.

Black Eagles is a card assisted, multi-player, area movement cube game that covers the period 1792-1804. Black Eagles is broken into four distinct scenarios: the "Rights of Man," or the introduction of republican ideals to the island; "Imperial Designs," or the invasion of English and Spanish forces; "Civil War," internal conflict between the Mulattos and the rebel leaders; and finally "Leclerc Invades," featuring Napoleon's attempt to restore slavery to the island.

Black Eagles allows one (yes, there is a solitaire version) to four players to command one of five historical rebel leaders, Toussaint L'Ouverture included, as well as Napoleon's veteran general Charles Victoire Emmanuel Leclerc. Those not commanded by players become factions available for alliance, along with the Gros Blancs, the Petits Blancs, the Spanish, the French, and the English, each provides the controlling player with a special ability. Alliances are fluid, as is the allegiance of the very units under your command. The more of the island's economy a player controls the more havoc he can cause with the funds he collects. On the other hand, the player who carries the least influence automatically controls the Petits Blancs and no matter how weak a player is, he can always attack a stronger player's economic base.

Black Eagles is no longer in its infancy. Play testing has proven it to be well worthwhile. Scenario play ranges from 90 minutes to four hours. Components include a 22" by 34" map, 45 card events that affect play in various turn phases --cards also provide resolution for the devastating Yellow Fever. THe game will include Player aids, hundreds of 6mm colored cubes (factional combat units), and several sheets of miscellaneous markers.

85005.description:
With each card played, you gain more information about the loot — or sanctions — that may be yours for the taking in different American cities. Basing upon this information, you send out the members of your gang to those cities: some are pros, some are wannabes.

Whoever has the most gang members in a city cashes the loot or undergoes the sanction. When going to Chicago, you have no choice but to split your takings with the boss himself: Al Capone. The further the game progresses, the higher the stakes are getting, especially in Chicago.

The Boss is essentially a card game (with a small game board for keeping scores) of deduction, bluffing, and a lot of backstabbing.
85005.name: The Boss

88145.description:
Combat Command is a fully playable set of rules that allow you to fight larger skirmish actions of World War II in four hours or less!

Only 18 pages of core rules, all writen in an easy to read style, backed up by over 140 pages of table of organization and equipment data - including airplanes - for all major nationalities!

Scale: one figure equal one man, one weapon, or one vehicle.

name.#text: Combat Command: World War II Skirmish Rules for 25mm Miniatures

88147.description:
You are the heir to the throne, but the monarch might live a very long time. You intend to speed things along, but it will only work if the major personalities in the kingdom back your play. You need to buy, trick, or eliminate anyone who might stand in your way.

In this solitaire Decktet game, personality cards represent different people in the kingdom who you need to control; personalities are the cards done up like face cards, with two close ups of a single figure. All of the other cards represent elements which you can use to control personalities. Your goal is to "influence" every personality card in the deck by paying one or more cards from your resource row that each share at least one suit with the targeted personality and have a combined value of at least the personality cards value.

If you influence all the personalities in the deck than you win! Miss even one though, or end up with no available moves, and its the headsman's block for you.

84052.description:
Stand alone miniatures rules set for survival modern horror gaming. 28mm scale (though can really be used for any scale). Book contains several scenarios providing different challenges for the zombie survival genre.

From the back of the book:

No More Room In Hell - Surviving the Zombie Apocalypse allows you to create a group of characters amidst the end of the living world...and the start of the living-dead world. Who will survive? Who will feed the Zeds? It's up to you to select the skills, the traits and the gear that you think that your survivors will need to face the rising zombie tide.

Featuring a campaign system, stand-alone games, random scenario, and quick-play random character generation, anything goes. You'll need to fight the dead and the living as you struggle to gather enough food, ammunition and food for your band.

85861.description:
This is man to man combat card game base of "Fist of the North Star", is Japanese manga/anime.
Each player control one character from story. A battle is done by the card play in battle royal form.
Various techniques of the battle styles that it appeared with a combination of the card and the dice can be used.
The player who survived to the game end is a winner.

88152.description:
This is a game from India published for the purpose of educating children in the teachings of the guru Gnani Purush Shri Ambalal Muljibhai Patel, also known as Dada Bhagwan. It consists of two separate boardgames: "Dada's World", which teaches about how to behave apropriately in given situations and answer questions about the guru's teachings; and "Guess, Who Am I?", which focuses on identifying role models.

Game 1 (Dada's World) - Players roll a die and move along a track which represents their journey through Dada's World, collecting rectangular plastic "coins" with a variety of point values.
Landing on marked spaces along the track can either add points (Helped Poor Person: 100), subtract points (Killed a cockroach: -150), provide the opportunity to answer questions about Dada's teachings to earn points (Dadai Dhamaka), lose turns, take extra turns, go back to Home, and other similar effects. At certain points on the track, players have the opportunity to pay points to take a shorter route.
The winner is the first player to make a complete circuit of the track and return to the start space with 1500 points or more. Players who complete the track with fewer than 1500 points must go back to an earlier square and try to accumulate more points.

Game 2 (Guess, Who Am I?) - Players roll a die and move along a track collecting pieces of three separate puzzles. Most of the spaces on the board are marked with a statement associated with one of the three "role models" - Parents, Dadashri and Humanity. When landing on a space on the board, players must identify which role model is associated with the statement on that space (example: Space #17 "We should bow down to them every day" is associated with Parents). Correctly identifying the role model allows the player to take the puzzle piece associated with that space.
Other spaces give the player a free random puzzle piece, allow the player to take a piece from another player, or cause the player to lose a turn. Players who reach the end of the track without winning the game move back to Start and continue to collect puzzle pieces.
To win, a player must collect all 12 pieces of one of the three puzzles. He may then assemble the puzzle to see a picture representing one of the role models, then flip the pieces over to reveal a message.

From the rule booklet:

Hello kids!!!

Time to enter DADA'S WORLD filled with excitement, fun & learn.....

This 2-in-1 Game Pack offer dual knowledge and fun, Get the tracks right from 'Home' to 'Simandhar City' and back 'Home' in Game 1. If you follow the rule you are IN, if you refrain then you commit a SIN.

Also recognize the ROLE MODELS of your life by learning their virtues and identifying them in Game 2. Abount Parents, Dadashri and humanity is what we get to learn.

Wow! So much to do, so much to learn, so little time we want more fun, then grab on this Game Pack 2-in-1.

name.#text: Fun and Gnan: 2 in 1 Game Pack

84057.description:
Starship Marines is an Starcraft boarding game done by Jim Wallman for minimum two players, with no limit in players. The game itself is a print and play type, and available for free download.

From the Introduction in the basic rules:
Starship Marine is a set of science fiction wargame rules, designed for use with toy soldiers. The basic idea is that there is a battle to control and capture a starship by a boarding party moving down the corridors and rooms of the ship. One side controls the attackers, who are mostly composed of the eponymous 'Starship Marines', and the defenders, usually less well armed crewmen, with perhaps a smattering of Marines to stiffen the defense. The deck plans can either be drawn out or built in 3D, depending on your preferences and time available. The scale of toy soldier is 25mm or 1/72, and any make of figures can be used [...]

The minimum you need are a few toy soldiers, some dice, a large sheet of paper with a deck plan on it, and the rules. A typical small game takes about a hour or so (longer if you like arguing about rules). The largest game we know of, to date, involved some 60 people, hundreds of toy soldiers, and many very very big sheets of paper.[...]

88155.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Telegruv is the new party game that takes the classic game, Telephone, to the next level. Draw cards illustrating popular dance moves including: The Twist, The Snake, and Brush Your Shoulders Off. Perform these moves for your teammates and get ready to laugh as your team tries to keep your dance sequence intact all the way down the line. The more moves that are completed correctly, the more points your team scores.

The game is ready to play and includes 95 dance cards of varying genre and difficulty, 5 wild cards, a 90-second sand timer, scoring pads, and pencils.

Telegruv is the party game that gets you on your feet!

88166.description: Call-it! is a fast-paced word-burst game. Each player has a category card that represents him/her (and it turned over for the other players to have memorized). The players take turns flipping symbol cards. When you reveal a symbol that matches an opponent, you have to be the first to call out a word from their category in order to win their card. The person who collects the most cards wins.

88167.description:
A variant of Apples to Apples, presented in an apple-shaped box, that includes 'Apple tokens' in three colours: 20 green (1 point), 8 red (2 points), and 2 gold (3 points).

Apples to Apples Family uses two decks of cards: Things and Descriptions. Each turn, the current referee selects a Description and other players try to pick, from the cards in their hands, the Things that best match that Description. The referee then chooses the Thing that appeals most and awards the round to the player who played it. When a player wins a round, they receive a random token. The first player to five points wins the game.

88168.description: It takes more than a steady hand and an eagle eye to win at this dart-based trivia game. Players or teams compete to score points by throwing their magnetic darts at the target. To score points, you must answer questions based on the color-coded category you land on. Show your skills by trying to land on your favorite category such as Sports, Geography, Arts & Entertainment, and History. The first player or team to score 300 points wins the game!

publishers: Department of Natural Resources, Michigan Parks & Recreation
84074.description:
Players roll a die to move their piece along the track and answer questions about the Michigan State Park System and nature. The first player to reach the campfire wins.

The game is made of recycled materials and labels are supplied to stick onto bottle tops to create player tokens.

(User Summary)

82962.description:
Tower Defence, is a quick, easy to play and easy to customise game of vertical tile placement.
This 2 player game involves building Defence Towers, as high and well armed, as possible to beat your neighbours Tower.

You score points for every tile placed and you can also score points for each weapon you have.

Players take turn laying sections down to build a high and well armed Defence Tower. These sections each have a point value which are added together at the end of the game. The weapon sections also have a seperate value, which equal the number of dice thrown to add to that score. The winner is the highest Tower value plus weapon score.

88176.description:
Contact is a solitaire game, where the player manages and deploys small naval task groups to accomplish random missions that will make up a campaign.

There are two major parts in this game:
- The mission planning/resource management
- The mission execution itself.

First the player determines what forces he will use depending on ships available and mission limitations.
Then, the player allocates weapons (anti ship and anti sub resources) to the platforms he chose.
Finally, the mission itself takes place, where the player deploys the task force in formation (by using a board that mimics a Radar display), and tries to accomplish the mission objectives, that include amongst others:

- Sub hunting
- Convoy Escort
- Sea Superiority
- Convoy raid
- Blockade
- Strategic Strikes

Each mission will have a variable number of turns to be completed and specific objectives, but the Tactical Cards may change all that! Sometimes Intel fails miserably!

The game is composed by:

- 24 Mission Cards - They will define the mission, the objectives, Victory Points, Standing Orders, Rules of Engagement
- 27 Tactical Cards - Will contain random events that will occur throughout the mission.
- 1 Game Board / Radar Display - Where the action takes place!
- 45 Ship Cards - Contain all the relevant information for each unit.
- 45 Ship Counters - To represent the ship card in the board.
- More than 100 counters representing the weapons used by the friendly forces and OPFOR.
- 64 Opposing Force unit counters, that can be either deployed by mission card or drawn randomly by Tactical cards. These include ships, subs and air raids.
- 36 contact counters - Using NTDS symbols, these will represent the location of the enemy forces (or uknown/neutral ones!), until they are positively identified.
- A few system counters
- 1D10 and 1D6 dice will be needed

As a starting point, this game will have one campaign included (Cold War 1985), but others can be easily added later, either by just using the existing components/era settings or by creating new ones.

WEBSITE (under construction): www.pbshots.biz/contact

89107.description:
DataMan is an space themed educational game that comes with a "DataMan calculator", 12 cards and 4 dual sided boards. Each of the 12 cards are printed with sepecific instructions that explain how to set up the the "calculator" for differant games.
The four boards generaly feature a geometric play area as well as instructions for more complicated games.

The DataMan story is generally based around three characters: DataMan, Commander NumberFun and AntiMath. DataMan is a small robot designed by Commander NumberFun who is a ruler of a far away planet. AntiMath is an "Evil wizard from a dark star who has a mysterous power to cloud the minds of his victims and steal away the fun and excitement of mathematics."

88181.description:
Obelix is a fast paced strategy game for 2-4 players, where the goal is to build Towers and control territory faster than your opponents. The trick is – you don’t know which Towers will grow and which will stagnate until the very last moment!

Players begin by constructing a gameboard from territory cards, dealt randomly to each player. No game will ever take place on the same board. Each player begins the game with six territories of their own color, and each territory begins with a random number of Obelix (between 1 and 6).

Attacking an enemy territory is as simple as rolling dice for as many Obelix as a player controls, with one catch - the winner takes the territory without a scratch while the opponent loses every Obelix on the card. Players attack and defend while reinforcing territories via the luck of the dice, and the first player to place all of their Obelix on the board takes the win.

88182.description:
Pixl is an abstract strategy game based around the balance of elements (fire, earth, water, and spirit). Players lay down blocks of their color and attempt to convert or erase opposing elements -if a Pixl is cornered by two pieces of the opposition a number of points may be awarded depending on the status of the opponent. Each player has the advantage when pursuing their "prey" element and must be eternally weary of their "predator" - who is always hunting them.

The game is structured so as to create an abstracted modern art piece by the conclusion of every game, as the elemental Pixls spiral around each other. While each player has a multitude of Pixls, only one piece in the game (the Port) may move - players must work to master the immobile Pixls and the Port necessary for their survival.

88183.description:
From the rulesheet:

"The object of Lawyer, the Game is to be the Player with the most money at the end of the game. You make money when you land on teal squares and you lose money when you land on fuchsia squares. Suing and being sued are another way to make or lose money. And at the end of the game, merchandise that you purchased along the way to The Good Life is figured into your final assets at a value 2 to 3 times greater than its original purchase price."

A simple roll-and-move game with a spiraling track, and spaces where you can pick up event type cards and buy merchandise. Has event spaces that allow you to "Sue your Neighbor", at which time the player may choose to "sue" any other player, for whatever made-up reason they choose. Lawsuits are settled by die rolls.

Game also comes with several dime store type toys that represent merchandise.

Game is subtitled "The hilarious game of negotiation and frivolous lawsuits".

84088.description:
This is the version of Fauna for the younger ones.

As in Fauna it is all about animals. It is a trivia game where you get a picture of an animal and all players can guess on where the animal is living (six different vegetation zones), how much is the weight (no numbers only comparisons to seven different objects), if it lay eggs and if it eats only plants.

The first player guessing right will get 2 points, the other are only getting 1 point.

So Fauna junior is much easier than Fauna.

91477.description:
I think some of the best games have a number of characteristics in common: they have simple rules, they are quick and they have a high replayability factor. The Stonehenge games are a good example of this. With this in mind, I recalled a number of these games and all of a sudden, there was the idea of creating a game of my own; a quick racing game with easy rules and a high replayability factor: Stonerush.

Number of players: 3–5

Object of the game: The players are druids who come home to Stonehenge after a hard days work. As part of their daily ritual (or just having fun), they try to be the first to run around the great stone circle. The player whose druid arrives first on case 30 of the outer ring is the winner.
Getting Started

Equipment: - The board
- The number cards: you will need all the cards, except the "night"-cards from 13 to 30.
- The trilithon cards
- The 5 figures, also called druids (even with 3 or 4 players!)

Ending the Game

When a figure reaches case 30 of the outer ring, the players reveal their trilithon card. The player whose color matches that of the figure that reached case 30 is the winner. If this color belongs to no-one (for example in a 3-player game), the winner is the player who has advanced the most.

Variant: for a quicker game, use the bluestones as the racing track.

88190.description:
(From the rear of the box:)

The road to the Rhine, and beyond to Berlin, seemed wide open in the early fall of 1944. The German armies in France had ceased being organized formations and were streaming back to the Reich in willy nilly fashion, hotly pursued by the Western Allied armies as they dashed through Paris and to the borders of Germany. The First US Army (with the Ninth later on), hit the Westwall on September 12th and was destined to slog through the mud and rain for months against the fortifications and surprisingly resilient German reserves hurriedly thrown against them in a desperate bid to keep the American army off as much German soil as possible. Additionally, lack of supply served to further restrain the American advance. Would the war be over by Christmas, or would the Germans pull off a second “Miracle of the Marne” and hold long enough to launch a counteroffensive in the west ?


(from Decision Games website:)

HURTGEN: Hell’s Forest is a grand-tactical simulation of that enormous campaign. The 2,240 counters in the game represent almost every formation, at company and battalion levels, which fought in the battle, including US, German, British, and even Belgian units. Infantry, armor, anti-tank, reconnaissance, engineer, assault gun, howitzer, rocket, parachute, ranger, glider, and headquarters units are all fully represented in the counter-mix. The two map sections are an accurate representation of the battle area and were compiled from 1944 German staff maps and 1943-1944 US Army map sources. The area portrayed shows all primary and secondary roads, trails and other types of terrain in relation to their suitability for armor and infantry, along with all the villages, towns and cities that proved to be the bastions of the German defense, as well as every creek and river that couldn't be crossed by wheeled vehicles without a bridge.

THERE are three main scenarios representing each of the offensive periods of September, October and November. A smaller learning scenario depicts the US 28th Infantry Division’s ordeal as it attempted to drive on the Roer River dams through the forest of the area. Players may also play continuously from September to the first week of December (almost 300 game turns!). The big challenge for the allied player is to see if he can reach the Rhine River months ahead of the actual date, and shorten the war considerably. Extensive supply, weather and air power rules are included.

THIS latest edition of the Grand Operational Simulation Series (which began with Wacht am Rhein) presents further refinements to the combat, artillery and supply subsystems in order to better depict tactical and operational warfare at this scale. For example, rules for “Lull” periods have been added in order to allow players to speed up game play during periods of relative inactivity. These Lulls compress game play from three turns per day to one, allowing players to cover longer intervals of historic time. Other additions feature level-two entrenchments that allow the German player to create fortified bastions in German towns and cities that can better withstand Allied barrages and ground assaults, along with rules that represent the logistical nightmare faced by the Americans during much of the battle.

THE orders of battle have been extensively researched in order to provide an accurate and functional depiction of the armies of both sides. The incredibly hodge podge nature of the resurrecting German army is shown through the depiction of the various rear area units and replacement army battalions that appear almost randomly throughout the game.

GAME SCALE
• Map: 1 mile per hex
• Time: 3 Game Turns per day
• Units: Infantry and Artillery are battalions. Armor is depicted at the company level.
• Each strength step is equal to a company.

GAME COMPONENTS
• 2 22x34” Four Color Map sheets
• 2,240 Die-Cut Playing Pieces (ACTUALLY 1,960!)
• One Rule Booklet
• One Scenario Booklet
• One Full color Examples of Play Booklet
• Player Aid Charts
• Two 10-sided Dice
• Storage Bags
• 11x17x2 inch box

88191.description:
This is a religious-themed trivia game. The trivia questions are religious in nature and are asked and answered in a mechanism simulating a simple baseball game.
Contents include: game board, question & answer booklet, eight markers (pegs), 6 sided die. Instructions are included in the Q&A booklet

87745.description:
This is a climbing game that has the rare status as being regarded as good for 2 players. It uses a 48 card deck, with three 2's and one Ace removed. Like Big Two or Tien Len, the 2 is high, Ace's next, and the remaining cards normal down to three.

Allowable plays are singles, pairs, triplets, runs singles (5+ cards), consecutive pairs or triplets (2+ sets), full house (triplet+pair), and bombs (four of a kind plus an additional card, except for aces, where its a triplet plus an additional card).

The game is played for points - you get as many points as are remaining in your opponent's hand, unless he is holding 16, 15, or 14 cards, in which case you would just get 50, 40, or 30 points (respectively). A typical threshold for winning the game is 60 points.

89652.description:
Sword & Shield is a tactical game of fantasy combat for 2 or more players. Using playing cards, figures, and a chess or checkers board you can fight out gritty fantasy battles.

The heart of the system lies in using a standard deck of 54 cards. These govern your ability to move and fight. Your ability to play the cards to your advantage will determine victory more so than simple luck of the draw.

Sword & Shield combines card drawing, tactical card play, and fantasy miniatures maneuvering into a simple 2 pages of rules!

This first release contains: Humans, Elves, Dwarves, Orcs Goblins, Giant Spiders, Skeletons, Zombies, Lizardmen and the dreaded Cthull all await your presence in the arena!

Pick up your copy of Sword & Shield, and let the battle begin!

89541.description:
Get ready for a new wave of fun with all new questions about the Scranton, Pennsylvania, branch of Dunder Miffin.

Based on the hit NBC sit-com "The Office", players move from cubical to cubical, collecting Dundie tokens along the way.

You'll hear people talking in the Parking Lot and have to guess who the quotes belong to. In the Break Room all the people from the show, who don't work in Scranton, show up to give you some special trivia. Most cards feature two levels of questions, Assistant to the Regional Manager and Regional Manager, so fans of all levels can play together.

name.#text: The Office Trivia Game: The Sequel

87746.description:
(from the designer:)

Soldiers of the Rising Sun (SRS) is a simulation of warfare in the Pacific Theatre of Operations during World War Two.

Each Turn represents part of a day. Each military unit represents a company or platoon. Each section of track is one to three kilometers in length.

This is a counter and map simulation using a point-to-point movement and combat system.

It's envisaged that SRS will have a number of modules, each depicting a certain stage of the conflict in the PTO. These modules will be divided into a number of scenarios. Each scenario presents a challenge to both sides, with clear objectives which must be achieved in a limited number of turns.

The first module, Gathering Storm, focuses on the opening battles of the Kokoda Track Campaign.

84114.description: You create funny sentences using randomly drawn cards in this game. The box contains 1500 words on 250 word cards (also a die, player figures, sheets for notes) and the rulebook provides 4 different modes on how you can play the game. If you play it four-play it can be played as a partnership game as well. It's a game of fun but you also have to use your brain to make your partner or the other players find out the words. But be careful as you can use only three words!

89795.description:
Players are competing for customers who arrive in a known order, but who have different demands. Do you put your precious resources up for grabs to lure customers, or do you spend them on additional docking bays? Be wary of the government officials who aren't picky about what they take from you and only give you half as many points!

Components, rules, and example of play are available in the Files section.

84116.description:
Based on and bearing the name of the popular Hungarian television show (Megasztár, meaning "Mega-star", this is a board game with a karaoke dvd included. Each player or team sings one of the songs, then the other players or teams must vote which one they liked most, the second and third most (they get 3, 2 and 1 points respectively). You also get points if your presentation was voted the most creative, most humorous or you had the best voice. The scoring track has some special fields that can make you advance or step back; also some "camera" fields where you have to give an interview as a star and the other players are going to vote how much they liked the interview.
(user description)

88214.description:
Wizards and sorcerers from all around the world get together in a contest of potions. They open the old Grimoires and start selecting potions and ingredients. The rules are strict and only the best will prevail.

Potions Festival is card game were the players collect ingredients to make potions. The ingredients are at the center of table and the potions are hidden. The ingredient cards are placed or moved to match the sequence of the potion.. They must lie in single path. You can choose any needed ingredients as long as
they are connected in a single path. You cannot backtrack at the
path or pass twice by a card.

There are four kinds of ingredients and three types of magic. At the end of the game additional points are earned by who have most from each type of magic and also for those who collected all three types.

Includes:

•Red Deck (33 cards)
•Blue Deck (40 cards)
•Game Rules Document

89113.description:
