In this hilarious game where everyone's a critic, laugh, chat, and play away with 200 NEW creative questions on movies, music, television, celebrities, and all things pop culture.

Loaded Questions Pop Culture, just like the original and various versions, tests how well players know one another. It is the perfect game for anyone who loves movies, books or television. Questions include "If you ran a celebrity zoo, who would be your star attraction?" and "Which millionaire would you like to get a Christmas check from?" Matching people with their answers will score points for you. Loaded Questions Pop Culture comes with 200 new and hilarious questions that your family will love. You can play with enclosed components or the original game (original game sold separately)

84122.description:
From the Introduction

"From the fourth of our attempts to hammer DBR into an historical mould we reach forward to 1636, to the height of the Thirty Years War. Gustav Adolph has been in his grave for four years and the Swedish aura of invincibility has been shattered at Nordigen in 1634. Nevertheless, the Swedes are nothing if not resilient and under one of Gustav's outstanding lieutenants, Johann Baner, they have reconstituted their army and gone back on the offensive.

"John George, Elector of Saxony, has changed sides once again and now marches with the Imperial forces of Melchior Hatzfelt. With a combined army of 20,000 men the two outnumber the Swedes, and Baner has fallen back.

"Having seemingly disposed of the Swedish threat the Imperials have slackened their pursuit. Whereupon Baner has immediately turned on them, cutting off the joint army from the remaining Imperial troops in the neighborhood, and preparing to attack them near the small town of Wittstock on the river Dosse.

User Summary

Scenario comes with deployment information, army lists, orders of battle, etc.

Scenario appears in Wargames Illustrated #186 (March 2003)

88219.description:
Game Overview
Cabin Fever is a small, dice-based scoring game with the theme of escaping a cabin during a harsh winter. Players begin the game "snowed in" requiring them to "dig out," or score 100 points before they may begin collecting points. The first player to score 1,000 or more points wins the game! The game has a strategy component where players may trap other players in the cabin, preventing them from scoring.

Special scoring situations have easily recognizable winter themed monikers. Players encounter obstacles along the way in the form of certain types of die rolls ("squalls," "thaws," "broken chairlifts") which may end their turn or put them in the cabin. In addition to obstacles there are special die rolls that immediately reward a player such as "vacations" and "chairlifts".

Setup
Cabin Fever is designed for 2-8 players with an optimal number of 3 or more players. A game can be played with more than 8 players at the consequence of extending the game's duration. All that is needed in addition to the game is a pad of paper and a pencil or pen with which to keep score.

Gameplay
Each player rolls a single die to determine who starts the game. The highest roll goes first (after resolving ties). All players are considered “snowed in” and must "dig out" by rolling 100 points or more on the scoring dice. Once a player digs out he or she ends his or her turn and passes the scoring dice to the next player on the left (clockwise) and may begin scoring on his or her next turn. The first player to accumulate 1,000 points wins the game!

The five same color dice included with the game are called scoring dice. Players start a turn by rolling all five dice (opening roll) in an attempt to create matching die faces. Players may elect to end their turn at any time and collect their points (with a minimum requirement of a matching pair). Players may continue a turn to earn more points but must roll at least one match to an existing match, or create a new matching set on each consecutive re-roll of non-matching dice. Dice that have been assigned to a match may not be re-rolled. If players fail to roll a match on a re-roll they immediately end their turn and do not collect any points.

Components
* 5 Scoring Dice (white)
* 1 Vacation Die (green)
* Cabin game piece (clear)
* Cabin Fever rules sheet
* 3 "I have Cabin Fever!" stickers
* Palm-sized, clear acrylic, travel box

88220.description:
Sicic is a game for two. Each player guides a group of Astronomers, aiming at copying the opponent’s Constellation. Sicic is played on two 8 × 8 squared boards, named the Earth and the Sky. Each player has 4 pieces that move on the Earth (the Astronomers) and 4 pieces to be placed in the Sky (the Stars). The Stars are the player’s Constellation. There are three phases: the Afternoon, the Evening and the Night. One of the player will be the first to move in every phase of the game.

In the Afternoon, players alternate placing one Astronomer at a time on the Earth, on an empty square. In the Evening, players alternate placing one Star at a time in the Sky, on an empty square. In the Night, each player must move one of his Astronomer every turn. The Astronomer can move in a direct line in every direction, any number of unoccupied squares. He must land in an unoccupied square. The Astronomer may choose not to move, in order to “pinch” one of the opponent’s Astronomers set in a neighbouring square. The result of a pinch is that the pinched Astronomer must move in the next turn. Moreover, it is forbidden to the opponent, in the second next turn, to pinch an Astronomer that occupies the abandoned square.

The winner is the first player who manages to place his Astronomers in the same way as the opponent’s Stars. Translations, reflections and rotations are allowed. Also, a player can win by pinching an Astronomer that is not able to move.

Sicic is latin for “stellae inerrantes caeli imitatio consequi”.

Online Play: Super Duper Games

88224.description:
Sophia is played on a 4x4 square board. Each player has two sets of 7 pieces. Each set is a different shape. On one of all the pieces is one color, and the pieces are a different color on the other. Each player controls a different shape and each player has one of the two colors they win with.

Drop Phase:On each turn, each player drops one their pieces either side upon an empty cell. When this phase ends-and the goal is not achieved-there will be two empty cells left.

Move Phase:On each turn,each player must do one of the following actions:
1.Move a friendly piece.
2.Jump a friendly piece over another piece, flipping it over to the the color on the other side.
3.A player passes if he does not have any valid action.

Goal:First player wins by making a 4 in-a-row of their chosen color.

90228.description:
WINNER: 2011 CREATIVE CHILD MAGAZINE SEAL OF EXCELLENCE
WINNER: 2011 CREATIVE CHILD MAGAZINE PREFERRED CHOICE
WINNER: 2011 DR. TOY TEN BEST GAMES
WINNER: 2011 DR. TOY 100 BEST CHILDREN'S PRODUCTS
WINNER: 2011 PARENTS' CHOICE RECOMMENDED PRODUCT

SYNONYMS is the exciting word challenge that entertains and educates in a fast-paced and fun board game for ages 10 through seniors.

Players race their pawns around the board to be the first to collect all the letters of the word SYNONYMS. A roll of the die and a card is selected. The player has one minute to earn a letter by naming the designated number of synonyms - unless a competitor declares a challenge! Minds race at maximum brainpower as each tries to top the other. Over 400 cards with over 10,000 empowering words provide hours of word-building fun for the whole family.

Never be at a loss for words again - Play Synonyms!

name.#text: Synonyms: The Word Game That Gets Your Mind Racing!

84132.description:
This 4-dimensional chess variant, using the standard 16 chesspieces and pawns, is played on a 4x4x4x4 board. (A printable 2D version of the board is provided, with coordinate numbers in each square.) This printable gameboard is laid out as a 4x4 arrangement of 16 "levels", each level being a 4x4 2D chessboard. Alternatively, 4 3D 4x4x4 gameboards set up in a row are usable. The game is available on Zillions, in a version by L Lynn Smith.

Piece moves are translated as directly as possible from 2D to 4D, with some adaptations for play balance. So a rook now can move not only north-south and east-west, but up-down and side to side, too, for a maximum of 8 possible directions. Bishops move diagonally within each level, and may also move diagonally from level to level, which simplifies the move somewhat, changing the bishop from a fully 4D piece to one that is 2D+2D. This change makes the game much easier to play.

The knight, on the other hand, rivals the queen in power, because it is the only piece in chess that already moves in 2 dimensions. On a 4x4x4x4 board, it can reach up to 2 dozen spots. The queen combines the moves of rook and bishop, and the king is a one-square queen in movement.

Pawns are the most changed, moving 1 square "forward" or "sideways" - 6 locations in all, and capturing as it moves. This allows 2 pawns to support each other, a useful feature on
a 4D board.

The game is won by checkmate, which with the held king rule, can be achieved in the standard fashion, or it can be forced on a bare king by a king and 2 major pieces, from any legal positions on the board. The held king rule allows a king moving onto the other king's current "level" to pin the enemy king in that level. This solves a major problem in higher dimensional chess, that of mating the opponent on a 4D board, which has so many ways to escape.

84136.description:
From the Introduction

"One of the regular debates that my wargaming colleagues and I seem to have is that of the role assumed by players during a wargame, and hence the level of detail that should be represented. Are we playing ships captains or fleet admirals? In general naval wargamers tend to assume the role of admirals whilst demanding a level of detail more appropriate to a 'game of captains.' For most periods this isn't too much of a problem as the numbers of ships tends to be relatively small, and there are fleet level rules with appropriate levels of abstraction for most periods. However, ancient naval warfare seems to be one period where all available rules operate at the ship level. Obviously this makes battles such as Salamis, with hundreds of ships involved, difficult to handle. I wanted a set of rules that could be used to recreate these enormous battles whilst placing the placing the players truly in the roles of admirals and squadron commanders. At this level the fate of the individual ships, other than those on which the commanders themselves are embarked, is unimportant. Hence, "Greek Fire and Roman Fury" was born.

"The basis for these rules is a theory that the naval battles of antiquity were fought in a style that was essentially similar to typical land actions. Therefore, in these rules, the respective fleets are represented by squadrons rather than individual ships, which are maneuvered around the 'battlefield' in a similar manner to armies. After a few false starts I decided to use the ever popular and quite robust American Civil War Fire and Fury as the basis for the system, hence the name I finally selected for this article."

User Summary

This miniatures rules set comes with information on what sorts of figures to use, and explains fleet composition, ship data (for the various sorts of ships that appear in the game), formations, sequence of play, morale, and a small number of charts

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #187 (April 2003)

84138.description:
From the Introduction

"Once Hannibal had been defeated at Zama in 202 BC, Rome was clear to concentrate on securing and expanding its eastern frontier beyond the Adriatic. The resources required for the Second Punic War had previously forced the Romans to conclude a compromise with peace with Philip V of Macedon, but with the Carthaginian threat removed, it was payback time.

"The neutral states of Rhodes and Pergamum provided an excuse for war, appealing to Rome for aid against Macedonian aggression, and the legions marched towards Greece. Philip blocked the passes onto the peninsula at Epirus, but a consul named Titus Quincticus Flaminius managed to get a small force around the Macedonian flank. Philip, convinced that the whole Roman army was about to descend upon him, pulled back into Thessaly.

"The Romans consolidated their hold on Epirus and voted Flaminius in for another term as consul and therefore military leader. After some intense diplomacy to establish which of the less dominant, minor powers of the region were allied to whom, Flaminius and Philip met at Cynoscephalae, named from the Greek for 'dog's head' after the name of a nearby ridge.

User Summary

Subtitled The Battle of Cynoscephalae 197 BC, this is a scenario for the Vis Bellica miniature wargame system. Scenario includes orders of battle for both sides, features of the battlefield, historical information about the battle, army sheeets for all of the forces, initial deployment, and defeat condition.

Scenario appears in Wargames Illustrated #187 (April 2003)

88245.description:
The Switzerland is a map for 3-4 players. Bond buybacks are permitted.

This is the same Switzerland expansion as was included in Winsome's Age of Steam Expansion: Austria, Switzerland & The Netherlands. It was made available for free by John Bohrer.

88246.description:
“Punic Island” is the third volume in the Campaign Commander series and simulates the campaign for Sicily and North Africa during the First Punic War. The system takes away from Second World War and goes to Ancients. In 264 Roma was summoned to Messina by Mamertines mercenaries to help in their quarrel with Cartage, the main power in Sicily. Carthaginians count on Hiero the Tirant of Syracuse to help defeating the Mamertines. Here begins the First Punic War.
Romans and Carthaginians fought for 22 year over Sicily and in North Africa. Rome emerged victorious and Cartage was obliged to quit his long standing presence in Sicily.
The land campaign was a long string of Roman victories as city after city was subdued and every Carthaginian army was defeated in battle. Syracuse was forced to make an alliance with Rome and Cartage was left with only a few fortresses in the island.
Anyway the war was won and lost in the sea. The war saw the emergence of Rome as a sea-power and a long string of naval victories allow Roman troops to menace even Cartage proper. Only to be saved by Xantipus and his mercenary army at the Bagradas Plains battle. Naval warfare played a prominent role in this war and will give Carthage Senate his las blow. Carthage tried to spend the Roman effort during the whole war. His strategy was of attrition and was unsuccessful; Rome never gave up a prize.
The game is developed in an operational scale – area-based map. It is designed for two players with one running the ROMAN forces and the other the CARTHAGINIAN forces -including Syracuse. The game lasts approximately 3-4 hours and uses a two sided system to handle the mechanics of play: cards and counters. The players will have to use their troops and their resources to obtain victory points while eliminating enemy forces and occupying cities in the map. It is not a card driven game as the cards are used to bring about events that influence battles, secure reinforcements, and provide resources with which to carry on the fight.
The ROMAN player will be on the offensive during the whole game as he has to conquer the whole island to get victory. CARTHAGINIAN player focuses on spoiling Roman campaigns and plans with ambushes, sallies and bad weather cards. Also he has to recruit an army as he doesn´t has any at the beginning of the game.
The ROMAN player must plan his offensives carefully as he will need a new army and resources for each one. Also he will need to build a fleet his doesn´t have at the start of the war. The sea contest will be evenly match and you better take into account bad weather as it sinks more ships than enemy action.
Siege warfare takes a prominent role in this game as every city in the game map is a walled on with his own intrinsic garrison.
Like all the games of this Series, the rules are simple and straight forward. Our objective was to create games that are very interactive, and offer players a pleasant creative experience. We aim for solid games for players who do not have the time or the space to leave a game setup and in place over a long period of play.

Components:
- 1 80x60 cm map of Sicily and North Africa.
- two ten-sided dice
- 176 unit counters
- 1 Rules Book for the Series “Campaign Commander” and Exclusive Rules of “Punic Island”; historical and designer notes.
- 70 cards (divided in two decks, plus help cards)
- 3 plastic bags.

name.#text: Campaign Commander Volume III: Punic Island

88248.description:
With this game players will try to look into their future.

The game is placed in the center of the table. Each turn the player swings the pendulum above the board. The place where the pendulum lands decides wether a player has to use the 'moodring'.
The 'moodring' at the end of the pendulum changes its color when it's put on the player's finger. The player takes the corresponding assignment card and has to fulfill the assignment.
The game also contents 'magic stones'. These stones are needed with some of the assignments.

The object of the game is to learn more about yourself, your friends or about your future.
88248.name: MiYu Das Spiel

84153.description:
Majorities is a new type of game with exceptionally simple rules, bearing little relation to other games as yet. Many variants (including a very natural 3-dimensional version) are possible.

It is based on the fact that in politics, or committees with sub-committees, a minority of people in critical places may nonetheless carry a voting motion. This has long been felt as a weird situation by the game inventor (Bill Taylor), who has devised this family of games to illustrate this phenomenon.

Rules

The board is initially empty. The first player places a stone on any cell, then players take turns placing two pieces per turn on empty cells.

A majority of stones in a line wins that line.
A majority of parallel lines in a direction wins that direction.
A majority of directions wins the game.

Source: Gamerz.net help file by Bill Taylor

Online Play

Boardspace.net Real time, against humans or robot players
Gamerz.net Turn-based

88250.description: Identik, the blue expansion, contains 40 cards thus adding 80 new images to the game, funnier and more hilarious than ever.
88250.name: Identik Erweiterung Blau

88253.description:
Unconditional Surrender! Case Blue (USCB) is a small, free Print-n-Play two player game covering the World War II military campaigns fought in southern Russia during 1942-1943. One side controls the Axis forces, while the other side controls the forces of the Soviet Union.

GMT Games printed it, with real counters, in their C3I magazine issue #28 in 2014.

USCB is a derived from the game Unconditional Surrender! World War 2 in Europe (USE). Using essentially the same mechanics (plus naval units, strategic warfare, diplomacy, etc.), USE covers the entire war in the European Theater. With only 80 counters, a small map, and much shorter rulebook, Unconditional Surrender! Case Blue provides an opportunity to try out the core of USE's systems.

Design Highlights

Scale: army and air fleet level units; 30 miles per hex; monthly turns
Simple Stacking: Up to one air and ground unit per hex.
No Factors on Counters: There are no combat or movement factors on the counters.
Single Combat System: One combat resolution sequence and Combat Results Table covers air and ground combat, but the results differ for each type.
Integrated Movement/Combat System: Units move and fight in a combined activation.
Historical or Variable Entry: Units and events can enter play using an historical or variable time line.

88254.description:
User Description:

Fruity Bugs is a game from the Tesco Junior range for 2 to 4 players aged 4 and up. The game includes one clockwork, strawberry board, 4 worm cards (1 blue, 1 green, 1 red and 1 yellow) and 20 green worms with coloured tail ends, 5 worms in each of the 4 colours.

You set the game up by randomly placing the worms in the holes in the strawberry and then each player selects a colour. The aim of the game is to be the first player to get all 5 worms in your colour. There is a lever at the top of the board, pull it and release to make the worms start wiggling (you'll have to repeat this frequently throughout the game as it only lasts for 10 seconds or so).

Once started players take it in turns, beginning with the youngest player, to grab a worm from the strawberry. If it matches their card they keep it, if not they put it back and then the next player goes. You keep going around until one player gets all of their 5 worms.

This is a very simple kids memory game with a dexterity element as you try and grab the wiggling worms as they move up and down in the board.

84159.description:
One of the great board game classics is the satirical Junta in which the players are members of the corrupt government of República de las Bananas struggling for power and money to put in their Swiss bank accounts. "Junta: ¡Viva el Presidente!" continues this idea. Several years have passed since the island was afflicted by unrest and attempted putsches. Since then, the army has lost importance; in its place, private militias do the dirty work. The members of the Junta live a reclusive life in grandiose estates financed by their Swiss bank accounts. The players belong to this Junta and now command their own private militias. And, as before, they rob their opponents unscrupulously and ambush the president as often as they can in order to become president themselves. The players must pocket as much development aid as possible, use this to hire new militias and extend their estates. The player who does this the fastest wins the game.

Game Contents:
- 5 Estates (in 5 player colours)
- 20 dice (in 5 player colours)
- 45 cards
- 5 summary cards
- 5 player screens
- 25 building tiles
- 1 pair of presidential glasses
- 1 set of rules

Source: publisher blurb on www.spiel-check.de translated from the German (see: http://www.spiele-check.de/9712-Junta_Viva_el_Presidente.htm...)

84160.description:
You and your opponent are snipers trying to kill off the members of your opponents army and maybe their sniper.

The Sniper and Hiding places cards form the Sniper Row. The rest make the Trench. On your turn, you take the aiming card and put it on the opponent's card that you're attacking. Roll a d6 to see if you hit. After that it's your opponent's turn and play proceeds until either one's army is terminated or a sniper is fallen.

There are 1 or 2 dice and 54 special cards in the game.
There is 1 Aiming Card and a Pass Card
There's a 26 cards set for each player's army.
Each Army will consist of
1 Sniper (You)
9 Hiding places
1 General
1 Colonel
1 Major
1 Captain
2 Sargent
10 Solders

88263.description: Publisher Description: Justin's got a special message for you. Be the first BACKSTAGE before your friends beat you there! Prove you got the lowdown on Justin's life and his music. Correctly answer the questions as you race through the concert hall. Justin's secret message is waiting for you backstage. Fast and fun, Justin's trivia will keep you and your friends guessing to see who's the biggest fan.

84173.description:
There are always 5 characters in this game: Dracula and 4 hunters. If there are fewer than 5 players, some players will play with more than 1 hunter. The hunters play together as a team.

The board shows three levels of Dracula's castle. In their turn, characters can move to an adjacent room, search the room for objects (e.g. garlic, holy water, daggers, or brides), or attack another character. If an attack is successful, the opponent loses "blood points". A hunter that loses his last blood point may be converted to a vampire; he changes sides and now works together with Dracula.

The hunters win if they kill Dracula; Dracula wins if he has converted all hunters to vampires. Dracula also wins if he returns to his coffin with 4 brides.
84173.name: Van Helsing

90366.description: Simple roll and move around a plastic pyramid. On the top of the pyramid there is a big gem. Thise gem will be spinned and shows different numbers (works as a die). There are also mummies hindering the players to reach the top. First player to reach the top on his colored stairs wins.

88276.description:
Discover an amazing world of warrior heroes, towering castles and brilliant, all-action battles to play with your friends.

The gameplay is fantastic fun - including crossbows and catapults that really do work. Castle towers with "explosive" special effects that send your enemies flying and some serious spells to cast upon anyone who dares oppose you.

So set out your castle keeps, tents, towers, crossbows and catapults. Build your rampart defenses and place your warriors in strategic positions. Then take it in turns to fire your projectiles - including the deadly fireballs, boiling oil and boulder bursts. Destroy your enemies defenses and weapons of awesome power before the destroy you.

Good luck and may glorious victory be yours!

name.#text: Crossbows and Catapults Master Battle Set

88277.description: This is a card game that is a bluffing word guessing game. Each card has three possible answers for each word on the card. Only one of them is correct, can you guess which one?

84183.description:
Publisher blurb:

A Small World Scenario for 3 to 6 players

At first no one noticed the small island on the lake - nor paid any attention to the gnarly pretense of a man who drifted onto it, sitting astride a wooden log with a huge grimoire on his lap employing a shovel as his unlikely paddle. A ghastly green mist soon shrouded the island, wrapping it in a ghostly silence pierced only by a maniacal laughter and some intermittent curses. Then, one moonlit night, an impossibly crooked tower emerged high above the mist, casting a long and dark shadow on the surrounding land... The Necromancer had arrived!

In Necromancer Island, one of the players assumes the role of a dreaded Necromancer who inhabits an island in the center of Small World's central Lake region. He captures the souls of all Race tokens lost to conquests, using them to progressively spawn Ghosts who invade the surrounding Regions. To make matters worse, his Powers grow as his reach across the land increases. If the Necromancer succeeds in bringing all of his Ghosts into play, anytime before the game's end, he wins!

Contains


1 Necromancer Island game piece
1 Well of Souls game piece
14 Ghost tokens
1 Rulebook in English, French & German


Necromancer Island is a free, limited-edition scenario available from game retailers worldwide and for purchasers of a Small World product from the Days of Wonder web store during November and December 2010 only while supplies last

Update December 2013 (Days of Wonders news)
http://blog.daysofwonder.com/2013/12/12/small-world-royal-bo...
"We also reprinted a batch of the long out of print Necromancer Island and an improved version of Leaders of Small World (now including all the races from the Small World Universe, up to the Royal Bonus) for our backers. After fulfilling these Kickstarter rewards, we found ourselves with a few extra copies which we are making available to Small World fans. So while stocks last (and we mean it when we say these are limited in number), you can pick up the new Royal Bonus expansion, Necromancer Island and Leaders exclusively from the Days of Wonder website. Please, note that this offer is limited to one copy of each expansion per order."
84183.name: Small World: Die Insel des Geisterbeschwörers

88280.description:
This is a set of tactical rules for gun-fights and shoot-outs in the setting of the American Wild West. The gun-fights take place as a table top miniature game which uses 25mm scale miniatures. The rules cover everything that is needed to play including character design and stats, scenario creation and even rules for campaign games. There are floor plans included in the rule book, or the game master can create their own.

The battles can take place outdoors for example in the middle of a western town, or even indoors, such as in saloons, banks, etc. Once each player has his character or gang of characters, then each player takes turns moving and firing at each other until there is one player (or team) remaining.

88281.description: This is an expansion book for Fistfull of Miniatures, which contains Scenarios, Army Lists, and New Rules for A Fistfull of Miniatures.

88282.description:
MIND CONTROL HELMET
Pay 3 Fuel to move an opponent's
ship to a different Orbital Facility and
use it as if it were your own ship.

The ship may not change value during the
move and may not be moved onto or
off the Terraforming Station.


The Mind Control Helmet costs more to use than the Orbital Teleporter because you're using a larger pool of other players' ships, almost guaranteeing you can find the right number to accomplish your goal.

It has all of the same restrictions as the Orbital Teleporter...
Cannot remove a ship from the Terraforming Station
Cannot change the ship's value in transit
Cannot use it at the same facility it came from

...plus one extra restriction...
Cannot move a ship onto the Terraforming Station


Two MCH cards were included free if you pre-ordered the base game from the second print run.

A limited quantity of MCH cards are available for separate purchase.

The MCH is included with all copies of the game as of the 3rd edition.
88282.name: Alien Frontiers: Premium Pack

85859.description:
This is man to man combat simulation game based on "Fist of the North Star", is Japanese Manga/Anime.
Each player control one character from story. Each character is shown with a metal miniature. They make the most of various Techniques corresponding to their battle styles.

A player decides Technique to use when the begining of each turn. The movement rate and battle ability of that turn depend on chosen Technique.
The movement is pre-plotted and then executed on the movement board simultaneously. The battle action is select battle chits secretly and then executed on the battle board simultaneously.
The purpose of most scenarios is to knock down a opponent character.

90230.description:
Salmandaar Lite is a semi-coop game for 1-6 players wherein the players spawn armies from castles located at the points of a hexagonal island and try to withstand the invasion of Fire Salamanders pouring forth from the volcano in the center of the island. The island and counters are all contained in the PDF that will be submitted to the file section, as will the instructions.

Player units represent workers, resources and military, and can be spent in attack, to build roads, or to support the generation of more units by providing infrastructure at the player's home castle. Players are expected to generally cooperate in repelling the Fire Salamander invasion, but player combat is possible and might be necessary to defend your castle from players fleeing Salamander overruns of their own lands. Combat with both the invaders and other players is by mutual removal, representing the consumption of both forces and materials and wealth, or will dice rolls, which might result in removal of the enemy without loss of the player unit, or might result in defeat and removal of the attacking unit. Both players and the invading Salamanders will start spawning from any captured castles.

Paper unit markers are provided, and are color-blindness friendly, but wooden cubes of assorted colors would be a great substitute.

At the end of every round (after the last player takes a turn), advance a marker on the turn track. Game ends after ten rounds, or if all players are eliminated. Winner is the player with the most castles and armies afield at game end.

This is a PnP version of a game still in development, Salamandaar (sans Lite,) for the One Sheet PnP contest. The PnP version is a fixed map, though I will provide additional maps. The final non-lite version of the game will feature a fixed intro map over which random map tiles may be placed, or placed according to scenario. The non-lite version will feature a larger map as well, and some more robust player abilities, some more ways to spend units.

Variant: Add a seventh player, who runs the Salamanders, ignoring the target priority rules and moving as he/she wishes.

88289.description:
Laste mälumängudoomino is a junior version of Mälumängudoomino

Game mechanics are the same: trivia game with domino pieces. The tiles have two categories marked on them, out of total ten. The tile placement follows normal domino rules, but each time you are placing a tile, you have to answer a question on the topic marked on the tile in question. The categories in the game are: history, people, nature, geography, computers & technology, entertainment, sports, Estonia, culture and various other information.

The game includes:
100 question cards with 1000 questions
55 domino tiles

88293.description: Idea of the game: The zoo is in a muddle: all the animals may get out of their enclosures and are drawn today. The colour combination of the dice decides which is the next animal to be drawn to complete one's row. Who can draw the longest row of animals. A drawing and dice game. Contains rules for older players.
88293.name: Yatzi Zoo

88296.description:
"BOLSA" simulates the functioning of the stock exchange in the perspective of small investors.

Throughout the year (each month = 1 round) players will have to invest or disinvest in stock in order to maximize their profit.

They can choose between 6 companies, from all sectors of activity and with 3 different profiles - high risk, medium risk and low risk.

As in the real stock exchange, quotations of each company are driven by 3 factors:
- the selling and buying orders from all players, which will bring quotation down or up
- the market trends, simulated by dice casted at the beginning of each month but with effect only at quarter end
- the always breakthrough company news from "Jornal Finanças & Bolsa", released at month end and that may impact one or more, or even all companies.

Each player will have 30 secs to plan it's moves in total secrecy and only then all players reveal their intentions.

At the end of the year you will receive yearend bonus only for the stock you have kept in your hand.

All stocks are then converted to cash and let's count the money.

The richest player wins the game
88296.name: Bolsa: Joga de tabuleiro

88297.description:
From the back of the box:
"Deal up murder and mayhem with the simple murder mystery game that's played with cards. 'Dealing with Murder' requires no fancy parties or petit'fours, just round up your favorite rival detectives and deal them into a baffling murder mystery which unfolds as the cards are dealt.

Who will be the first detective to identify the killer? Will you cooperate with your fellow sleuths...or withhold some evidence...to give yourself an edge in solving the crime?

A singular murder mystery experience for 2 to 6 amateur detectives aged 12 to adult.

Contents include a unique 55 card deck of clues, tips and evidence; crime scene photos and suspect profiles; game instructions and a sealed crime solution.

Object of the Game:
To be the first detective to solve the crime by correctly stating 1)Who the murderer is 2) The motive, and 3) How it was accomplished.

Similar to/same series as:
Dealing With Murder: Fatal Error

88298.description:
A simple roll and move game played on a board made of small wooden jigsaw pieces. The aim of the game is to have most jam in the end. Landing on a space may cause you to gain jam, lose jam, skip a turn or move forward on the track. Reaching the goal first gives a jam bonus.

Winner of the Children's Game of the Year 2010 in Finland.

87079.description:
From the website:

The Scenario:
One year ago, Robert Killingsworth bought the farm. Six months later, he was dead - leaving his widow, Elizabeth, to tend to their fledgling winery and vineyard on the outskirts of California's wine country. With mounting debts and no clue as to how to run a business, Elizabeth is desperate to sell the farm and recoup her losses. The fierce drought and shaky economy, however, have left the Killingsworth Farm on the market for far too long.

One early autumn day, six people passed through the gates of Killingsworth Farm to see Elizabeth - one of them, a cold-blooded Killer...

Those Present at Killingsworth Farm:

Michael Nightshade: This real estate developer from New York arrived unannounced with plans to buy Killingsworth Farm and develop it into a low-cost housing community. His boss ordered him to obtain the Killingsworth land at any price…

Dr. Chelsea Barren: After suffering a nervous breakdown, this psychiatrist and best-selling author moved to Northern California to relax… but she moved next door to the Killingsworths instead.

Vicki D'Adly: Elizabeth's estranged sister from New Jersey, she and her husband were traveling on vacation when Vicki decided to drop by Killingsworth Farm for a visit… a surprise visit.

Norman D'Adly: A real estate broker from New Jersey and husband to Vicki, Norman is trying to salvage his job and his marriage while traveling across the country on vacation.

Kathryn Lawless: Best friend to Elizabeth, this local librarian and historian has a flare for the eccentric. She lives down the road with her 15 cats and loves true crime - especially the mysterious, unsolved death of Robert Killingsworth

Enrique Graves: This young drifter wandered onto Killingsworth Farm just as Robert and Elizabeth were moving in. Elizabeth took a liking to Enrique and he has lived on the farm ever since - tending to the fields… among other things.

Which of these people has a secret worth killing for? Come to Killingsworth Farm and find out before it is too late!

http://www.whodunitmysteries.com/sour.html

88300.description:
Santa has infiltrated the home of Sam Malton, the founder of Mal-Mart. He's on a mission to give coal to the whole family, and if he succeeds, the Holiday season is saved from commercialism. If he fails, Sam and his naughty children will reap the rewards of consumer spending.


Each player randomly and secretly takes the role of one character; Santa , Elf, Sam, Kid, Naughty Kid. Sam and his kids are trying to figure out who Santa is, while Santa is trying to give everyone in the Malton family coal.

This is a rethemed and adapted version of a specialized version of Werewolf (no moderator needed).

Game Files Here
http://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/62211/secret-santa-rules
http://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/62151/secret-santa-compone...

88301.description: Mini version of 'Billiard' or 'Pool'. There are many different versions of this game of skill, but ultimately you have to use a cue stick with which to hit balls into the table's six pockets.
88301.name: Biljard

88303.description:
From the publisher:
Nutimäng is made for 4-5 year old children. It is a simple story telling game, in which adults can aim their kids if needed.Each time you give your kid and question or task, let them finish it and then check the other side of the card if they got it. First child to collect 5 correct tasks/questions is the winner.

The game is put together from national children educational standards.

88304.description:
From the publisher:
Easiest party game for couples. This game is a good way to learn about your friends and family, to find people who think like you.
The couple that wins the game is the one who "clicks" more and gets to the finish first. Only thing you need to do in this game is to pick words from word pairs and then check, if your partner thinks the same. Is it blond or dark - your choice?

88305.description:
From the publisher:
We all take part in traffic and knowing it is not just for drivers. This educational card game teaches about traffic and it contains 40 cards: 36 traffic sign, 3 traffic lights and 1 rule card. It can be used to teach about traffic signs, but it also is a party game for kids as well. The game is simple, you just need get rid of your cards by finding companion traffic sign. Sound easy enough, so now lets start teaching the youngsters...

88316.description:
Autokrator (a.k.a. emperor) is a medieval Euro/wargame about the wars from the 7th to the 11th century between Christians and Muslims. In Autokrator, you control one of the major kingdoms/Caliphates of the Medieval Age – the Franks/Holy Roman Empire, the Moors, the Saracens, the East Roman Empire (Byzantines) – with each kingdom striving to protect and expand its domination.

The players use four characters each round – the King, the General, the Admiral, and the Garrison – with each character having special abilities. What's more, each player has his own "battlecard" deck of armies and must divide them strategically between his characters at the begining of every new turn. The original combat system is based on the choices that the players have, and the battle is fought between five battlefields: Plain, Hill, Forest, City and Ambush. The game lasts five rounds, and players win or lose victory points based on the winning battles and the territories that they control.

Make your choices wisely, and take a chance on becoming the next Autokrator!
88316.name: Autokrator

84230.description:
The Governor`s Daughter has been kidnapped again! The villainous and insatiable Dread Pirate Roberts has again claimed his chance to acquire a ransom for the life and the chastity of a beautiful damsel in distress. This formidable act of villainy has shocked the other pirates of the Archipelago. Never had they witnessed such a breach of etiquette! Now, they set sail to find the fragments of the map leading to Robert`s hideout. But before they find it, adventures and isles await!

Pirates: Governor`s Daughter is a re-edition of an adventure-economical board game hit. Thanks to the brand new rules, you will experience fabulous sea adventures, sack the cities and trade routes of the Archipelago, get rich dealing with exotic wares or die trying to compel bloodthirsty pirates. And in the end, you will free the beauty in distress and save the world from the Dread Pirate Roberts! Arrgh!

88327.description:
Collector is played on a 6x6 square board.
On each turn,a player must drop a friendly stone and a neutral stone,both on adjacent empty cells.
When all cells are occupied,wins the player with the largest group.
Collector is presented at 100 Strategic Games for Pen and Paper by Walter Joris.

88328.description:
Promotional card included in orders from Plaid Hat Games for a period.

Khan Queso is a Champion of the Mercenaries, and his special ability reads:

Plague
After moving Khan Queso, you must roll a die once for each unit that is adjacent to Khan Queso. On a result of 5 or higher, that unit receives one wound marker.
88328.name: Summoner Wars: Chan Quezo

88329.description:
Promotional card included with orders from Plaid Hat Games for a limited time period.

Sairook is a Champion of the Mercenaries, his special ability reads:

Shadow Summon
If Sairook is on the battlefield at the end of your turn, you may choose to remove all wound markers from Sairook and place him back in your hand.
88329.name: Summoner Wars: Sairook

88330.description:
Ambivalence is played on a 6x6 square board. On each turn, each player drops a friendly stone on an empty cell.

In the following cases, stones are transformed into neutral stones:

Custodian: An enemy stone becomes neutral when placed between two friendly stones.
Intrusion: Two enemy stones becomes neutral when a friendly stone is dropped between them.




When the board is full, the player with more friendly stones wins.

Ambivalence is listed as Ambivalente in 100 Strategic Games for Pen and Paper by Walter Joris.
88330.name: Ambivalence

88338.description:
Kill Ball is a science fiction tabletop sports game for two players created by Gil Nicoll and Adam Watts. It uses tokens or minis on a gridded board to represent a match between two teams of human clones in a gritty arena environment.

Gameplay is an ultra-violent hybrid of handball and hockey. Clones are extremely disposable, and inflicting serious injuries and death upon the opponent’s team is a major part of the game’s strategy. A decapitation will add an additional ball to the arena which can also be used as weapon.

In leagues and tournaments, each player generates a unique team that carries on from game to game. Clones who suffer injuries or death in the arena will have temporary to permanent reductions to their stats, but are easily replaceable between matches. The ones that survive are awarded experience which can be used to improve attributes and purchase additional abilities.

88339.description: Players randomly and secretly pick a character from a pool of 10. Each player/character will host a dinner party consisting on a starter, a main dish, a dessert, drinks and entertainment all of them represented by cards with various choices of food, drink and entertainment. At the end of the game, each player will receive points from the rest depending on the various and particular tastes of their characters.

84247.description:
From the box cover:
2000 BC, many people settled in Mesopotamia, where they founded great cities and nations become. One of these nations rely on you to carry the title of "most powerful nation." Build the grandest temples. Grow your people and fight to accumulate great wealth. Rely on your omens to plan your actions and, above all, increase your power at all costs trying to get their hands on the deity statues that will ensure the favour of the gods.

The game play:
Each player have 4 actions per round, he can either draw a card or play a card.

The player can draw from the display only, the display start with 3 cards, however it increases as the game progress up to 6 cards.

The player can play a card from his hand, even one he just drew. He can play a card on his opponent (stealing cards from them, forcing them to discard), or his can play a card in front of him to increase his chance of winning.

88349.description:
Grid Snakes is a quick-playing game with some real-world dexterity elements for two, four, or six players (with variant rules for three, five, and seven to twelve players). You’re a digital snake, trapped in an arena with several other snakes. As you move, you leave body segments behind you. Your goal is to eliminate your opponents by forcing your opponents to crash into the edge of the board or and section of any other player.

Play is simultaneous (so there's no down time) and proceeds through the following phases: plan, challenge, resolve. During planning, you have a just a handful seconds to pick a direction and a speed for your snake. When all instructions are revealed, any player may spend a token to challenge another player. If you're challenged, you have to flick a token onto a chart; where it lands dictates your speed for the turn. During resolution, you move the snakes, add body segments, and check for collisions.

Grid Snakes uses a large and a small custom board, several small custom decks of cards (eight cards each), some nickels or quarters, and a lot of colored glass beads (or other small tokens). The rules and cards are available at: http://www.invisible-city.com/file_download/165/

Grid Snakes has fairly simple rules, but requires quick decision making and planning. Grid Snakes is appropriate for ages 12 and up. If you eliminate the timer, you could probably play this game with slightly younger children. If you allow multiple attempts on reflex challenges, you could go even younger. A four-player game takes 30 minutes or fewer to play. A six-player game takes 40 minutes or fewer.

88354.description:
The finalists of the RoboRally tournament which transpired at the Origins Game Fair in 1999 each received a copy of the King of the Hill board. While it is virtually impossible to obtain an original, the fan community has produced an accurate print-and-play version available for download.

King of the Hill incorporates various elements from previous expansions published by Wizards of the Coast—most notably being one of only three boards to utilize ramps and ledges—while exclusively featuring the 'steep ramp' element which, unlike normal ramps, requires three movements worth of momentum in order to ascend.

90096.description: Players take turns to place colored L-shaped tiles in order to form lines of a given color and orientation. Once there are no more tiles to place, all players reveal their objectives. Then, each line yields points according to its lenght to the respective player.

91185.description:
A simple Norwegian roll-and-move game. With the help of a die, you fly a space rocket in a race from Earth, around the solar system and back. On about every third of the 100 fields you meet some kind of adventure, like "You run away from giant monsters. Roll once more." or "You land on Mars. Here you take a refreshing bath in one of the channels, rest, and pass one round."

No. 805 from the publisher Saga Kunstforlag.

91460.description:
Number of players: 1–50

Object of the game: The object of the game is to be the player who can stack the most Stonehenge disks in a single stack within 60 seconds, that won't fall over.

Setup: Have a level playing area with enough room to allow people to stack disks into a single pile. The box lid is recommended to be empty, flipped upside down, and set in the middle of the playing area to be used for stacking. The box lid enables disks to fall over and not roll away and get lost.

Set aside all the disks into one large area off to the side, sorting them my color. You will also need to have a space for players to hold as many disks as they bid they can stack, and also the neutral figure.

Clear the stacking area (empty the lid and flip it upside down)

One person acts as timer for the game.

The first player who stacks the amount of disks he bid in a single stack, with the neutral figure on top (before time runs out) that doesn't fall over before time runs out, wins the game.

84266.description:
A PnP game set in the fictional world of the Chrysanthemum Empire. Players control Houses to ultimately control the empire within the time of the Changing Winds, which lasts for 2 years. Any means is possible, be it by showing off your House's wealth, military might or even influence in the courts. Treachery is of course, the bread and butter among the Houses of the Chrysanthemum Empire.

A role selection and worker placement game for 2-6 players, inspired by Citadels and Stone Age, this game thrives to give the most gaming experience possible while expending as few resources as possible in making it.

Multiple six-sided dice are required.

6 pieces of A4 paper are required to build this game, mounting onto chip boards and some kind of thin cardboard for the counters are recommended. 9 playing cards with the size 2.5" x 3.5" and sleeves are also recommended.

89924.description:
Have the whole family buzzing with laughter.

Each player puts on a crazy bee headband. Pick up the corresponding coloured balls with your bee by moving your head. Be the first to collect all 10 balls of your colour to win the game.


Extended game play may cause dizziness.

88369.description:
Object: Become Chairman of the Board, the winner must have a minimum of 51% of the stock of his company and a minimum score of $255,000. The highest score wins.

Players take turns picking up a Situation card, adding or subtracting value to the score sheet and/or move along the gameboard. Some cards allow you to choose between increasing/decreasing your net worth or moving your playing piece forwards/backwards while other cards will have you to both.

The are other squares on the gameboard which involve Conflict/Advantage cards and Corporate Investment cards. Conflict/Advantage cards are played when picked up. These cards are similar to the Situation cards but some are Advantage cards which can cause other people to lose a percent of their income, move backwards and other 'take-that' actions.

Corporate Investment cards are kept face down and typically add to your wealth but amounts vary. They are added in towards the end of the game.

Contents include game board, score sheet, 4 player pawns, 72 situation cards, 35 conflict/advantage cards, 30 corporate cards, and insert with the instructions on them

81913.description:
This game entry is a catch-all for games where some scrap of data exists – a picture in a catalog, or the game box itself – but for which not enough information is known for the game to be added to the BGG database. This entry serves as a repository for images and information for BGG users who want to research these games toward the goal of gathering enough information to include them in the database.

To participate, you can:


Upload images of unidentified games to this page.
Start a thread for a particular unidentified game, including whatever information you might have.
Visit the Unidentified Games Geeklist for an overview of games currently being researched.


Please help if you can!

Also a useful catch all for gamers listing their games played but where they have insufficient information to recall which actual game it was.

84276.description:
(from the Publisher site)
This is an Item that you can add to your Back To The Future Card Game deck.

It says, "If you had this on the table during your previous turn, you may discard it instead of playing a card, to draw 5 cards."

This card was published in 2010 to promote the release of Back To The Future: The Card Game. It is a card that peels off a postcard. The front of the card is shiny, due to the peel-off method, but this will not affect gameplay, since the cardback matches the regular game.

name.#text: Back to the Future: The Card Game – Pizza Hydrator

88377.description:
Mini-expansion included in Pizza Hut's "Helaba!"-magazine no 43. (magazine edited in Belgium for Pizza Hut)
This mini-expansion has 2 new cards for the game "Identik":
The dutch cards are:
- Sliertenbezweerder (stringscharmer)
- Dolle koeien (mad cows)
- Tussendoortje (snack)
- De beste vriend van de hond (a dog's best friend)

families: Small Box Games Pure Card Line
85205.description:
Irondale: The City Complete is the second, and final, expansion for Small Box Games' Irondale.

The City Complete offers 36 new cards, including 11 new buildings, with new building types: Rubble, Gardens, and dual building types.

The highlight of the expansion is a classic rigid Small Box Games' small box with enough room to house the base game and the two expansion, sleeved.

91189.description:
In Ristorante Italia, each player owns an Italian restaurant, a restaurant that he wants to make better than everyone else's in order to have the most points at the end of the game. To do this, a player must set up the menu, draw recipe cards, go to the town markets to collect needed ingredients, improve and enlarge the restaurant, improve the staff's cooking skills (as indicated by the cook-o-meter), and otherwise do whatever is necessary to have the most exemplary restaurant in the city.

Ristorante Italia lasts four phases, with each phase being comprised of three rounds. In each round, players can perform two actions from this list: draw recipe/wine cards, buy ingredients, buy rooms, take a "personal touch" cube, buy a bonus card, or buy a cooking training course. Special events during the game include VIP visits, culinary reviewer visits and the final National Cooking Contest, in which players will compete with their best recipes.

To achieve victory, players can follow an economic strategy – focusing on a menu which provides a strong revenue – or a quality strategy, in which the restaurant features special recipes matched to unique wines. Both strategies can lead to victory, and a balanced strategy can also be a good idea.

Ristorante Italia, scheduled for release in October 2011, can be played in two versions: Recipes for Novice Cooks (lighter version) and Recipes for Great Chefs (complete version).

families: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game (LCG)
87776.description:
The Twilight Beckons is the first Asylum Pack in the Rituals of the Order cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. This cycle introduces new Ancient Ones, Cthonians, Criminals, and Lunatics, as well as cards for the Order of the Silver Twilight. A new story begins as Lucy Jennings, a rich socialite, stumbles upon a secret that will change her life...

The Twilight Beckons is a fixed 60 card Asylum Pack that contains 20 different never-before-seen cards based on the dark mythos of master horror writer H.P. Lovecraft, designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.
87776.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – The Twilight Beckons Asylum Pack

84297.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Refresh yourself with this special COCA-COLA 125th Anniversary Collector's Edition of the MONOPOLY game. COCA-COLA’s most treasured collectibles over the past 125 years are all up for grabs as players buy, sell and trade posters, calendars, serving trays and more. Six collectible tokens including the Bell Glass, Diamond Can, Vintage Cooler, Delivery Truck, Polar Bear and Contour Bottle make this game a treasured keepsake for COCA-COLA fans of all ages.

84298.description:
Publisher Blurb:

It’s Only Rock ‘n Roll - but you’ll like it in this Rolling Stones Collector’s Edition of TRIVIAL PURSUIT. For the first time ever, one of the most legendary rock ‘n roll bands teams up with America’s favorite trivia game so fans can get some satisfaction by showing off all they know about The Rolling Stones. With over 2,000 questions from six categories covering the band’s history, music, accomplishments and more, there’s enough trivia for fans of all levels. So get your friends and neighbors together for a game you’ll want to play ‘til the whip comes down! Game includes custom die and playing pieces featuring the iconic Licks logo.

As in other Trivial Pursuit games, players roll dice to move around the board and answer trivia questions in various categories. Players earn pieces by answering correctly on certain spaces for each category, and the winner is the first to collect one of every piece and return to the middle and answer one final question.

name.#text: Trivial Pursuit: The Rolling Stones Collector's Edition

88395.description:
This tile laying games pits two players against each other, trying to build point-winning diamonds and rubies, whilst blocking your opponent's efforts.

There are bonus tiles that let you make double moves or swap out tiles from the game.

The tiles are rhombus-shaped, with 30 per player, and each player takes their turn adding a tile to the table, one at a time, until the winner is declared.

88397.description:
From the Back of the Box:

Looking for the Real America? Here's a card-capture trivia game with a huge heaping of awesome questions from every corner and generation of the good ole' U.S.A.! Keep to the easier road with Civil Lore! cards, or take to the backroads with really tough Cannon Fodder cards!

Trivia Categories and Descriptions from the Back of the Box:

Secret Natures - Native American Myths, National Parks, Legendary Creatures, Amazing Oddities

Town Halls - Iconic Americana, President Lore, Crazy Laws, Holiday Traditions, Regional Customs

Country Roads - Folk Heroes, Roadside Attractions, Farm Life, Appalachian Ways, Old West Sayings

Modern Airwaves - Radio Days, Behind the Scenes, Classic Television, Business of Hollywood

Urban Scenes - Streetside Games, Urban Legends, Fads & Trends, Great Ballparks, Literary Gems

Futurescapes - Technocultures, Origins of Everyday Things, Sci-Fi Snippets, Future Visions

88399.description:
Space Strips is a print-and-play solo game. It is inspired by the famous Space Invaders game.
Your mission is to get to your destination with your spaceship and to destroy as many invaders as you can. You move your spaceship on an area that is made of paper strips. Each turn, you remove the lowest strip and add a new one above the others : the "boardgame" always changes. Your spaceship moves up one square. If a meteorite or some invaders come accross your way, you have to fight them with 1, 2 or 3 dice. The game ends when you reach the Destination strip or when your Armor points come down to 0. Then you count your points : 50 is a good score.

publishers: Foundation for Social and Economic Initiatives (FISE)
87506.description:
"Busine[eS] - play social economy" is a biding game designed for one of polish NGO's - Foundation for Social and Economic Initiatives (FISE). It this game each player takes role of a leader of local government. His task is to develop structures of social economy in his area - job agencies, social assistance centers, NGO's etc... and take care of people who are looking for a job.

In each round players bid for projects of the institutions of social economy. Then they add it to their personal boards creating a system of social economy in their city. Later they need to help people looking for a job. There are three kinds of meeples representing different groups of people: green one are easiest to manage but they will give you the less points for finding them a job, the yellow ones are average, and the red meeples are people who needs a lot of time to prepare them to work but they are worth most points. At the end of each round if you haven't got enough space in your structures for the people looking for help you have to pay a penalty. In each round all of the meeples move one step closer to the left side of a players boards. When they leave the board it means they found a job and player receives points.

The game was designed as a learning tool for workers of polish jobs offices.

The game was self-published by Foundation for Social and Economic Initiatives (FISE)

91192.description:
This game is designed to be played in any workplace, by colleagues or representatives of different departments, in about a minute per workday. The goal is to reach four designated rooms on an office building map and then be the first to reach the "project completed" field.
On each workday, the players can move from the staircase to any empty room - the first player to show up at work can play first, the next ones in order of their appearance. A room that has been reached is marked on a personal success field. When all players have made a move, a random floor is blocked and anyone on that floor cannot go back to the staircase, thus not reach any new room in the next move (on the next workday).

The first player/team to reach the "project completed" field is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

88402.description:
Crappy Birthday is a humorous game about pranking your friends with gifts they don’t want.

How to Play
Deal 5 Gift Cards to each player.

1) When it is your turn, it is your birthday! Everybody gives you a crappy "gift" from their hand.
2) You shuffle the cards, turn them over one by one, and pick the gift you dislike the most.
3) The player who gave you that gift gets a point.
4) Draw back up to 5 Gift Cards. Play moves to the left.

The first player to 3 points wins.

When to Play
Crappy Birthday is designed to be taken as a gift to a party instead of a bottle of wine or a 6-pack of beer. The goal of Crappy Birthday is to get people talking, laughing, and having a good time as quickly as possible. Don't be surprised if some people dislike the same gift that other people at the table love, because the gifts were designed to start fun and interesting conversations. Crappy Birthday is simple enough that a group of non-gamers can read the rules and start playing within a few minutes. Or if people do not want to play at the party, they can have fun by simply looking at the cards and laughing at the pictures and funny concepts.

So the next time you are going to a party with non-gamers, consider bringing Crappy Birthday as a gift.

88403.description:
Tigele is the first volume of a 4 volume game/game system. Tigele like the other Volumes is a standalone game. Meaning as it comes out of the box, it is a working game. Tigele may be added to other volumes as an expansion. Or the other volumes may be added to it, in part or whole, as expansions. Or this volume may be mixed with parts of the other volumes to form whole new games.

Tigele is a battle strategy game made up of 100 tiles comprised of 72 pictographs forming just several tile types. the game was played by a small community of individuals in the North west corner of Montana for almost 20 years. Slowly evolving into this publish version. (Long cold winters and beer)

Oddities of the game:
1) We call the game a board game, even though it is a tile game; because, the tiles in part make up the playing area, a 10 X 10 layout of tile we call a field. The field is comprised of two opponents laid out in 10 X 5 (1/2 the field we call the courts). That area once established remains a constant grid for play throughout the game. Thus the tiles making a randomized board.

2) The tiles used above are the playing board and the playing pieces.

3) The game uses the relationships of one tiles to another as a mechanic to manipulate luck, and unforeseen or uncontrolled events. This also encourages ever developing tactics and interpersonal strategies (more so when later volumes are played in concert with one another).

4) The box instructions gives two player mode instruction. but the game plays up to 4 players in the Volume One level. The 3 and 4 player modes of play are suggested on our web site.

5) The game was designed for two primary reasons. To help keep the designer brother out of trouble and as a model of one basic form of social political behavior...Don't ask me.

6) Hard rules augmented with a few soft rules. the soft rules force personal interaction and create a fog of war atmosphere...again don't ask me...it just works.

7) Players on your side of play may or may not really be playing on your side.

8) The game uses its art as a fog of war mechanism.

9) The game has a slight learning curve; but the game is basic in play.

88404.description:
ATS Expansion Pack 6- Killing Fields continues the series of expansions for the first ATS series boxed game Advanced Tobruk. Ownership of that game and American Personnel and Vehicle counters are required to play the scenarios included in the set. Killing Fields adds new vehicles and overlays to the system including a 22" long escarpment overlay. The thirteen scenarios included represent WWII actions in North Africa with the Americans, British, Germans, and Italians.

ATS is a tactical level wargame system with each turn representing about 90 seconds of real time and each hex representing 50 yards of terrain. Each weapon and vehicle counter represents one weapon or vehicle. Personnel counters represent squads, crews, forward observers, BAR gunners, and leaders.

88406.description:
Starfleets vs. Planetbusters!

Exodus Series #2

At the end of the Exodus Wars, the first interstellar battle between four post-diaspora star empires, a gigantic alien war machine devastated the frontier worlds. The war-weary militaries of all four empires joined together as one and sent massive fleets of capital ships and escorts to the beleaguered frontier worlds at faster-than-light (FTL) speeds.

Astra Titanus is a solitaire game of space opera battles featuring fleets of highly advanced military starships that are dwarfed by a single alien robotic ship - a STAR TITAN.

The Titan is controlled by cards that determine movement, special weapon use and targeting priorities. The human ships “jump” across space using FTL drives. There are energy beams that shatter small moons and missiles that accelerate to a substantial fraction of c, the speed of light.

As Admiral, you must send your sailors out into the void against the overwhelming might of the Astra Titanus!

Game Data:
Complexity: 4 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 9 on a 9 scale
Scale: Minute turns; one spaceship per counter.

Game Components:
• One 11” x 17” map
• Four 8½” x 5½” status boards
• 20 Titan control cards
• 40 5/8” square, two-sided unit counters
• 28 5/8” round markers
• 20 1/2” square, two-sided missile counters
• One 6-page full-color rules booklet with examples of play
• One 4-page full-color scenario booklet
• Polybag packaging and component storage

Astra Titanus FAQ - please read before posting questions in the forum!
88406.name: Astra Titanus

84311.description:
The Evil Empire has conquered their archenemies, but the fragile Pax Imperia is already breaking: absolute power is corrupting and another war has broken out. Now it's up to you to battle against former allies and end the civil war... before the Empire is destroyed from within!

Both players start with the same 100 item cards beforehand, but can only choose 70 of these to actually battle with. No single card is better than another. It's simply a matter of choosing your strategy: do you want more offense or defense? Will you go for a quick coup d'etat to seize power or try wearing down your oponent slowly instead?

Choose items that will help you end the civil war and restore peace the quickest. The fate of the empire rests on YOU!

88408.description:
The sun has retreated from the earth. It has been a little over a week since the last hint of light shone over the horizon, and the chaos has begun. People fear for their existence, while scientists struggle to explain the phenomenon.

Until they came.

The creatures of nightmare — vampires, werewolves, and ghouls — have begun to appear throughout the world, and they show no sign of hesitation in claiming the dark world as their own!

--

Publisher Blurb

Nightfall - a new fast, furious and fun deck-building game from Alderac Entertainment Group. Featuring direct head-to-head combat, amazing art, a new AEG world, and unique mechanics by designer David Gregg, Nightfall will be the deck-building game to own.

Before the game begins, there is a draft to determine which cards are available for purchase, and by whom. During this draft players select two cards from the set for their personal archives, and they also select cards to put into the common area. The cards drafted into personal archives may only be purchased by the player who drafted them.

After the table has been set with the private and common cards, players begin play.

The meat of Nightfall is in the chaining mechanic, which was partially developed with the help of people right here on BoardGameGeek.

Each card has a main color and two linking colors. If you can match the main color of a card to one of the linking colors of the previous card, you can chain those cards together. Once a chain is started, players all get an opportunity to link additional cards onto the chain during that turn.

Cards in the chain resolve in reverse order: first in, last out. Instant effects fire off as cards come off the chain, doing damage to your opponents or bringing characters into play to defend you and attack your opponents.

The object of Nightfall is to put wounds into your opponents’ decks and end the game with the least amount of wounds in your deck. But beware: the more wounds a person has, the more enraged they become and the faster their deck works, meaning more cards and bigger chains will come your way!

Nightfall's base set releases with starting decks of 12 cards for up to 5 players, and 24 distinct cards (7 copies of each) for drafting during play.

The box contains card dividers, and is in the same format as the much heralded Wrath of the Elements box for Thunderstone.

Integrates with:

Nightfall: Martial Law
Nightfall: Blood Country
Nightfall: The Coldest War
Nightfall: Dark Rages
Nightfall: Eastern Skies
88408.name: Chainmaster

88414.description:
This is the first expansion of San Guo Sha, aka Killers of the Three Kingdoms. As a character expansion, this expansion introduces 8 new character cards but no new playing cards.

In addition, this expansion also includes 2 Demi-God characters randomly inserted into some boosters. Rarity is unknown.

88415.description:
User Summary:

This is the expansion of San Guo Sha, aka Killers of the Three Kingdoms. This expansion includes 52 new playing cards which divides into basic cards, equipment cards and tactic cards. All of these cards can be directly inserted into the basic game with or without any other expansions.
88415.name: San Guo Sha: Battle

88416.description:
User Summary:

This is the second character expansion of San Guo Sha, aka Killers of the Three Kingdoms. As a character expansion, this expansion introduces 8 new character cards but no new playing cards.

In addition, this expansion also includes 2 Demi-God characters like the Wind expansion, randomly inserted into some boosters. Rarity is unknown.
88416.name: San Guo Sha: Fire

88417.description:
This is the third character expansion of San Guo Sha, aka Killers of the Three Kingdoms. As a character expansion, this expansion introduces 8 new character cards but no new playing cards.

In addition, this expansion also includes 2 Demi-God characters like the Wind and Fire expansions, randomly inserted into some boosters. Rarity is unknown.

91195.description:
Kick Bones is a free print and play dice game for two players. All you need to play are two regular six-sided dice, one hundred coins (or pencil and paper), and the following from http://kickbones.com:

Instructions
Doubles Sheet
Two Shields

88421.description:
Second expansion for the game "Arriala, canal de Garonne".
The expansion is FREE, only print 4 tiles and the rules.

The active player can use 2 of his action points to move one of this worker from the vineyards to the city. The player wins as many points as these workers.

89663.description:
This game is for very young audiences, and get to know different feelings by making facial expression.

The rules are quite simple:

- Draw a card: happy, laughing, funny, surprised, sad, hiding, angry
- Make an apropiate expression
- move the the meeple to the new position on the board

for 2-4 players, age above 3
includes - Playing Board, Meeples and playing cards

84331.description: This is a chess-related abstract strategy game with an insect theme, played on a hex board of 61 cells. Pieces are the Queen, Highborn, Drone, Nurse, Worker, and Soldier. Each type of piece has a unique ability and movement. Soldiers are the only pieces that can capture, but they may only move over friendly pieces to do so. Nurses can "birth" new pieces, if there are enough workers available to support those pieces. The queen is the royal piece, and there can only be one per hive, but a highborn can promote to a queen, with the help of a drone, preventing defeat. Drones are also the only pieces with totally free movement, being able to fly to any open cell, but are limited to 2 per game. The game is won when your opponent does not have a queen on the board at the end of the opponent's movement/promotion phase.

88428.description:
This is an expansion to the Axis & Allies Miniatures War at Sea game system, sold as booster packs. Each pack includes five secret miniatures, with at least one rare unit. Set V, previously known as Fleet Command, includes 39 different units. Several new nations are included: Poland, Finland, and Sweden. Neutral Sweden comes with one predreadnought battleship, one cruiser and one destroyer. Sweden is assumed to be able to join either the Axis or the Allies.

Other interesting units include the Japanese carrier Kaga, USN carrier Essex, German cruiser Blucher and Italian battleship Roma, as well as the Japanese hybrid battleship-carrier Ise and the converted British battlecruiser-to-carrier, Glorious.

name.#text: Axis & Allies Naval Miniatures: War at Sea – Fleet Command

families: A Song of Ice and Fire
88429.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Card Game. Of Sands and Snakes features the bastard daughters of Oberyn Martell, the Sand Snakes, mysterious and power-mad Euron Crow's-Eye of House Greyjoy, as well as a wealth of synergy for cards with the Sand Snake trait through cards like Blood of the Viper and His Viper Eyes.

Of Sand and Snakes will augment existing decks and add variety to the A Game of Thrones LCG.

- Features cards emphasizing the Sand Snakes of House Martell
- Contains 60 never-before-seen cards (3 copies each of 20 cards)
- Expands on existing themes and subfactions for all six Houses, plus neutral cards
88429.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Of Snakes and Sand

88431.description:
Andalusia is a 2 player, print-and-play map, designed by Thomas Wegner for Steam. The map depicts Andalusia, an autonomous community of Spain, in the south of the Iberian peninsula. (Read more: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andalusia)

There are nice twists regarding goods delivery. The Andalusia map uses a concept of "My City Tokens" - goods delivered to a city with your "My City Token" on it gain you 1.5 Victory or Income points per link, but only for the first delivery. Furthermore, there are very few blue cubes in the game. These are worth 2.0 Victory or Income points per link when delivered to Gibraltar.

88432.description:
Theme:
In Chinese, Kim-Bac means "the treasure seeker". A breath-taking treasure race in the narrow streets of an old Chinese town: that's the theme of this new game, fast paced, constantly renewed with an uncut suspense.

Kim-Bac is played in to phases: in the first one, "where is the treasure hidden?", all the treasure seekers try to put their hands on the chest that contains the secret of the treasure hideout.
In the second phase: "the treasure race", a single player, the Kim-Bac, knows where the treasure is hidden. All the others ally to capture him and share out the treasure.
Randomness almost never occurs in this second game phase. Alone against everyone, will the Kim-Bac be able to reach the treasure hideout?


Thème :
En chinois, Kim-Bac veut dire "le cherche trésor". Une haletante course au trésor dans les étroites ruelles d'une vieille ville chinoise : c'est le sujet de ce nouveau jeu au rythme rapide et au suspense ininterrompu, constamment renouvelé.

Kim-Bac se joue en deux parties : dans la première : "où le trésor est-il caché ?", tous les chercheurs de trésor essayent de mettre la main sur le coffre qui contient le secret de la cachette du trésor.
Dans la deuxième partie : "la course au trésor", un seul joueur, le Kim-Bac, sait à quel endroit le trésor est caché. Tous les autres s'allient entre eux pour le capturer et se partager le trésor.
Le hasard n'intervient presque pas dans cette deuxième partie du jeu. Seul contre tous, le Kim-Bac pourra-t-il parvenir jusqu'à la cachette du trésor ?

88433.description:
Before their nightly adventures begin, the gangs visit the Inn to equip themselves.
Each gang can choose any two equipment cards to use, but they’ll have to pay for them with the loot that they collect during the game!

name.#text: Cadwallon: City of Thieves – The Inn

88435.description:
This game developed out of a BGG dice design contest game i posted a few months ago (http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/552079/my-many-monster-d...). My solo game rules for the pictured dice (which can be purchased at http://www.flyingbuffalo.com/) is as follows:

Many Dungeon Dice
