Gummy Bear Factory is a fast-paced card game of trading and set collection for 1-5 players, playable from ages 8 and up.

The game uses unique cards composed of heads, middles or legs gummy bears in different colors. On your turn, you take or trade for gummy bear parts and try to lay down complete gummy bears of three matching cards. Players build new gummy bears or onto existing gummy bears. The game is won by the player who created the most gummy bears and scores the most bonus points for having majority control on a row. The game is easy to learn, but it takes strategy and cunning to win.

The game is inspired from European boardgame design. It emphasizes easy to teach rules, no player elimination, no language, and game mechanics that emphasize strategy and paying attention to the gameplay rather than completely luck.

Gummy Bear Factory is the only game that you can use real gummy bears in place of the included scoring winks and increase your fun! You provide your own. Symbols allow easy play for color blind players. There's also a challenging solitaire variant and special two player rules.

84525.description: In the game, up to six bears try to create a store of honey. On the field, around a meadow, are six bear caves. In the middle of the meadow there are the bees. Every player has a choice to move the bears or the bees.The bears move exactly four steps, and if they cross one, they can lift honey pots, which they try as quickly as possible to transport to their caves. When moving the bee you roll a special die (2x honey symbol 3,4,5,6). The honey bee is then moved to a space and on their old space is a honey pot is laid. The bees can also chase the bears, if caught the affected bears lose the honey and start again in the cave. Honey which is already in the cave is safe. The winner is the bear who has a full stock (adjusted according to players) collected first.
84525.name: Une faim d'ours

85945.description:
From the leaflet that comes with the game:

Instead of using the two standard heroes from the base game (the Officer and the Warrior), the Defender can choose to draw two random heroes from among the ten new ones available in this expansion.

The expansion is 10 heroes (5 Double-faced Cards )in a zip lock bag and an A5 size sheet of rules.

88626.description:
From the rules:

Game is based on a TV show here in Estonia called "Unistuste Agnetuur" ("Dream Agency").
In it a story telling game in which each player must make a dream party for the customer.
In each turn one player is a customer and all other players are dream party makers.
Before customer takes a card from a theme deck, each player takes 1 card from 4 card piles (not the theme deck). On each of those card are 1 word. Now, the customer says the theme and each player now must put together a party idea for the customer using those 4 cards in their hand.
After which, customer will decide who had the best idea and went close to what he / she wanted.
Game goes on until everyone has been a customer.

You win the game if you have collected the most theme cards while making the best parties. If two or more players have equal number of cards, then they must count flowers on them. Each flower is a point and a level of difficulty (1-easy, 3 hard).

84531.description: "Hello Mr. Bear" is part of the Haba series "From 2 years," an infants-game series from Haba. The game is several games within a game. The game has no board but rather it is made up of a house that can be built up, it has three walls and an open side, and several wooden figures that can be positioned within the house. The first game supports listening and understanding of words and figures and the fine motor skills. Other games are simple memory games where the children try to remember which figures have been placed in the house.

88629.description:
From the rules:

Game idea is to rise your firms stock times 20 it was at the beginning of the game.
Each player gets one firm at the beginning of the game and starts to develop it step-by-step by moving from the developers track to the wall street track and from there to the win.
During the game you do a lot of selling and buying, going through business schools and paying fines to other companies.
The whole game is a cross-breed from Monopoly and Cashflow.

You win the game when you have raised the stock value 20 times.
88629.name: Ärihai

88630.description:
Played with a standard deck of playing cards.

2-player rules:
One player takes all the red cards; the other black cards.
Jokers or the card box are laid to form the central tile of a 5x5 grid. Players each lay a card orthogonally adjacent to this central tile.

Then players take turns either:
- laying any card in an empty space orthogonally adjacent to an existing friendly card.
- laying any card on top of a friendly card (to increase defence).
- laying a card on top of an enemy card. This can only be done if the enemy card is orthogonally adjacent to a friendly card AND the card being laid is higher in rank than the existing card.

The winner is the one to occupy more spaces.

3 player game:
Players 1 and 2 take a suit each. Player 3 takes 2 suits, giving them stronger card to make up for being wedged in the middle.

4 player game:
Each player uses one suit.

88631.description:
This game is very similar to Memory, but it is an educational game. The pairs consist of a tile with a picture and a tile with the matching word. Whether a picture and a word belong together can be checked by a code at the side of the tiles. As in Memory, the players try collect tile pairs until the playing area is cleared; the player with the highest stack at the end of the game is the winner.

Several editions have been announced by the publisher; as of Essen 2010, only the one about musical instruments seems to be available.

88632.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The card decks contained in the Down In Flames - Guns Blazing game will accommodate up to 6 players. However, if you want to play monster air battles, this is the item for you!

This is functionally an expansion as it ups the number of players in the game from six to twelve.

name.#text: Down in Flames: Guns Blazing – Extra Decks

88633.description:
Raon means fun by traditional Korean. This game can be viewed as a Rummikub like game using Hangul(Korean alphabet) tiles instead of numbers. Two rules, basic and speed, are provided in the manual. The following describes the basic rule.

Each player initially gets 15(13 for 4 players) consonant tiles and 5 vowel tiles and then tries by turn to form a Korean word using his/her tiles. After the mandatory first time registration of 3 or more syllable word, each player's word can contain any number of syllables. Also each player can re-use any tiles from the previous player's word and return not used tiles to the draw pile; therefore there is at most only one formed word all the time. If a player cannot form a word, he/she can exchange any number of tiles with draw tiles and end his/her turn. The first player to use all his/her hand tiles wins the game(or round, using scoring variants).

Components:
56 plastic consonant tiles (square)
24 plastic vowel tiles (long)
4 paper covers
50 cards for speed game
1 manual (Korean and English)
88633.name: Raon

87135.description: The players move their five pieces with numbers on them around the board trying to put at least three of them in line with a total of 5 or a multiple of 5. They then write down the sum as score points and continue playing until one player reaches 200.

84549.description: Luca and his white dog Baldur are to look after the tinted colour-sheep. The little shepherd leads the green sheep to a very green meadow, but what does that yellow sheep need? A book for reading out loud, to look at, to tell stories, a story on colours and tinted sheep, and a game in which to roll the die and thread the sheep onto a woollen string. Luca moves from spot to spot, if all the sheep and the dog are threaded before the sun sinks, all animals can sleep in the barn and the game is won.

81843.description:
Метро 2033, based on the novel Metro 2033 by Russian author Dmitry Glukhovsky, is dedicated to survival in the dungeons of the Moscow metro in a post-apocalyptic world.

The players in the game act as gang leaders who control those or other subway lines. The goal of the player is to make your own clan dominant. To do this requires many soldiers in the army, many resources, and many controlled stations – but the more controlled territory, the greater the threat to the welfare of a clan. And not just from other players, but also from the unknown creatures that now live invisibly in the subway alongside you.

Calculate the right strategy to survive in unfriendly world, and make an appointment with dice that define the amount of resources and the winners in the battles – and become the leader in this dark world...

Reimplemented as


Metro 2033
81843.name: Metro 2033

88649.description: Kō shōgi is a large-board variant of shogi, or Japanese chess. The game dates back to the turn of the 18th century and is based on xiangqi and go as well as shogi. Credit for its invention has been given to Confucian scholar Ogyū Sorai. Unlike standard shogi, pieces may not be dropped back into play after being captured. Promotion rules are complex, and the fates of several pieces are interdependent. The objective is to capture the opponent's commanding pieces: The general, plus the governor if present, or either the banner or middle army if not. Two players, Black and White, play on a go board ruled into a grid of 19 ranks (rows) by 19 files (columns) with a total of 361 intersections. Each player has a set of 90 pieces of 34 different types. The pieces are round and flattened like go stones. In all, the players must remember 65 different moves. The pieces are generally of the same size, though black pieces may be slightly larger than white pieces. Each piece has its name in the form of one or two Japanese characters marked on its face, in white on black stones and in black on white stones. On the reverse side of most pieces are other characters in red; this side is turned up to indicate that the piece has been promoted during play. - Wiki (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ko_shogi)

84558.description: Idéspelet is both a board game and a creativity tool. In the game the players create ideas around a given question and pitch-battle these against each other. The greatest ideas advance in rank and the weaker go back for another iteration and another chance. In the end the player with the highest ranking is proclaimed the winner.

89869.description:
The popular card game gets a modern makeover with bold graphics and a sleek, portable case, making it a great gift idea! It's still the same classic game - but has been enhanced with an exclusive MOD die. For ages 7+.

--

Each player is dealt a stockpile of 30 cards. The winner will be whoever manages to empty their stockpile first. Cards are played onto four shared building piles in numerical sequence from 1 to 12. On each turn, a player draws until they have five cards in their hand, and then plays cards from either their hand, a top card from their discard piles, or their stockpile. At the end of their turn, a player must discard onto one of their four personal discard piles.

Included in this version is the new MOD die. At the start of your turn roll the die. Three sides depict numbers that you can use the dice in place of that numbered card. One side is a Skip-Bo you can use as a wild. One side lets you discard two cards on your turn instead of one and the last side makes your opponent draw one card to add to their stockpile.

91470.description:
Number of players: 2

Object of the game: Connect all of pieces into one orthogonally connected contiguous group of pieces.

Equipment: Game board (each number space of outer ring is divided up into four spaces). 6 red disks. 6 white disks.

White goes first. Randomly pick who will play white.

Each player alternates turns moving one of their pieces until one player wins.

Pieces have two types of moves, a slide or a jump:
A slide move consist of moving a piece vertically (towards the inside of the outer track or towards the outside) or horizontally (to a space of a larger or smaller number) an unlimited number of spaces until it lands on a desired empty space. A piece may slide through multiple empty spaces but NOT an occupied space. A piece also may not land on the same space it started its turn on.

A jump move consists of a piece jumping over a single piece of either player, vertically or horizontally and landing on an empty space. A jump is like a slide, except the jumping piece is sliding through an occupied space. A piece may not jump over more than one piece.
Ending the Game

The first player to get all 6 of his pieces into one orthogonally connected contiguous group of pieces (vertically and/or horizontally adjacent) wins the game.

88664.description:
The game consists of 40 cat puzzle pieces and 40 hat puzzle pieces. Players draw 4 cats and race to find their 4 matching hats. A round ends when one person completes their 4 pairs.

In subsequent rounds, each player draws a new set of 4 cats and play continues until there aren't enough cats left for everyone to have four. The player with the most matches wins.

{user summary}

90184.description:
From the rules:

Old classic game from Soviet Estonia. It is roll and move game with small twists.
Each player is a child trying to get home from school and the goal is to reach home first, but it is not that easy as it sounds.
On the way there are a lot of distractions, like planes flying over head and ice cream being given away for free. All these things take time and you might not reach home first.
Smarter will use trains or bus, some will try and run for it.
Be the first to reach finish and win the game.

84570.description:
From the rules:
Taxibo is a unique Surinamese board game, which takes you by taxi through the centre of Paramaribo. It is a game for 2 to 4 players and consists of 1 dice, 16 pieces in 4 colours and a board.

From the website:
First Surinamese boardgame, developed by Gerrit Baron for the whole family. Taxibo is a taxi game which takes place in Paramaribo. Each of the four players owns a taxi company, who's four cars stand in four different garages. very exciting and above all educational.

Discription: Taxibo is a basic role and move game with some similarities to Sorry. Players move their pawns (taxi's) by rolling dice. The board represents (in an very abstract manner) the streets of Paramaribo. The end goal is getting all four taxi's to the central square. The players who first achieves this wins. Some of the spaces of the board are related to famous sights in Paramaribo and require a player who lands on them to do things such as skip turns, roll again, etc.

84572.description:
From publisher:

The Island of Fear
Can you survive until sunrise?

A plane carrying a group of tourists to the Maldives crashes in the Indian Ocean. On the first night after the crash, the survivors realize that there were werewolves on the plane with them. These fiends organized the whole crash so that they could hunt down some humans in the moonlight. There is only one way to survive until the rescue crew arrives – find out who the werewolves are and lynch them.

The Island of Fear is probably the most advanced version of the world-renowned Mafia game. First of all, in addition to the normal tourists and werewolves, there is a sexual predator, a clairvoyant, a nurse, a witch, an untouchable, a nightwalker, a half-blood werewolf and even a were-hamster. All sorts of nasty surprises can be expected from this colorful group of people. Second, the game contains a set of event cards that create specific events as the game progresses. Third, there are object cards that can both help or hinder the owner. Finally, the game comes with a DVD with mood-setting backgrounds and a timer for day-time voting. Also included are a chart and voting tokens to help manage the game.
84572.name: The Island of Fear

88671.description:
Necromantic acolytes are dueling in a deserted graveyard to become the most powerful Necromancer! This is achieved by collecting arcane tomes of power & the chest of ultimate secrets, or by destroying your enemies minions with devastating spells and hordes of undead monsters.

This game has been taken to several war gaming conventions in the uK where it achieved Best Participation game at Warfare (Reading 2010)

The games consists of 4 players each representing a Necromancer in charge of an undead horde. To begin with eaxh player has 3 ghouls, these are; fast, good at searching but weak in combat. During each turn the players will raise a skeleton and a zombie to supplement their force. So more figures will enter play as the game progresses. The turn order is determined randomly by pulling stones from a bag. There are six stones, one for each player and the other two represent the resurrection of skeleton & zombie. When a players stone is drawn, they are allowed to move all their figures. No diagonal movement is allowed, nor are you allowed to enter a space occupied by other players pieces, and finally there's a stcking limit of 4 figures per area. After moving any figures against to an enemy must fight (this is compulsory), otherwise they may search for artifacts. Specially prepared dice are used for both searching & combat. These dice have the following faces; 2 x swords, 1 x shield, 2 x eye and 1 x swirl. During searching a number of dice are rolled, if any show the 'eye' the item has been found and will need to be carried back to the Necromancer in order to be used or scored. In combat, both players roll their respective dice, lokking for swords or shields. Basically a shield will negate a sword, any any excess swords on either side will kill a minion each. Spells can be played to influence the outcome of a battle ie 'Battle rage' - All swirls count as swords, thereby increasing your chance of killing your opponents figures.

zombies are slow, not good in searching but the best fighters, skeletons are average across the board. The Necromancer himself, is very good at searching, but otherwise similar to a skeleton.Points are awarded for kills and for collecting items. The first player to acquire 25 points wins. Sets of gems are worth more than singles, scrolls give you another spell but are not worth any points, relics are worth 2 points, the chest is 4 (this is placed in the centre of the board) and potions are worth 1 but can be used in combat to roll an extra die. Kills are worth 2 points each, however the Necromancer is immortal so each wound he takes is worth 2.

88672.description:
A cardgame for 2 players which simulates battle of Savo island in 1942-43. Designed by Tomoki Kondoh.
Each player gets ship cards and aircrafts cards and must get VPs from eliminating enemy forces or getting enemy bases.
Moderate complexity and takes about 60 minutes.

88879.description:
Junishi is an abstract strategy game inspired by the 12 animals of the Chinese zodiac. (Each player controls 6 of the 12 animals.)

The object of Junishi is to move one of your 6 animals into your opponents Gate, which is located at the opposite end of the board, in between your opponents Spawn Areas.

Players begin at either end of a board comprised of 19 circles arranged in a hexagonal pattern.
At the start of the game there are not any pieces on the board. Any pieces that a player wishes to use must be "spawned" in one of the Spawn Circles on that players side of the board.
Players may move the pieces that they already have on the board either by moving them into adjacent circles or by jumping over friendly pieces.
Players also may use their animals to capture their opponents animals by jumping over them.

Junishi is a simple and fast paced abstract strategy game that is easy to learn and usually plays in under 20 minutes. It comes in a little cloth bag that also serves as the game board
and it can be carried in any pocket that is big enough to hold a pack of gum.

Junishi is a complete game that can be expanded by combining it with its sister games Zodiakos, 12 Moons, and Neteru.

(source : the publisher)
Integrates with:

12 Moons





Zodiakos



Neteru

88153.description:
From the original rules:
"OLTCIT Rally (Raliul OLCIT) is an attractive competition game created in order to learn the road signs along with their meaning, racing elements and specific terminology."

The game board is made from 65 modular plastic tiles, 43 having numbers on them.

After choosing the favorite color of your car, when your turn comes, you role one die and move on the board with a number of spaces equal with the number depicted on it. After this, you search the space number in the game rules to see what you have to do:pay taxes,receive points, low speed, high speed, going forward, going backwards, or do nothing (if the tile you are sitting on is blank).

In this way you can earn or lose points. The player with the highest score wins.

88691.description:
The Game of Life: Adventures Card Game is a card game following the same classic-remake series as Monopoly Deal Card Game and Sorry! Revenge Card Game, but is different from The Game of Life: Card Game in 2002. This game is simple and quick for families. Cards are divided into four decks by category. You collect points by displaying cards in front of you. Each turn you must play/discard one card and refill hand. Game ends when six out of eight 10-year cards are drawn.

[Box Back]
Your life really is in your hands. Make your Life Story bigger and better than your opponents' with Adventure, Career, Family and Wealth cards.

Always wanted to swim with dolphins? Now's your chance! How about becoming a jet pilot? Do it! Every new experience means more points, and more points means victory!

It's your Life Story - make it a big deal!
88691.name: The Game of Life: Adventures Card Game

84602.description:
Nobody knows who or when, but one player is going to be the killer! Discretion and assassination attempt on one side, and vigileance stalking each other. Suspense guaranteed!

Assassin X is based on a user specific trading card (55 originals cards) through which you build your game and influence your opponents. It is a game of strategy and psychology in which deception and bluff you will need to win!

The goal of the game is the first player to have 5 pts. You gains points if
1) Successful murder = 2 points
2) Countering murder = 1 point
3) Discover an assassin = 1 point

Each player receives 5 cards that they keep secret.
The rest is the deck face down. A sense of play is defined for a turn. It will be inverted at each new turn.
Each round takes place in two stages:
- A phase of trading between 2 players.
- A phase of action for any player

If you receive the card or draw Assassin
you become a murderer. Unless you try to get rid of it, you should prepare your murder by collecting maximum points with maps of Crime Guns, Approaches,and Masters. However, be careful not to be detect because it may well be another player sends you the Police and there, it would be over.
Assassinate when you're ready!

87829.description: Brazilian quiz game inspired by Trivial Pursuit:Family Edition where players must answer questions about world, arts, society, science, sports and variety. There are two decks of questions, one for adults and other for children. Before answer a question, the player must choose how many spaces he wants to move if the answer is correct. The winner is the player that reaches the last space and correctly answers the last question.

83288.description:
From the rules of play:

A simple, fast paced and fun card game

In an imaginary journey through the territories of our souls, deep into the heart of our innery selves we can picture a tree.
The choice of the shape of the tree is not a casual one. Its web of branches, leaves, flowers and fruit is representive of the complexity of human feelings.
Thanks to its symbolic representation of the tree and the display of the 16 feelings through as many works of art, the TA MATETE board game allows players to see their own image reflected in these "figures", thus authentically and deeply entering their own emotional dimension.

The object of the game is to collect the works or art portrayed on the cards of the different feelings. In order to acquire a feeling each player needs to collect three works of art of the same kind connected with that feeling.

CONTENTS:
- A bag containing 48 coloured tiles, 12 for each colour (red, yellow, green, light blue)
- A board portraying the tree of feelings
- Living Gallery: board where to place discards
- 148 cards representing the 16 works of art connected with the 16 feelings
- A paper block to keep score

The TA MATETE board game is an EXCLUSIVE 1000-copy LIMITED EDITION

84609.description:
Rollick! is a hit party game that’s a fast and furious team competition.

With ROLLICK!, the entire team collaborates together to act out clues for one or more players to guess. It’s a hysterical, fun, fast-paced, team competition game that’s an absolute riot at parties, family gatherings, work events, holiday celebrations, with friends, and even loved by teenagers!

With over 750 clues, including words for younger children, suggestions for large and small groups, and other fun variations, no game is ever the same!

For hours of hysterical fun – the choice is ROLLICK!

name.#text: ROLLICK!  The Hysterical Game of Clues and Collaboration

90763.description:
From the publisher:
Kampen om Halmstadis a game about the Swedish city of Halmstad. The mechanics is, roughly, a mix of Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit where most of the questions are about the city and its history. Players move around a track on the board and acquire properties and answer trivia questions about the featured city.

84614.description:
(from Compass Games website:)

Bring added realism to your submarine campaign with IJN, Imperial Japanese Navy, the first expansion pack for Compass Games’ award winning SILENT WAR.

Every Japanese warship down through the large destroyer escorts and the major auxiliary cargo ships and tankers are provided in two full countersheets with 336 new playing pieces for the game and rules to integrate them seamlessly into the game. IJN, Imperial Japanese Navy also brings new rules to SILENT WAR such as loners, crash dive, and targeting escorts, rules introduced in the follow on game, STEEL WOLVES.

A must have expansion pack for any dedicated SILENT WAR player. Requires SILENT WAR to play.
84614.name: IJN

88711.description:
This is a 10 scenario pack for Advanced Squad Leader that covers the Polish Campaign of September and October of 1939.

The scenarios are:

FE 176 Defense of Wysloka - A German Grenadier unit is attempting to bypass a mixed unit of Polish infantry and motorized artillery.

FE 177 First Invasion of Germany - German units are trying to disengage from a Polish armored force advancing toward the German border. This scenario requires board FE1. (Not included in the pack)

FE 178 Crushing Polish Victory - A Polish mixed force must attempt to block a German armored formation from penetrating to the rear.

FE 179 Jakacking Ass - Polish infantry attempting to hold a town against a German armored formation.

FE 180 Andrzejewo Aflame - Polish infantry attempt to avoid a German pincer movement in the middle Polish campaign.

FE 181 Gardens of the Citadel - German and Polish combined forces engage in city combat.

FE 182 Shredkowice - More city combat as a small force of grenadiers encounters a Polish infantry unit bolsters by some tough artillery pieces.

FE 183 Take the Flag - A Polish cavalry unit must evade German infantry in its flight to Warsaw.

FE 184 Hurrah! - Polish cavalry attempt to evict a German infantry force from a Monastery.

FE 185 Assault on Fort IX - Late Polish campaign action as the Germans attempt to breach a flooded anti-tank ditch.

84618.description:
Description from publisher:

Un juego "pipí cucú" para revivir lo más divertido de la época.

En este juego, los setentosos y ochentosos, tienen que contestar preguntas, actuar, dibujar, silbar y mucho más...recordando lo más
divertido de la época.

¿Te animás a actuar representando al "Super agente 86" y dibujar un balero...o al Correcaminos; y a silbar "Menta y Limón"... o "Cleopatra"?


Is a mix between Trivial Pursuit, Pictionary and acting, everything based on the music, tv, movies and culture of the 70s and 80s. Players must act, answer questions, draw, whistle, and sing in various competitions.

84620.description:
User summary:

A religious educational board game that introduces Catholics to the saints and their missions. Intended to help players understand God's calling in their own lives. Includes a book on the 76 featured saints.

Players move their pewter figurines around the board a la Monopoly. When landing on a color-coded square they answer one of four questions read from corresponding cards:

Blue - Light or humorous
Green - Scripture memory
Red - Thoughtful, reflective
Yellow - Lives of the saints

The first person to fully navigate the board by successfully answering questions wins.

The game takes about an hour to play and is geared to ages 10 and up. The goal is to learn more about one's faith, one's mission in life, and about the calling in other players' lives.

90108.description:
Your next door neighbour, old Mrs Jones (the cat lady), just left for vacation, but she forgot to let all her cats out of her house. You and your friends agree to help Mrs Jones, by searching her house, finding her cats the putting them outside, before they cause havoc.

The first player to successfully eject 3 cats from the house is the winner.

On each turn, you explore the modular house, trying to find those pesky cats, but catching them will require a dose strategy and plenty of luck. Although, there are objects to help you; the cats' toys, food and paraphernalia, which will help you catch those cats.

Herding Cats is a hilarious game for 2-4 players that plays in around 30 minutes.

84622.description:
User Summary

Age of Frederick the Great - Wargame Rules for the Seven Years War is a miniatures rules set that includes a card-driven resolution system.

Rules cover sequence of play, movement, terrain effects, fire, melee, morale and rally, the leader action cards (and how to create them), game scale, and unit and army organization.

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #178 (July 2002)

84623.description:
From the box front: Raid Elmer Fudd's vegetable patch and collect the most carrots

User summary: At the start of the game, players get a supply of carrots. On each turn, every player gets a card. When any two vegetable cards match, everyone grabs for a Bugs Bunny piece, with enough for every player but one (i.e. three Bugs pieces for four players). Whoever does not get a Bugs piece must give a carrot to the other players. In addition, there are three Elmer Fudd cards. If one of these turns up, no one should grab for Bugs. If they do touch Bugs, they must give up two carrots to each other player. The same penalty applies for touching Bugs when there are no matching cards.

When one player runs out of carrots, the game is over, and the player with the most carrots wins.

name.#text: What's Up, Doc? The Bugs Bunny Game

84624.description:
From the Introduction

"Last year I promised to present for discussion a set of rules covering the Armada period of naval warfare. Here are those rules, or rather a fast play version of the Channel Wargames Group's current set.

"The philosophy behind them is both to make an attempt to make a set of rules that give a good flavour of the period and the methods of fighting with ships current at that time. And to make the games played with them as enjoyable as is possible. Because of this things such as gunnery have been simplified as much as possible.

"Ships gunnery at the time of the Armada was a thing in a state of flux. It is as well to contemplate, that ships carried many different types of ordinance, all intermingled together on the same deck. The logistics of serving such a varied armament in a rapid manner was beyond the capabilities of the time, and I would hazard a guess beyond us today as well. Most authorities give a maximum rate of fire for the guns of the Spaniards as once, yes once, a day. Small pieces and hand held weapons were obviously much quicker to reload. Even the English rate of fire is said to have been at best once an hour. If this difference had been used in the rules the Spanish player's would be sitting on their for much of the game, and the English for quite long periods. The solution to this problem can be read in the rules themselves..."

User Summary

Rules set covers scale, speed of units, sailing rules, handling classes, wind effects, firing, ranges, firing charts, special effects table (effectively a sort of critical hit table), putting out fires, effects of bowing on hull factors, boarding, morale, special rules for galleys, a ship list, and a brief bibliography. Game requires models (1/600 preferred for ease of scratch building), and two types of dice (d6 & d20).

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #178 (July 2002)

84625.description: A gorgeous game in resin, coming in a huge wooden box. Two players or teams must dig for the Pharao's treasure, finding hints that will help them in the search. The valley of the Sphinx is made of little 3D spaces in resin that can be lifted to see what's under. A guide with the reproduction of real ancient Egyptian documents is featired to translate the hieroglyphics and identify Pharaos' names. The cost was impressive (150.000 liras - equivalent of 77.50 euros that was a really huge sum in mid '90s).

84626.description:
User Summary

Hour of the Gun - Tombstone, Arizona, 1881-2 is a set of three linked miniatures scenarios and a rules set that covers the events surrounding the infamous gunfight at the OK Corral. Scenarios include: Street Fight at the Ok Corral, Tucson Stockyards Ambush, & Shootout at Iron Springs. Characters surviving a scenario (from either the Earp or Clanton faction) are eligible to appear in the next scenario. Off table events (like an assassination attempt on the Earps) between the scenarios help to build suspense.

Effectively this is a set of skirmish scenarios with characters that are drawn from history. Characters that didn't appear at the events in question, but that might have, are included in charts of "Improbables." Historical figures that did participate are found in the "Probable" charts, and have a much higher chance of participating. Percentile dice are used to determine the characters in the various scenarios.

Each character has their own set of characteristics which include: Reaction, Control, Bravery, Dexterity, Agility, Physical, Panic Distance, Security Distance, Pistol Skill, Rifle Skill, Hand Weapon Skill, & Fists Skill.

Game requires various old west miniatures and terrain, along with 2d10 for percentile rolls and single d10 rolls.

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #178 (July 2002)

name.#text: Hour of the Gun: Tombstone, Arizona, 1881-2

88724.description:
Story Time was the Southern California finalist in the 2010 Rio Grande Games Design Contest.

Story Time is a competitive card game with a story writing theme. Each player chooses a character in the story and tries to guide the story so that his or her character fares the best. The pages of the story are represented by cards, with each card having both story text and game rules. The players build the story by taking turns adding pages. Several times during the game the story is read. During the reading, the game rules on each page of the story are followed in turn. Those rules will result in the players gaining or losing points depending on how well their characters fare in the story. At the end of the game there is one final reading, and the player with the most points wins.

88725.description:
This is self-published expansion kit for "Sengoku Gunyuden" series.
"Etsu-To-Ga Sanshushi" means Records of Three province, Ecchu, Noto and Kaga.

This game covering battles of Hokuriku region in Tenshō era (1573-1592AD).
Six scenarios and one campaign game include in this kit.

84630.description:
Russian card game of attacking and getting rid of all cards. Originally a game for two, three or four players, it's mostly known today in an adapted version for two players brought into England by the Mathematics professor A.S. Besikovitch, and later included in David Parlett's Oxford Guide to Card Games. This version is played with exposed cards and symmetrical hands, giving it a strong strategic flavour.

At the beginning of the (Besikovitch) game each player chooses two sets without overlapping with the other player, typically in a 32-card deck, out of which one is their own trump. Cards are dealt for the first player, who keeps the cards of their both sets; the second player gets exactly the same cards in the other sets and both their hands are filled up with the rest of the cards. As an example: a player who's chosen spades and clubs with spades as trumps keeps the cards in both sets and gives all their red cards together with the undealt cards to the other player, who then selects the analog cards to the first player's in the red sets with hearts as trumps, gives the rest of the red cards back to the first player and finally keeps all the remaining black cards. Both hands are symmetrical, and play can start.

From now on each turn a player lays a card in a pile between both players; before the next player can play out a card of their choice they must throw one that is superior in value to the top card in the pile or a trump. If the player can't or doesn't want to do so they must take the whole pile and forfeit the turn. So, each player throws two cards in a row: one following the previous card, and one to be followed by the opponent. The first player to get rid of all cards in their hand is the winner.
84630.name: Challenge

88881.description:
In this Yahtzee-like dice game, players get to throw the five dice up to three times on their turn while attempting to make high-scoring sets, whether of animals, flags, or something else; many versions of this game have been released, and the symbols matter only for what you check off, not for a point value since each symbol is worth 1. Choose carefully which lines to score as each line can be scored only once! If all the possible choices for a roll have been filled, then you must score zero points on another line of your choice.

If you score 18 or more points on the upper half of the score sheet, then you receive 10 bonus points. (Note that unlike Yahtzee, each symbol is worth only one point; note also that in the lower section, each line has a specific scoring combination, e.g. three elephants score only with two bears, not with a two of something else. Roll five identical items, and you get a 10-point bonus. Whoever has the highest score when all the score sheets are filled wins!
88881.name: Danmark Yatzy

84642.description:
From the box: "A Game With No Redeeming Qualities"

A roll and move drinking game where you move your piece around a game board arranged like a person's home. The object of the game is to be the first player to get from the front door to the bathroom.

84654.description:
This is a TV tie-in with the popular eponymous German TV series.

Players move around the board trying to collect 1 chip from each of the 6 houses on the street. To collect a chip, a player has to answer a question concerning the show correctly. After collecting all 6 chips, the player needs to answer a master question correctly to win.

There are several inbuilt variants for more or less competitive/cut-throat play.

88753.description:
Terra Shrinka is a cooperative dam-building survival game for 1-4 players. Terra Shrinka has a unique lunar tide system that controls the water and will erode the island if you don't work together to scout out the island, gather resources, and build dams fast enough.

THE STORY SO FAR

On a South Pacific flight your plane is struck by lighting and makes an emergency landing on a small desert island. The good news is that everyone survived the landing, the bad news is that the tides are rising and the island is flooding. It's up to the brave passengers to step forward and bring order to the chaos. You survived the crash, now can you survive the flood? The very earth is shrinking around you! Can you dam the flood?

THE OBJECTIVE

Dam the flood by creating an unbroken chain of dams from one board edge to the other and protect the crash-site in the process!

HOW THE GAME PLAYS

The game starts with the board taking its turn. The board’s turn is broken into five phases:

1. Move Moon Tracker
2. Add Flood Cube(s)
3. Roll Moon Die that matches current Moon Phase
4. Draw card if “N” or “S” is rolled.
5. Move Flood water and resolve damage

After the water does a good job of destroying board squares, it is the players’ turn. Each player starts with their Team Leader in the Crash Site. During the players’ turn, they do the following:

1. Explore and Move
2. Create
3. Transfer
4. Set Dams

Each player has a starting character. Are you the ren-faire blacksmith, or are you the bag lady? No matter whom, it is each team’s job to explore this uncharted little island. The survivors find food to bribe more recruits off the plane. They make networks of people to transfer gathered goods. And finally, they create and set dams to stop the water. This requires lots of communication and teamwork to protect your Crash Site and stop the water from spreading any more. If your Crash Site is destroyed, you lose. Otherwise, keep track of how many squares were destroyed when you finally blocked off the flood and try to do better next time. There are additional scenarios to add replay value and ensure that you want to come back for more.

88755.description:
Try to be the first player to collect the characters in this hit CW TV show. Getting the crow card will let you take a card from another player and having the herbal Vervain card protects your character cards. Other twists and surprises add to the fun.

-Publisher

Starting with a hand of 3 cards, Draw a card from the deck. Then play a card. You can meld a character card or use one of the other cards that have special effects. If you cannot play a card, discard one from your hand.

The first player to have collected all six character cards and the special two-sided Elena/Kathrine card winns.

84662.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Module Y3 comprises a 100-page SSD book, including:
Early battleships for the Federation, Kzintis, and Gorns.

Warp-refitted command cruisers for the rest of the Federation member states before the unified star fleet was formed.

Warp-driven dreadnoughts for the five member species of the Inter-Stellar Concordium before they coalesced into one nation.

The 64-page rulebook includes five scenarios as well as the ship descriptions and annexes.

name.#text: Star Fleet Battles: Module Y3 – Early Years III

families: Legend of the Galactic Heroes fleet battles
84663.description:
This is a Japanese science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes.

Two scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets.
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 10 to 20 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat.
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated many times during one turn.
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The outcome is decided by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.

name.#text: Lost Complete Victory: Legend of the Galactic Heroes

families: Legend of the Galactic Heroes fleet battles
84664.description:
This is a Japanese science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes.

Seven scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets.
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 10 to 20 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat.
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated many times during one turn.
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The outcome is decided by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.

name.#text: Vermilion: Legend of the Galactic Heroes

84671.description:
The "game board" is set up in the box - four poles are put in the corners which have plateaus on them. Each player gets a catapult (seesaw-style), four actual fluffy pillows and three cardboard figurines of their color.

The active player puts a pillow on his/her catapult and tries to lob it into the box. If successful, he/she may put one figurines on one of the plateaus. If one of these is shot down, he/she takes it back and also takes one pillow out of the box. The first player to get all four pillows into the box is the winner.
84671.name: Bataille d'Oreillers

84672.description:
This is self-published expansion kit for Dokuganryu Masamune. Also needs rulebook and reference card from Hideyoshi Gunki or later.
"Mutsu Nikki" means "Record of Mutus province".

Covering battles of Mutsu and Dewa province.
Six scenarios are included in this kit.
"Battle of Eiroku 1", "Battle of Eiroku 2", "punitive expedition　to Ooura" and "Battle of Minato" are short games for two players.
"Three champions of Dewa" is short game for three players.
"Mutsu Nikki"　is campaign game for three or four players.

90571.description:
"With skill and expertise, you and the other X-Men must dodge the pitfalls of the Danger Room. Only then will meet your goals." (Translated from the rule book).

Every player chooses his character (Wolverine, Beast, Cyclops, Storm, Gambit or Rogue) and place it in the Danger Room (any Start Point valid on the board) with one objective (collect X-Tokens, the amount of each color is in the Objective Card) and four Trap Cards. Then the game starts.

Every turn the player spins the Moviment Wheel (to define how much he moves) and next the Trap Wheel (that activates a trap). The Trap Cards can be used any moment of the game and disarm or arm one trap.

Win the X-men who complete his objectives first.

This game is from Brazil and may not be available elsewhere.

84677.description:
This is expansion kit for Shingen Joraku. also needs Kanto Seiatsu, Nobunaga Fuun-roku, Hideyoshi Gunki, The Longest Day in Sengoku.

Covering battles of Oda-Tkugawa ally versus Takeda clan.
Two scenarios are included in this kit.
"Shingen's Last Battle 2nd Edition" is expansion version of "Shingen Joraku. Large campaign scenario for two players. One player control Takeda clan, Hojo clan and western coalition. Another player control Oda clan, Tokugawa clan and Uesugi clan.
"Battle of Nagashino - Nobunaga's Victory" is short game for two players.

88776.description:
From the back of the box:

COWntless hours of entertainment with family and friends. Forget cows or balancing the books, this fast-paced card game has everything to do with rolling the dice to be the first to get rid of all your cards.


Roll the dice!
Do the math!
Lay down the cards that qualify!
First players to lay down all the cards in their hand, wins the game.
Watch out for the Cow eyes!


Includes: Two decks of 48 cow cards - numbered 1-12 in four colours, dice and instructions.


* *


Summary:

In this light children's card game, players begin with a hand of cards, each of which is numbered (1-10). On their respective turns, each player rolls a pair of six-sided dice and tries to discard a card from his/her hand based on the result rolled. The numbers on the dice are combined using simple mathematical operations to determine whether a card can be discarded. For example, if a player rolls a 3 and a 2, they could discard a 1 (3-2), a 5 (3+2), or a 6 (3x2). A player who cannot discard must draw an additional card. The first player to empty their hand wins.

name.#text: The Little Big Game of aCowntin

84688.description:
Small expansion for the base game:

It comes with 4 new cars:
Ramone
Luigi
Guido
The King

Allows now the game to played up to 10 players.

And adds a new route as well called: "Even Longer". (Just adds 2 more tiles, with Luigi and The King special places.)

name.#text: Cars: Radiator Springs Rallye Small Expansion

88526.description:
It's laundry day and the animals need help getting dressed! Reach inside the dryer to find their
missing clothes and exlpore using only your sense of touch. Think you've found what you're looking
for? Pull it out and see if it's a match! But watch out for the Skunk's Undies or you'll lose a card.
Fun 3-D game play encourages tactile exploration and fine motor skills.

Ages 4 and up.

Honors:
Parent's Magazine Top Toys of 2010 (November 2010 issue, page 164)
Good Housekeeping Magazine Top 6 Games of 2010 (Holiday Issue December 2010)

Designed by Mary Jo Reutter, winner of the 2010 Excellence in Game Design award at the Toy and Game Industry (TAGIE) Awards.

- from the publisher

88793.description:
Manufacturer's Description:
Which do you have? Do you have the skill? Do you have the will? Roll balls to score 1, 2, or 3 points but watch out! Roll too hard and you'll give a free shot to your opponent - too soft and you might score on yourself! With fun, fast-paced gameplay, Brass Ball & Nerves of Steel is an addictive diversion that everyone will want to play again and again.

This game combines bowling and tic-tac-toe. One side has 3 brass balls, the other 3 steel balls, and you try to roll your balls into the holes on your opponent's side. There is a nice combination of risk assessment and dexterity: the farther up the opponent's side you get your ball to go, the more points -- the rows of holes score 1, 2 or 3 points. If you miss and it rolls back into a hole on your side, it counts for your opponent's score. And if you roll off the far side, your opponent keeps the ball to roll and score on his own.

85337.description:
User summary:

A modern warfare wargame, intended to be used with 1/285 miniatures and terrain tiles, developed and adopted as a training tool by US Army from 1977 to 1997.

The scale is one inch to 50 meters. A curtain is suspended half way down the playing area to simulate fog of war, and can be moved forward or backward depending on the knowledge of the terrain of the opponents. The game is normally played with three of four players per side and an impartial controller. Opponent teams take alternate turns, going through a sequence involving, in that order, artillery fire requests, previously requested artillery fire resolution, direct fire, movement. Combat is resolved by dice rolls on probability tables. The game uses two six-sided dice of different colors, to generate numbers from 11 to 66.

88800.description:
Contains two games in one box. From the publisher:
Giftrace: You are Santa Claus and you need to follow the path from the beginning to the end. On your way you leave one gift (a ring in your colour) on each house when you land on a house square or pass it. Score points are given accourding to who is first, second, third and forth to arrive to the end zone. The first person gets 4 points, second gets 3 pts, the third gets 2 pts and the last one gets one point. But, for each gift that you still have remaining (rings on your pawn) you get one minus point for each ring! The person with the most points wins!

Sledrace: Each player chooses a pawn and puts it on the sled in the same colour. The rings are not used in this game. The person that looks most like a racing driver starts! You throw the die and move accordingly. When you land on a square with a picture, you immediately follow the instructions on that square, then your turn ends. Please note that if you pass an X you stop right away because you just hit a tree and the rest of your moves in that turn are cancelled! The player on your left goes next. The first person to reach the finish line wins and gets the trophy!

88802.description:
3-4 players build their homes from scratch in 14 rounds in HSH. Each player starts with his own mat that represents his home, and hires technicians to develop and decorate it with furniture, appliances, antiques, and shield it against the evil eye of his neighbors -who really can cause major damage!
Every turn consists of 6 phases. In the last phase of every turn, players organize a party to gloat about their new acquisitions.

88803.description:
A magazine dedicated to Advanced Squad Leader. This issue has articles on how to prepare a good setup and perspectives on three scenarios. Also included are four scenarios:

DB082 Roadside Assistance - This scenario set in late war Greece has a German halftrack with mechanical problems waiting for assistance when local partisans attempt to knock it out.

DB083 Block to Bataan - This scenario is set in the Philippines in the early war, features an armored engagement between the Philippine Army supported by US Armor and the Japanese.

DB084 Pot of Stew - The action here is set in Russia during the Kursk offensive of 1943.

DB085 The 138 of the 138th - The Germans are making one last push to take the factory district in Stalingrad. This scenario uses the Red Barricades board.

88804.description:
This educational game shows the consequences of lobbying for fair trade relations with third world producers. It is used in schools of the German state of Rheinland-Pfalz, with the goal of inspiring students to put pressure on their communities to buy fair trade goods.
Up to five players represent importers of third world goods (bananas, stones, coffee, tea and cotton clothes), trying to be the one with the greatest profit who doesn't get caught either overcharging the buyers or inhumanly exploiting the producers. The board has five tracks, one for each product (for the sake of the game, they all have the same price). On the track, there are three markers: The lowest is the price that the producers get; the middle one represents the overall cost including shipping costs, the third one the price that a municipality buys the goods for (the distance between the latter two is the profit margin). The mechanism is a simple "play one card, draw one card". The cards have events printed on them, with each event either influencing the own track (with some choices to make) or that of another player. There are also hidden cards which can be played face-down to another player's track. These are revealed at the end of the game and influence the the maximum prize a municipality will pay and the maximum abuse of producers it will tolerate. A player who exceeds either of these levels is out of the game; the remaining player with the highest profit margin is the winner.
The game has some push your luck element (you can make a rough guess about the tolerable levels from the number of cards played against you) and is embedded in a curricular project in the schools of the state.
It is not for sale nor does it come in a box. 12 copies were hand-made by Reinhold Wittig, of which 10 copies will be used in schools beginning in 2011.

88805.description:
Hi Fans! How would you like to tour with Take That?

Play the Take That game and be part of our exciting, hectic lives. We all need personal assistants to take care of us 24 hours a day

You'll get closer to us than anyone and you'll have to be prepared for anything! From appearing in our videos, to organising our parties and even sharing our secrets.

So everyone take your pick and take us around the world! Who will it be? Gary, Howard, Jason, Mark or Robbie. Choose your favourite and Take Them around the world!

Source: box

88808.description:
From the prototype rulebook:

"You have been hired as curator of a brand new zoo in Europe. Your job is to build a world-class collection of animals for the awaiting public. However, your opponents have been hired in similar positions at competing zoos. Be strategic in the use of your resources, and assemble your collection wisely. If you succeed, you will be known the world over as Menagerie Mogul!

Over the course of five rounds, players will draft resource cards from an ever-changing selection. They will then use these resources to compete against one another in hopes of acquiring the most prestigious animals in the world for their zoos. At the end of the five rounds, whoever has achieved the goal of curating the most profitable zoo, wins."

91475.description:
Fidchess is an attempt to create a chess-like game for Stonehenge, using just the original parts in the Stonehenge game. Its name comes from the Celtic game Fidchell, which has been called “Celtic Chess”. Fidchess has little to do with Fidchell, except that they are both abstract strategy games. The name of the piece are derived from Celtic numbers, except for "Rigant", which means "Lord" in proto-Celtic.

Number of players: 2

Object of the game: To either capture an opponent's druid or all 10 of the opponent's disks that are used to make up pieces in the game.
Getting Started

Equipment: Stonehenge board (outer track). Outer track is four spaces wide (combining day and night spaces as one space) and 30 spaces round, using spaces 1-8 only.
10 green disks and 10 yellow disks
1 green and 1 yellow figure (Rigants)

Ending the Game

Once a player has either captured their opponent's druid or eliminated their opponent's Oins, Duos, Peths, or Teths (and Quens in Quen variant) from the board, they win the game.

84716.description:
Expansion to Activity with 220 new cards. Themes: leisure and food

The gameboard and pawns are needed from one of the basic Activity games.
Most of the new cards have book-, film- or play titels (theatre, opera, music), fairy tales or poems to be guessed by the teams
Also tasks about art and architecture, everything around food and kitchen and last but not least - games are includet in this theme pack.
It's a real challenge, to "dance" or picture the title of a poem, you might have learned in school - but will your teammates remember it too?

The minimum age is specified with 12, but 30 to 40 is best "experience-level"

83428.description:
The board depicts a ship with seven hatches. Around it, there is a course of fields, some of which have special symbols. The hatches are covered with tiles. These hide characters from the Disney movie.
The players roll dice and move around the course. The goal is to collect a set of three cards depicting Ariel's friends, then go onto the ship and flip over hatch tiles. When a hatch tile shows one of the friends, another hatch tile can be flipped over. When the witch appears, the player has to start collecting cards again. When the prince appears, the game ends and the active player is the winner.
While circling the ship, special symbol fields enable the players to draw cards, move forward etc. When a player reaches a field where (an)other player(s) is/are, he/she can steal a card from each of them.

84722.description:
A computation game for 2-4 players from 8-14 years

Contents: 4 men, 4 boards - each showing a pair of scales with adjustable weight figures, 60 tiles showing weight units from 1-60, track with 22 spaces.

1. Zero! Each player adjusts his scale so that it shows zero.
2. Two! Each player draws two weight-tiles and puts one on each side of his scale. It is up to hom which tile goes on the left and which tile goes on the right.
3. Quanto! Players draw a third tile an can place it either on the right or left side of their scales.
4. Got it! The first player who succeeds in balancing his scale by adjusting the dials scores most points

84723.description:
Football simulation for 2 to 6 players. The game consists of defense cards, midfield cards, attack cards and action cards. Each move is started by playing a midfield card. The cards have a color code that determines which kinds of cards can be played next (i.e. an attack card (red) can only be played if the previous card contains a red color code). Attack cards also show a number of balls that has to be surpassed by the next player. A player who cannot counter an attack card catches a goal and has to take all the cards from the current stack; the last player to play an attack card before that takes a scoring card. When the card stack is used up, the player with most scoring cards is the winner.
Action cards can be used to reverse player order, pass an attack to the next player, etc.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
84723.name: Die Bar-Bolz-Bande: Das Kartenspiel

84724.description:
A dice rolling game with a colour dice, little plastic goats in 4 colours and 4 trains for transportation.

Goal is, to transport the goats through the swabian country following an old popular folksong "Auf der schwäbschen Eisenbahn"

84727.description: In this game - following the children's book of Ottfried Preußler with the same name, each player will play the little sorceress once. The little sorceress tries to break the evil witches operations. So she attempts to burn the grimoires and witches' brooms. That child, whichs acts best, will win.

name.#text: Die kleine Hexe: nach dem Buch von Ottfried Preußler

84728.description:
The XVII. the king scented the plans of the noblemen conspiring against it in England on a century's waist, that down it wants to be repelled from the throne. He deprived all those, who were getting involved in a suspicion, of their title, their property and their name because of this. As a last opportunity, offered it to the ones driven into the exile in order for them to prove their innocence, that who gets into the utmost nook of his realm as the first, it proves it with his desperation, worthy that way, that gets back his goods taken away. Your rivals will make your road harder, save up at what more thalers, that give yourself to benefits and be able to hold back your adversaries.

Be the most resolute one and reach the aim, the long one and tiring one firstly on a road, defying the obstacles, that regain all that, from which falsely bereft!

Peregrinus is a game that is still under development and just before publishing. Consequently, the rules are not complete yet but are still changing. In the game you have to come up with different colour combinations with four cards, and you can proceed in the game with these combinations. You can collect money, points, action cards and treasures. All this will be converted into victory points at the end of the game. You can create obstacles for your opponents, and you can turn the action cards into your advantage but can also annoy your opponents with these cards.

The aim of the game is to collect the most VPs

88825.description:
A guessing game of Bible people, places, and things!

You get 20 clues to figure out the biblical person, place, or thing. Ready. Go!

Learn the Bible in a fun, new way with Choose Your Clues. Almost 2,000 clues lead you to discover many Bible facts you never knew existed.

Use as few hints as possible and you're the winner!

Three ways to play. Great for family times and travel, too!

(description source: back of the box)

88826.description:
GridBowl is a simulation of American Football.
In this game you find : touchdown, field goal, punt, play of scrimmage, etc...

This game is played on a large gameboard (110 cm by 50 cm for big version, or 80cm by 45 cm for smaller version). You can play with 11 "football miniatures" (from Miggle Toy, or kaskey kids for example), or with 11 tokens representing players.

Gridbowl is a game of PROGRAMMATION : each turn, you use a PlayBook card. This PlayBook card gives the type of movement for each specific player.

Your opponent does the same with his own PlayBook card.

Once the Playbook cards are chosen, players from each team act alternatively.
So there is a lot of suspense in GriddBowl.

In this game you must anticipate opponent's moves.

88827.description:
From the publisher

Ready the Cannon, Fix Bayonets, and Prepare to Charge!

Civil War is now upon us, and you must take the field as the leader of the Union or the Confederate forces. Command your generals and direct your infantry, cavalry, and artillery in 30 different scenarios that feature the terrain and troop deployment of each historical battle—from the First Bull Run and Wilson’s Creek to Prairie Grove and Gettysburg.

History may have been written, but in Battle Cry, the outcome of each battle is up to you. With your strategy and tactics, you can turn the tide to carry Old Glory or Dixie to victory.

Includes 30 Battle Scenarios!

This is an expanded and updated version of Battle Cry.

name.#text: Battle Cry: 150th Civil War Anniversary Edition

88828.description:
(from the game) THE OIL IS RUNNING OUT! The days of easy drilling are long gone and oil companies are searching in ever deeper, riskier and more fragile places just to secure our daily fixx of capitalist cog-grease. The battle is on to protect these areas from the next 'Deepwater Horizon' and with a couple of dice, a few coins and a friend, you can re-enact this struggle. It's Greenpeace vs. the Oil Company, trying to establish marine reserves in the very territory the other player wants to exploit. Through a mix of strategic lobbying, exploration, occupation and reserve creation, one of you will triumph. But beware: too many blowouts and you'll have a deepwater slaughter on your hands. And if all the animals die, you both lose!


You only need some coins and 2 dice to play. Everything else is included in the files. Game play takes place on a grided map of the ocean, containing squares of varying depths of water. One player takes on the role of environmental activists, Greenpeace, while the other, the role of a Big Nasty Oil company. Greenpeace is trying to establish marine reserves in the very places that Big Oil is trying to drill. You see, oil (in the form of coins) is available everywhere, but severely limited in shallow and medium depths. So once the easy oil runs out, the oil company is pushed into deep water. Drilling involves rolling two dice, one after the other. If the second number is larger than the first, this drill results in profit (coins equal to the difference in the two numbers) but if you roll a double, it's a blow out. Blow outs are more damaging in deeper water and any blow out might affect surrounding wildlife (animal counters are distributed randomly for each game). If any one species gets totally wiped out, both players lose.

Each player has 3 strategies to choose from each turn and there is enough variation to ensure that no single outcome is guaranteed (although a lot of animals consistently die).

88829.description:
Designed for the 2010 Christmas Print and Play Game Design Contest, Jingle Jangle is a domino-like placement game which scores points for arranging tiles into the appropriate patterns.

Jingle Jangle uses a special set of 30 tiles with two bells on them called jangles. The game can be played by two, three or four players and the size of the hand varies with the number of players.
• Two players get 14 jangles each, with two jangles left over.
• Three players get 9 jangles each, with three jangles left over.
• Four players get 7 jangles each, with two jangles left over.
In the case of three left over jangles, one is put away out of the game and not exposed, to leave two jangles in the starter. The starter is the pair of left over jangles. These are turned face up and put side by side to make a square in the middle of the table.

Jangles are placed on the table, vertically or horizontally, played out from the starter square. The idea is to build a “crossword puzzle” grid of repeated color patterns in the rows and columns.

Any set of two or more adjacent jangles ending in a row or column is called a group. The jangles must be played so that the bells in each group form a (repeating) pattern. The possible patterns are:

• a single color repeated, example: red, red, red or
• two colors alternating, example: red, blue, red, blue, red, blue or
• three colors in a repeating cycle, example: red, blue, yellow, red, blue, yellow, red, blue, yellow or
• four colors in a repeating cycle, example: red, blue, yellow, green, red, blue, yellow, green or
• or all five colors in a repeating cycle, example: red, blue, yellow, green, purple, red, blue, yellow, green, purple
As soon as a group has a repeated color in it, or contains all five colors, the pattern for that group is fixed, and future jangles that extend the group must conform to the established pattern. As the layout grows, it is possible for a row or column to contain two or more groups, separated by spaces.

Each jangle must be placed so that it correctly extends two or more groups, but you are not allowed to create a set of four jangles side by side in the layout, touching along their long sides.

If a player thinks he cannot play, he exposes his hand. The other players can then (if they wish) point out any plays he might not have seen. In this case the player must play a tile. If more than one possible play is pointed out, the player has the option of picking the one he likes. If no play is pointed out, then the player scores zero and places no jangle. He is not out of the game, but has to wait for his next turn to see if he can then find a play.

The game ends one of two ways: 1) When one player places all his jangles. The other players who started after him get to place one more jangle, however. 2) When no player can place a jangle.

Scores are counted and added as the jangles are placed. Each bell on a jangle is worth 5 points, The score is the product of the new lengths of all extended groups. If the jangle used to extend the group is a double, then the score is also doubled.

All players lose points for the jangles remaining in their hands when the game is ended. Doubles are -5 points and all other jangles are -25 points.
88829.name: Domino Bead Game

88533.description:
This is a color matching game for younger children, where players have fun in the forest with moose!

Players take turns dealing cards featuring Buck the Forest Ranger and his pokey pal Moose. Get a "Buck" card and do nothing -- get a colored "Moose" card and race the other players to slap the stack of cards with the matching color. Get there first and you win the card! The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins! Fast-action, color-matching forest fun!

85699.description:
See molecules take shape before your eyes!

Each player builds the model of the molecule represented on the molecule card which he has drawn. The playing pieces are moved around the board from the starting square by die roll, in the direction of the player's choice. In each case, the action on the space is taken, allowing players to obtain atoms or bonds, discard components, or draw individual or collective event cards.

Has anybody made one of the target molecules? The first player to finish has the right to compare his molecule with the ones listed on the objective card. If none of the target molecules has been constructed, he is in a position to create mischief for the other players.

(Paraphrased from the back of the box.)

89923.description:
Fast-paced stacking game building coloured rainbows out of discs to match cards

The cards are shuffled and placed face-down in a pile in the centre of the table, and the coloured discs are spread out evenly around the table. Each player starts with a game base on which to build his rainbow (tower). The top card is turned over and all players have to build a rainbow following the sequence of colours and symbols on the cards. The first player to build their rainbow puts the pot of gold on top to win the round. The player who wins the most rounds is the winner.

84743.description:
Follow the life of Christ from Bethlehem to Calvary. Players move along a path that follows the events of the life of Christ and answer questions on cards that are drawn. First player to the end wins.

User Summary

name.#text: Life of Christ: Bible Journeys No. 2

88841.description:
The Smurfs are busy having a wonderful time. Can you match up all your cards to their happy activities?

Source: box

This is a simple game (recommended for ages 4-8) of matching colours and symbols. Each player has a hand of five cards which they must match to the corresponding spaces on the game board.

Players spin a spinner to determine what colour card they can play and then attempt to match the symbol on their card to a space on the board. If they have no card of the appropriate colour they must draw from the deck.

The winner is the first to play all their cards.

name.#text: The Smurf Game Happy-time Picture Matching

84746.description:
Small card-driven game covering a famous battle during Sengoku-era.
In 1575, Katsuyori Takeda invaded into Mikawa controlled by Ieyasu Tokugawa. Nobunaga Oda decided to reinforce Tokugawa and had his one of the most important battle against Takeda's traditional horsemen by having his most innovative gunpowers.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Nagashino

1 map
80 counters
4 pages rulebook
30 cards
2 dice

Takeda must conquer the Nagashino castle before the game end. Tokugawa must stop the Takeda's goal.
84746.name: Nagashino Shitaragahara

88843.description:
A piece of cheese is put into the mouth of a battery-driven mouse. The mouse is then set loose on the floor and dashes through the room. The players represent cats and have to catch the mouse's tail with a small plastic sling. The first player to succeed in that gets the cheese. After nine rounds, the player with most points is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
88843.name: Caccia al Topo!

84748.description:
Guided Lands - Tabletop battles for all fantasy miniatures

Guided Lands is a new tabletop game for two players, ages 14 and up. The game has an universal approach to tabletop gaming, where almost all fantasy miniatures with a scale around 28mm can be fielded in battle. Players take on the role of two mighty warlords, who muster their troops to claim the throne and be crowned king of the Guided Lands. Doing so players will use a unique step-by-step approach to create different races and equip their soldiers with weapons, armor and special abilities, thus making nearly all of your fantasy miniatures you have lying around somewhere ready to be used as heroes or units in Guided Lands. The scale ranges from small skirmishes to epic battles including monsters, magic and powerful artillery. An easy and streamlined ruleset as well as a card-driven initiative system keeps gameplay fast, while also engaging for seasoned tabletop generals. So dust of your old miniatures and start playing!

Guided Lands is the first game of the new publisher Smiling Monster Games and will be released in a limited first edition of 500 copies at Essen Spiel 2010 in German language (Hall 6, booth 6-808), estimated price € 20 (softcover book).

More information at www.smiling-monster.de

88845.description: Simple roll-and-move with three pawns each. You have to go through a maze and need cards to pass some spots. There are also spots to draw new cards. Two pawns on the same spot block the space. First player having all three pawns in the goal wins (goal has not to be reached exactely)

84750.description:
This is the oldest book in Japan for history related in Japan.
It is 30 volumes and is the fantasy story. The player are the editors for Nihon syoki.
They collect the category cards, and make the book, put the tile on the board corresponded the space. The spaces are connected by lines to some space.
These are the story's web.
The game is 6 rounds. The player has the 1 action on 3 each areas per 1 round. Get the category card, bonus card, make the book, change the order and so on.

45 Category card
3 Library card
12 Offering card
24 Point card
18 Bonus card
40 Player tile(10 per player)
1 Round Maker
4 Board(They can make any patterns)
1 Round / Action Board
1 Rule
84750.name: Nihonsyoki

89901.description:
Try to find Arsène Lupin and try to stop him before he finds the blue diamond.

Each player tries to find his 5 objects before accusing Arsène Lupin. The player who plays Arsène Lupin tries to find 4 objects, the blue diamond and escape before it happen.

At the beginning, rôle between Arsène Lupin and clients is drawn and stays hidden until the end.
60 hidden objects are place in the hôtel.

The mechanism is very simple, a player throws a dice on each turn and moves in the Hôtel. If his move ends on an object, he look if he belongs, and then take it back in his bedroom. When a player recovers 5 objects, he can accuse Arsène Lupin, if this player is Arsène Lupin, he leaves the hôtel.

88848.description:
All pieces are magnets in a transperant covered plastic maze. On your turn you roll two dice and use a magnetic stick to move your pieces. There are holes with different values for the different players. When a piece is fallen in a hole it will be scored. Game end when one player has only two pieces left.
You can "accidentally" move pieces of other players.

88852.description:
Promotional game for BP Strato Motor Oil.
Roll and move racing game. You can pay extra money to roll more dice (20 for 3 dice, 50 for 4 dice)
Every player tries to get all 3 cars in first. You are out of the game if you cann not pay.
With event cards.

88853.description:
The Spartan Army expansion features over 20 scenarios, which focus on a period of time from 669 BC to 338 BC. In the early battles of Sparta against Argive, we see the development of Hoplite armies. We then move onto the war with the Persian Empire and take a closer look at the battle of Thermopylae, 480 BC. During the Peloponnesian Wars, Sparta takes a leader position among the Peloponnesian states, which would last for almost two centuries. Finally there is a shift in power away from Sparta during the battles of the Theban Era and the rise of Macedon.

The Spartan Army expansion also provides all the blocks and stickers needed to field a Spartan Army and its allies to oppose the armies from Commands & Colors: Ancients - Expansion #1 - Greek vs Eastern Kingdoms. As well as one sheet of 15 new double sided Terrain Tiles.

Rules-wise, if you are familiar with Commands & Colors: Ancients, you'll have no trouble at all learning the special rules for Hoplite infantry, for the basic game mechanics remain unchanged. Battle dice still resolve combat quickly and the Command cards provide an element of luck that creates a fog of war and presents players with both challenges and opportunities for victory.
As with all Commands & Colors: Ancients expansions to date, the tactics you will need to execute with these Hoplite armies will conform remarkably well to the advantages and limitations inherent to these historical units, their weapons, the terrain and history.
